In addition to co-founding the University Foot and Ankle Institute, Dr. Briskin also serves as an assistant clinical professor at the UCLA School of Medicine and is a Diplomat of the American Board of Podiatric Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Foot and Ankle Surgeons. Dr. Bob Baravarian is a board-certified Podiatric Foot and Ankle Specialist. Before co-founding the University Foot and Ankle Institute with Dr. Briskin, Dr. Baravarian spent four years at UCLA and prior to that completed a comprehensive three-year residency at the University of Pittsburgh with an emphasis on sports medicine, reconstructive surgery, foot and ankle trauma and diabetic limb salvage. Dr. Baravarian is also a Diplomat of the American Board of Podiatric Surgery and one of only a handful of foot and ankle surgeons to have both foot and reconstructive rearfoot and ankle certifications as a Fellow of the American College of Foot and Ankle Surgeons. He is currently a member of UCLA Medical Group, Chief of Podiatric Surgery at Santa Monica/UCLA Medical Center and Orthopedic Hospital, and an assistant clinical professor at the UCLA School of Medicine. Dr. Baravarian also serves as Editor Emeritus of the international medical journal, Foot and Ankle Specialist.

story:
Who we are:

We are a group of fitness professionals with a passion for making a healthy lifestyle available to every individual. For years, we have worked with motivated individuals, collegiate and semi-professional athletes as well as injured and special needs clients. Over that time we have established and adhered to a simple principle; given the choice, everyone chooses to be healthier. We believe the keys to helping people realize this goal are just as simple. Remove the most common barriers to success and make choosing a healthy lifestyle easier. The goal of Boot Camp U Health & Wellness is to use innovative partnerships, technology and personalization to help people feel better about themselves and live a happier, healthier lifestyle.

Fitness and Professional backgrounds:

Rahsaan Morgan:

  • B.S Degree in Kinesiology with an emphasis in exercise science, from CSU Fresno
  • 20 years personal training and nutrition experience
  • Work for some of the nation’s largest gyms as a trainer and fitness director
  • Independent trainer (IBO)
  • Has trained: Athletes, obese & morbidly obese, people with injuries, past injuries and post physical therapy patients and kids.

Jeremy Frattini:

  • B.S. Degree in Business with an emphasis in finance, University of Detroit Mercy
  • 15 years personal training and nutrition experience
  • Co-Owner of Last Play Training 
  • Has trained: Athletes, obese & morbidly obese, people with injuries, past injuries and post physical therapy patients and kids.

Why are we creating BOOT CAMP U Health and Wellness

After years of providing high quality personal training for some of the largest gyms in the country, we realized there was one challenge we couldn’t solve in our quest to help people live better. We could only reach the people who reached out to us by joining a gym or client referral. While every success is gratifying, we realized there had to be a better way to reach a broader set of people. The ones with physical, emotional and lifestyle challenges, that prevents them from coming to us for help. With Boot Camp U we will be able to come to them. By removing the barriers to beginning a health and wellness journey; time, money and fea , we will make fitness accessible to a broader group of people than ever before.

Helping us bring fitness to everybody

Our passions are fitness and helping people. Your contributions will create the bridge between us and the people who need our help. By contributing you will help us reach places where traditional fitness can’t, the general public, businesses, schools, and even after-school programs. Our goal is to raise $50,000 to build the IT infrastructure and fund program development for specialized groups such as children, morbidly obese individuals, those suffering from hyper- tension and diabetes to name just a few. As well as helping us to establish industry leading partnerships never before attempted in the fitness industry.  A portion of your contributions will also be used to provide subsidized clinics and support. While we committed to building a cutting-edge fitness company, our focus is on the people we can help. This is a flexible funding model and all funds will be used towards making our shared visions for BOOT CAMP U a reality and no funds will go unused.

What are your perks?

While we hope it is clear that helping us is an easy way to help a number of people to achieve a healthier more productive life. We want to be certain to thank our contributors in a meaningful way. So to thank you for your contribution we have defined a number of perks. They are defined in the list to the right.

Other ways to contribute

If you are unable to contributeyou can still participate and share in our vision of sharing health and wellness by:

  • Spreading the word about our company, our mission and our campaign
  • Following us on Facebook : http://facebook.com/bootcampuhw, bootcampuhw@facebook.com
  • Follow us on Linked In: https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=41814006.
  • You Tube:

 

THANK YOU FOR LOOKING AT OUR CAMPAIGN!!!!

“Graduate To A Better U”

story:
******

         Je dois d'abord dire que je sais qu'il y a pire que ce qui m'est arrivé, et j'ai aussi le coeur brisé lorsque je vois des gens dans la misère, mais il y a des situations malheureuses qui sont faciles à éviter et il faut seulement être avertis!! S'IL-VOUS-PLAÎT, ne faites plus jamais le choix de ne pas contracter une assurance lorsque vous quittez le pays!!!!! Ceci n'est pas une collecte de fonds, c'est une conscientisation!

        Cette page a été créée car des gens près de moi ont proposé un moyen de m'aider, mais je ne demande rien!

        J'ai eu plus de visibilité que je n'en espérais et la manière de faire peut être discutable, mais au moins le message est passé; prenez des assurances voyage, car personne ne voudrait prendre le risque de se blesser à l'extérieur et devoir débourser 27000$ en plus!

        Pour ceux qui aimeraient connaître ce qui s'est passé, je le raconte ci-dessous.

 

 _______________________ French ______________________



Le début de l'aventure ..


Tout a commencé lorsque je tentais un dernier voyage en 2012-2013. Comme mon budget ne permettait pas un voyage dispendieux, j'ai pu acheter mon billet via le partenariat d'une amie qui travaille pour une compagnie aérienne. Étant donné que je voyageais stand-by, sans siège attribué et courant de gate en gate pour partir n'importe où dans le monde ou presque, ca a été le plus beau moment de ma vie de me faire attribuer un siège après 2 jours d'attente dans les aéroports! Des larmes de joie coulaient sur mes joues et même si nous avons attendu encore une heure ou deux avant de décoller du au dégivrage de l'avion, je n'avais plus aucune raison de m'inquiéter! Je partais enfin pour la Californie! Mais durant le voyage ..

Mon accident

Le jour où je devais quitter San Diego pour me diriger vers Los Angeles, les personnes qui m'hébergeaient sont partis travailler en ne pensant pas que j'étais à l'extérieur de l'appartement. Ils ont donc barré la porte en sortant, et j'étais prise dehors sans ressources! Puisque nous avions ouvert une fenêtre quelques jours auparavant pour entrer et que j'avais replacé cette même fenêtre, c'est la première idée qui m'est venue en tête. J'ai donc soulevé la fenêtre à l'aide des pentures, et malheureusement, j'ai dû trouver un point faible car celle-ci a éclaté..

Voyant mes os à travers trois de mes doigts, j'ai paniqué .. à ce moment précis, j'étais seul au monde, n'ayant pas de preuve d'identité sur moi, pas de téléphone, personne. Le monde a semblé vide pendant plusieurs longues secondes. Mes doigts ont commencé à saigner, et je ne savais pas combien de temps je tiendrais avant de m'évanouir. Je me suis rendue chez les voisins le plus rapidement possible et heureusement, malgré que mon sang tombait partout sur leur tapis, ils ont répondu et ont accepté de m'aider. J'ai fait pression sur mes doigts avec un essuie-tout propre et ai levé ma main au dessus de mon cœur pour arrêter le saignement .. quand les premiers secours et l'ambulance sont arrivés, j'ai réalisé que mon cerveau ne connectait plus à mes doigts, et j'avais l'impression qu'ils tomberaient si je les tenais pas en place. Mes tendons ainsi que mes nerfs étaient sectionnés ..

Après les heures d'attente et de traitements hospitaliers, j'ai subit une chirurgie plastique reconstructive sur ma main afin de rattacher les tendons et les nerfs à mes doigts. J'ai passé une seule journée à l'hôpital, probablement puisque je les suppliais de me laisser partir le plus tôt possible car je n'avais aucun moyen de contacter qui que ce soit et mon amie m'attendait à un point de rencontre à Los Angeles. Cette amie est la sœur cadette de mon ex petit ami qui s'est suicidé en Mars 2012, et c'était la première fois que je la revoyais depuis tous les événements malheureux de l'année dernière. Je n'avais vraiment pas envie de la laisser à elle-même dans un monde inconnu. Je me suis sentie terriblement coupable toute la journée .. elle avait fait 20 heures d'autobus et de train pour me rejoindre ... Terrible pour moi de ne pas être au point de rendez-vous, mais surtout de ne pas être en mesure de lui communiquer ce qui se passait!

 

Ce que je vis présentement


L'hôpital de San Diego ne m'a pas donné beaucoup d'information sur ce qui m'arriverait suite à la chirurgie. Je suis donc revenue à Québec, et devait me présenter à l'hôpital tous les jours au début, puis encore plusieurs fois par semaine jusqu'à présent. Je suis suivie en chirurgie plastique spécialisée, ainsi qu'en ergothérapie, ou je réapprend tranquillement à utiliser ma main. Un mois après l'accident, je n'arrive toujours pas à  plier mes doigts le moindrement ni à les redresser complètement. Je fais des exercices qui prennent environ 1 heure à compléter, toutes les heures, donc continuellement .. toute la journée. J'ai perdu tous les muscles du bras et de la main gauche, du poignet et des doigts, et mon bras est maintenant la moitié de sa taille normale. Suite au port de deux plâtres, je porte maintenant une orthèse, en tout temps, qui est irritante pour ma peau qui elle meurt et pleume de partout. Je suis incapable de trouver un emploi en raison du temps que je dois consacrer aux exercices d'ergothérapie .. qui me prennent en moyenne 7 heures par jour.. et quel travail pourrais-je faire aussi bien que quelqu'un qui a ses deux mains?! J'arrive déjà difficilement à m'habiller! Taper sur un clavier prend également beaucoup de temps et de patience, mais je refuse d'abandonner!



Aujourd'hui, j'ai reçu de mauvaises nouvelles. Mes tendons se sont soudées à ma chair à l'intérieur de mes doigts .. et il est probablement trop tard pour être en mesure de plier la dernière phalange de deux d'entre eux un jour. Je garde espoir, mais je suis sortie de l'hôpital le coeur gros .. Je ferai tout mon possible pour qu'ils reviennent à la normale, mais ils sont assez enflés et je ne sens aucune force .. En fait, je ne ressens rien du tout peu importe ou je touche mon majeur et mon annulaire. Mais je n'abandonne pas, je garde espoir!

 

Le prix de ma main


Il y a quelques jours, j'ai reçu ma deuxième facture .. (la première étant 52,86 $ pour les radiographies) .. qui revient à 27 135,60 $ US, que je dois payer avant le 21 Février, sinon des intérêts seront ajoutés au montant. Ma carte de crédit est pleine, et ne pouvait encaisser que 5000 $ du total de toute manière. J'ai également 18000 $ à rembourser pour mes prêts d'études universitaires. Cependant, je ne serai pas en mesure de travailler avant encore 3 à 6 mois, dépendant de la progression de ma réadaptation.

J'ai dû dire adieux à toutes mes activités de vie .. escalade, boxe, travail sur le terrain, rénovation, cheerleading, etc. Tout est dangereux parce que les cicatrices à l'intérieur de ma main pourrait rouvrir s'il m'arrivait de faire un mauvais mouvement. Je possède encore ma petite entreprise, mais je ne suis pas en mesure de prendre autant de contrats dont j'aurais besoin pour regagner ma vie.

Comment m'aider


Tout montant que vous pouvez donner, même 1 dollar, me rendrait tellement heureuse que des gens comme vous existent :) Je serais éternellement reconnaissante s'il y a des gens qui pouvaient m'aider à rembourser le prix de ma main, à racheter ma vie! Les gens qui m'entourent savent que je serai toujours la première à faire tout ce que peux pour aider chaque personne qui a besoin de moi, sans jamais rien attendre en retour, parce que ma principale raison de vivre est de rendre ceux que j'aime heureux!

Je vous donne à tous le plus gros câlin ever!! Merci d'être la pour moii xxxxx

 

 ______________________ English ______________________

 

Here below is how it all happened..

 

The beggining..

Everything started while I was traveling for the last time in 2012-2013. As my budget did not allow an expansive trip, I was put on my friend's partnership on a flights company. Traveling stand-by, it was the luckiest time of my life to be given a seat after 2 wait days in airports. Tears of joy fell off my cheeks as we waited another hour or two for plane deicing, I so didn't care! I was finally making it to California!! But before coming back..

 

My accident

The day I was moving from San Diego to Los Angeles, I got locked out the apartment where two new friends were allowing me to stay. They left for work in the morning, and forgot I was doing laundry outside. As we had opened a window only two days before to get into the apartment, it was the first idea that came through my mind; to reopen the same window that I had put back into place myself earlier. I lifted the window, pushing it upwards from the frame, and sadly.... I guess I just found a week spot.... the window collapsed..

Seeing my bones through three of my fingers, I panicked.. I was alone in the world at that moment, having no identity proof with me, no phone, no one. It started bleeding, and so I didn't know how much time I had left before fainting. I walked as fast as I could and knocked at the neighbours door, and after dropping blood all over their carpet :(, I wrapped my fingers in a clean paper towel and put pressure to stop the bleeding.. when first aid and ambulance arrived, I realized that my brain was no more connected to my fingers, and I felt just like if they would fall if I let go of them. My tendons and nerves were cut..

After all the hospital processing and wait, I had plastic reconstructive surgery on my hand so they would reattach tendons and nerves to my fingers. I have spent only one day at the hospital, it propably helped that I begged for them to let me go because I really had no way to contact anyone and my friend was waiting for me to join her in LA. She is the younger sister of my ex boyfriend who had committed suicide in March 2012, and it was the first time I was reuniting with her after all that happened last year, so I really didn't want to leave her in an unknown world by herself. I felt so awful all day long.. she was traveling 20 bus and train hours to meet me... AWFUL for me not to be there, not to be able to tell her what was happening!!!

 

What I'm going through now

The hospital did not give me much information about what I would have to go through after surgery. So I traveled back to Quebec, and had appointments almost every day at first, then still several times a week up until now. I am followed by a hand plastic surgeon, and by ergotherapists who are helping me relearn how to use my hand. A month after the accident, I am still not able to fold my fingers or to straighten them. I am doing exercices that take 1 hour to complete, every hour, so mostly.. all day long. I have lost all muscles in my hand, wrist and whole arm, which is now half the size of the other and very week. After two plasters, I am wearing a brace that I can never take off, and which is iriting my skin, that is already dying and pealing off my whole arm. I am unable to find a job or work because of the time I need to spend on exercices.. 7 hours a day.. and what job can I do as good as anyone else with only one hand? I am not even able to get dressed properly by myself! Typing is also taking so much time and mind effort, but I refuse to give up!

 

Today, I've learned bad news. My tendons have welded themselves to the flesh inside my fingers.. and it is probably too late for me to be able to fold the last joint of two of my fingers someday. I keep hope, but walked out of the hospital very sad.. I do everything I can so they come back to normal, but they are now so swollen and I feel no strenght in them.. I actually feel nothing at all wherever I touch them. But I am not giving up, I am faithful!!!

 

The price of my hand

A few days ago, I recieved my second bill.. (the first one being 52,86$ for XRAYS) ..which comes up to 27 135,60$ US, which I have to pay before February 21st, or else they will charge interest. My credit card is full, and could only take 5000$ of that amount anyways. I also have to pay 18000$ for my university studies. Fact is, I won't be able to work before another 3 to 6 months, depending on how readaptation is going.

I've lost all my life activities.. climbing, boxing, working on field, doing renovation, cheerleading, etc, everything is dangerous because the scars inside my hand could reopen if I happen to make a bad move. I still own a small event staff company, but am not able to take as many contracts as I would need to win my life back. 

 

How you can help

Any amount you can give, strarting from even 1 dollar, would make me so grateful that people like you exist :) I would be forever thankful if some people would help me repay my life back and repay the price of my hand.. and everyone around me knows that I would help all the people I admire as much as I can while never expecting anything in return, because the only reason for me to stay alive is to make the ones I love happy!!

If ever we can't make it, I'll keep on working hard on my side to repay the bill until I collect enough money!! The last solution is bankruptcy.. but it would still be so expensive, and would stick onto me all my life.. so I wish I don't have to go there.

I send to you all the greatest hug ever, leave your email address and I'll send you a special THANK YOU!!! <3 <3 <3

(la première étant 52,86 $ pour les radiographies) .. qui revient à 27 135,60 $ US, que je dois payer avant le 21 Février, sinon des intérêts seront ajoutés au montant. Ma carte de crédit est pleine, et ne pouvait encaisser que 5000 $ du total de toute manière. J'ai également 18000 $ à rembourser pour mes prêts d'études universitaires. Cependant, je ne serai pas en mesure de travailler avant encore 3 à 6 mois, dépendant de la progression de ma réadaptation.J'ai dû dire adieux à toutes mes activités de vie .. escalade, boxe, travail sur le terrain, rénovation, cheerleading, etc. Tout est dangereux parce que les cicatrices à l'intérieur de ma main pourrait rouvrir s'il m'arrivait de faire un mauvais mouvement. Je possède encore ma petite entreprise, mais je ne suis pas en mesure de prendre autant de contrats dont j'aurais besoin pour regagner ma vie.
Comment m'aider
Tout montant que vous pouvez donner, même 1 dollar, me rendrait tellement heureuse que des gens comme vous existent :) Je serais éternellement reconnaissante s'il y a des gens qui pouvaient m'aider à rembourser le prix de ma main, à racheter ma vie! Les gens qui m'entourent savent que je serai toujours la première à faire tout ce que peux pour aider chaque personne qui a besoin de moi, sans jamais rien attendre en retour, parce que ma principale raison de vivre est de rendre ceux que j'aime heureux!Je vous donne à tous le plus gros câlin ever!! Merci d'être la pour moii xxxxx
 
 ______________________ English ______________________
 
Here below is how it all happened..
 
The beggining..
Everything started while I was traveling for the last time in 2012-2013. As my budget did not allow an expansive trip, I was put on my friend's partnership on a flights company. Traveling stand-by, it was the luckiest time of my life to be given a seat after 2 wait days in airports. Tears of joy fell off my cheeks as we waited another hour or two for plane deicing, I so didn't care! I was finally making it to California!! But before coming back..


 
My accident
The day I was moving from San Diego to Los Angeles, I got locked out the apartment where two new friends were allowing me to stay. They left for work in the morning, and forgot I was doing laundry outside. As we had opened a window only two days before to get into the apartment, it was the first idea that came through my mind; to reopen the same window that I had put back into place myself earlier. I lifted the window, pushing it upwards from the frame, and sadly.... I guess I just found a week spot.... the window collapsed..
Seeing my bones through three of my fingers, I panicked.. I was alone in the world at that moment, having no identity proof with me, no phone, no one. It started bleeding, and so I didn't know how much time I had left before fainting. I walked as fast as I could and knocked at the neighbours door, and after dropping blood all over their carpet :(, I wrapped my fingers in a clean paper towel and put pressure to stop the bleeding.. when first aid and ambulance arrived, I realized that my brain was no more connected to my fingers, and I felt just like if they would fall if I let go of them. My tendons and nerves were cut..
After all the hospital processing and wait, I had plastic reconstructive surgery on my hand so they would reattach tendons and nerves to my fingers. I have spent only one day at the hospital, it propably helped that I begged for them to let me go because I really had no way to contact anyone and my friend was waiting for me to join her in LA. She is the younger sister of my ex boyfriend who had committed suicide in March 2012, and it was the first time I was reuniting with her after all that happened last year, so I really didn't want to leave her in an unknown world by herself. I felt so awful all day long.. she was traveling 20 bus and train hours to meet me... AWFUL for me not to be there, not to be able to tell her what was happening!!!
 
What I'm going through now
The hospital did not give me much information about what I would have to go through after surgery. So I traveled back to Quebec, and had appointments almost every day at first, then still several times a week up until now. I am followed by a hand plastic surgeon, and by ergotherapists who are helping me relearn how to use my hand. A month after the accident, I am still not able to fold my fingers or to straighten them. I am doing exercices that take 1 hour to complete, every hour, so mostly.. all day long. I have lost all muscles in my hand, wrist and whole arm, which is now half the size of the other and very week. After two plasters, I am wearing a brace that I can never take off, and which is iriting my skin, that is already dying and pealing off my whole arm. I am unable to find a job or work because of the time I need to spend on exercices.. 7 hours a day.. and what job can I do as good as anyone else with only one hand? I am not even able to get dressed properly by myself! Typing is also taking so much time and mind effort, but I refuse to give up!
 
Today, I've learned bad news. My tendons have welded themselves to the flesh inside my fingers.. and it is probably too late for me to be able to fold the last joint of two of my fingers someday. I keep hope, but walked out of the hospital very sad.. I do everything I can so they come back to normal, but they are now so swollen and I feel no strenght in them.. I actually feel nothing at all wherever I touch them. But I am not giving up, I am faithful!!!
 
The price of my hand
A few days ago, I recieved my second bill.. (the first one being 52,86$ for XRAYS) ..which comes up to 27 135,60$ US, which I have to pay before February 21st, or else they will charge interest. My credit card is full, and could only take 5000$ of that amount anyways. I also have to pay 18000$ for my university studies. Fact is, I won't be able to work before another 3 to 6 months, depending on how readaptation is going.
I've lost all my life activities.. climbing, boxing, working on field, doing renovation, cheerleading, etc, everything is dangerous because the scars inside my hand could reopen if I happen to make a bad move. I still own a small event staff company, but am not able to take as many contracts as I would need to win my life back. 
 
How you can help
Any amount you can give, strarting from even 1 dollar, would make me so grateful that people like you exist :) I would be forever thankful if some people would help me repay my life back and repay the price of my hand.. and everyone around me knows that I would help all the people I admire as much as I can while never expecting anything in return, because the only reason for me to stay alive is to make the ones I love happy!!
If ever we can't make it, I'll keep on working hard on my side to repay the bill until I collect enough money!! The last solution is bankruptcy.. but it would still be so expensive, and would stick onto me all my life.. so I wish I don't have to go there.
I send to you all the greatest hug ever, leave your email address and I'll send you a special THANK YOU!!! <3 <3 <3

story:
Bold, Beautiful Shirts

Be an inspirer! Give a voice to the needy with one of these colorful new shirts.

Text below Speak Up logo: Speak up for those who can't speak for themselves, defend the rights of the poor and needy

Many Options

  • Two fit/brand options: fitted T made by Canvas or a casual cut from Anvil
  • Up to XXXL
  • Four color choices: Teal, Violet, Orange, Red

When the campaign is finished, we'll send you an email to find out exactly what options you'd like for each shirt.

What Speak Up Does

Speak Up Magazine is a nonprofit street magazine based in Charlotte, NC, that gives a voice to voiceless people and creates an income opportunity for individuals battling to stay off the streets.

Vulnerably-housed Speak Up vendors sell the magazine for $4 and buy additional copies for $1, which allows them to become self-sustaining micro-enterprises.

story:
The walls that almost killed me

When I was 20, they used to call me the tornado or the volcano as I was always full of energy and always laughing. Today, I still love to laugh, but my life has become so small because of my illness, that i barely have any social life at all...My condition is critical

I was exposed to mold for 13 years without knowing, as it was hidden between the walls of my bedroom. Since then, I suffer from some 40 chronic and debilitating symptoms that make my life a living hell. Mold attacks the nervous, hormonal, digestive, musculo-skeletal and immunitary systems. Mostly, I'm severely intolerant to all foods, and it takes me $1,300 worth of supplements every month in order to eat a few foods. Some of the symptoms are respiratory distress, pain, a noxious feeling, severe intestinal disorders, itching, and I also lose lots of hair, everyday from malabsorption, and have scalp burning symptom.

Mold disease is not recognized in Quebec, but it is in Ontario and the States where there are appropriate treatments.

In the last 13 years of my life, the cost of my survival has been an unskalable burden. I've spent at least $200,000 to relieve me from symptoms, and I'm now in great debt. Today, this kind of survival is senseless and my life has become too small.

By contributing to this campaign, you are helping me to recover from this disease, and to give me my life back. I could finally contribute to society, as I am a skillful woman.

What I Need & What You Get

According to the Environmental Health Association of Quebec, I need $30,000 to go through a protocol of treatments that would make me recover from my disease. The cost will go to the doctors consultation and treatments, plus travel and special accomodations, as I need a safe place because of my sensitivities. I would like to meet Dr Shoemaker or Dr. William Rea. You can visit their websites at: http://www.survivingmold.com/ and http://www.ehcd.com/

My gift to you will be my neverending gratitude, and I will be posting videos on the progress of my healing process. I will also send you great karma! And if ever I'm totally healed and able to dance again (I was a professional dancer) I'll make a video of my dance and send it to you!

If I don't reach my goal, I will still be needing money for my supplementation in order to survive. So I will still be immensefully thankful.

Please share this page

Please get the word out and make noise of this campaign! If you can't donate, send the link to your friends and use the Indiegogo share tools!

MANY THANKS! xox♥♥♥

A few pictures of Sonia

Here are a few pictures of me, before the illness hit me strong. I was already ill, but was fighting thanks to dancing.

story:
http://www.torontosun.com/2012/08/23/friends-family-on-way-to-bringing-leibenko-home

During the month of August Anna was traveling with a group of friends in Europe.

On August 17, 2012, she was on a board of “Adriatic Queen” catamaran in Croatian water. Unfortunately, Anna accidentally slipped off of a 3 meters high catamaran and hit her head on the ledge and fell into the ocean. She went unconscious instantly.

Anna was delivered in an unconscious state by the helicopter to the casualty department of the brain neurosurgery hospital in Split, Croatia.

Currently Anna is in a coma with internal brain bleeding and numerous head and face fractures.

She hooked up to a life support machine and is in critical condition.

Unfortunately, Anna didn’t have travel insurance and her family and friends do not have the financial capacity to cover the massive costs of treatment in Europe and transportation by Air Ambulance from Croatia to Toronto.

Anna must remain in the hospital for seven to ten days in a state of total tranquility in order not to develop any air pockets in the brain. After that, if her condition will improve, she has to be transferred to the department of Neurosurgery into Toronto hospital facilities.

The price for the Air Ambulance Worldwide is $ 93,550.00 USD, that must be paid as soon as possible to secure the transportation, without this Anna will not be able to travel back safely and it may cause her life.

The price for the treatment in Croatian hospital is not fixed yet.

PLEASE, HELP SAVE ANNA’S LIFE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

WITHOUT YOUR HELP SHE WILL NOT MAKE IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

IMAGINE, THAT SHE IS YOUR SISTER, YOUR DAUGHTER, YOUR FRIEND!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

WITH A LITTLE HELP FROM EACH OF US SHE WILL MAKE IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Please find it in your heart to help save the life of a girl which just began.

Thank you all so much for taking the time to read this and for your generosity to help save the life of a young girl.

story:
Our Story

We are raising funds over the next 5 weeks to buy as many useful loving gifts as we can for  as many kids in as many shelters/orphanages (worldwide) as possible!


 We want to show the Kids that there are people all over the world that love them.

We want to let them know that even in the darkest times.. dreams can come true.

The Impact

All we want to do is spread love and hope.

 DCT is a baby non profit concept.

 D-Dreams, C-Come, T- True. 


We hope to bring love, inspiration, hope, guidance and support to as many brothers and sisters and possible. 

We want to unite and find strength together, as a family.


The Children are our future! 


We feel that as a first project it would be powerful to focus on that.



BE THE CHANGE YOU WISH TO SEE IN THIS WORLD!!! 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $5,000 BUT the more we make, the further we go, we have team mates in Jamaica, Africa, Canada, America, Japan + 
We welcome suggestions as to orphanages / shelters that you would like to reach out to, this mission is a never ending journey and we will never stop giving and loving for peace. (fighting for peace just seems to contradictory)


Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD! SHARE THE LINKS, VIDEOS, FLYERS ETC! MESSAGE US! ASK QUESTIONS! LOVE ! AND HAVE FAITH !


The images and videos will continue to be updated as we progress so stay tuned!

Here we go!

D.C.T

THANK YOU!!!!!

story:
I love my husband more than words can describe. He is my best friend and I can talk to him about absolutely everything. We are exactly one week shy of our one year wedding anniversary today and we want more than anything to have a baby together.

My husband will be 39 in a few short weeks and I just turned 27 this year. My husband has three teenage children from a previous marriage and he had a vasectomy after his youngest was born, when he was 25. I have a 5 year old from a previous relationship. We would love more than anything to bring our two families together and have a baby.

Last August, we attempted a cycle of IVF but it was unsuccessful. We gave my body a rest and tried again in November and since this would be the last cycle we could afford we gave it our best shot and did everything to the tee. Rest, acupuncture, and lots of hope. It was a success! We found out just before Christmas that out dreams were coming true! All the pain and struggle has been worth it. I was pregnant! My son would be a big brother, which is what he said he wants to be when he grows up! As I neared the end of the first trimester I was finally starting to feel better as far as the pregnancy symptoms go. I was 14 weeks on my birthday, February 20 and I experienced some light spotting. I called my midwife nurse and we concluded that it wasn't serious because it was not a lot of spotting. At 12:03am the next day, I woke up screaming in pain and gushing blood. I knew what was happening and I was horrified! I had lost my baby on my birthday, and spent the entire next day sitting in a hospital room crying with my husband. Our dream had been shattered. We do not have the funds for another round of IVF and frankly, the whole experience has scared us from pursuing fertility treatments again, even if it were free.

We had considered a vasectomy reversal in the past but we were told the chances of success were very low given the age of my husband's vasectomy. Ever since this unfortunate loss of ours I have been having ahard time accepting that we have to just give up, so I again began researching a reversal in the hopes that we can find a way to make this happen, or at least try everything we possibly can.

I came across the website of a doctor in Oklahoma who performs reversals for a very low cost and he has a good success rate, even for vasectomies that are over 12 years old. It's certainly not a guarentee, but the risk is worth it to us.

The reason we are setting up this wonderful fundraiser is because we literally put everything we had into the unsuccessful IVF procedures. We spent quite a bit of money trying for this baby as well as a great deal of pain and stress and it ended in heart ache. We would love nothing more than to have a baby together and we feel that a reversal with this amazing doctor could be the answer!

The cost of the vasectomy reversal with this doctor is $1700 and that is his entire fee. The additional costs are for plane ticket(s) and lodging while we (or just my husband depending on funding) are in Oklahoma as we live in Upstate New York.

Please cosnider helping us with our journey! We can schedule the procedure as soon as we get the funds gathered. Thank you so much for hearing our story.

story:
The Project

Pebble watch is really cool and the perfect companion for your sport activities.

As we are convinced that personal style and fashion are going to play an important role in smartwatch accessories, we started to focus on experimentation and trends.

After this process, we have created a stylish product which is relevant to the needs of the Pebble bands and sports markets.
It is a great accessory to make your Pebble stand out and match it with your sport activities: Training Wristbands for Pebble watch.

Training Wristbands make your Pebble look cooler and more comfortable for all kind of fitness and sports: running, basketball, tennis, skateboarding…or just your big night out.
This is a product uniquely designed for people that want to customise their Pebble watch for their sport activity. It fits your Pebble band easily, what means that you do not need to replace your band as it will be discreetly hidden behind the training wristband.

You will enjoy the experience every time you wear your Pebble with our training wristbands
Now your Pebble is much more customisable with a bunch of fresh and colourful training wristbands with new variants in the future!


Training Wristbands for Pebble watch details and benefits:

  • Custom built for a soft and snug fit with Pebble watch.
  • Available in black, blue, red and white.
  • Great absorbency to help keep sweat away from the skin during workouts, competitions, etc.
  • Soft and stretchy fabric made from a cotton/polyester/elastic terry cloth blend.
  • Machine wash.

What We Need: Show Us Your Love

The team behind this project has extensive experience on the design of fashion accessories and the development of applications for smartwatches:
Go to our smartwatch apps in Google Play
Including and Android music player for Pebble watch:
Go to our music player for Pebble watch in Google Play

We are asking only money to complete the expenses of the acquisition of materials, production, logistics and the launch of and Android/iPhone application where to sell our accessories for Pebble watch

What You Get

Every contribution helps and you are rewarded.
If you want to be part of the movement to make the Training Wristbands for Pebble watch the ultimate sport accessory for your Pebble, you can collaborate in different ways: You can become one of our project supporters and get a discount coupon code in the case you want to purchase the Training Wristbands for Pebble watch in the future and receive our newsletter with updates.
Do you want more?You can get one of our packs available: BLACK, BLUE, RED and WHITE.

What you get with each one of the packs:

  • One pair of Training Wristbands for Pebble watch.
  • One Lanyard.
  • One $5 discount coupon code if you want to purchase an extra pair of Training Wristbands for Pebble watch in the future.
  • You will receive our newsletter with updates.

We promise timely and transparent communication throughout the process.
Soon our Training Wristbands for Pebble watch will be in the wrist of people enjoying of sports activities like never before!
If you wish to get in touch with us, you can contact us at hello@disrapptive.com

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help.

Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Tweet, Facebook, text or email your friends and Pebble lovers!
Tell them about this project. It is only possible with your help.

We really appreciate your interest, support and enthusiasm.
Thank you!

Including and Android music player for Pebble watch:
Go to our music player for Pebble watch in Google Play
We are asking only money to complete the expenses of the acquisition of materials, production, logistics and the launch of and Android/iPhone application where to sell our accessories for Pebble watch
What You Get

Every contribution helps and you are rewarded. 
If you want to be part of the movement to make the Training Wristbands for Pebble watch the ultimate sport accessory for your Pebble, you can collaborate in different ways:
You can become one of our project supporters and get a discount coupon code in the case you want to purchase the Training Wristbands for Pebble watch in the future and receive our newsletter with updates.
Do you want more?You can get one of our packs available: BLACK, BLUE, RED and WHITE.
What you get with each one of the packs:


One pair of Training Wristbands for Pebble watch.

One Lanyard.
One $5 discount coupon code if you want to purchase an extra pair of Training Wristbands for Pebble watch in the future.
You will receive our newsletter with updates.

We promise timely and transparent communication throughout the process.
Soon our Training Wristbands for Pebble watch will be in the wrist of people enjoying of sports activities like never before!
If you wish to get in touch with us, you can contact us at hello@disrapptive.com

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help.
Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Tweet, Facebook, text or email your friends and Pebble lovers!
Tell them about this project. It is only possible with your help.
We really appreciate your interest, support and enthusiasm.
Thank you!

story:
Hello all,

I am setting up this fundraiser on behalf of a good friend of mine, Josh Campbell. He is also my twin sister, Anita's, loving boyfriend.  Josh was severally injured when he was 16, and his been wheelchair bound for 18 years. He is an incomplete C6-C7 quadriplegic, which means he has almost all feeling and usage from the chest and above. He has been wheelchair bound since the age of 16. Josh is an incredibly giving man, who has devoted much of his adult life to teaching and tutoring students in all areas of the sciences, as he has graduated from UCLA with a degree in microbiology, immunology, and molecular genetics. 

In the last few years, his health has been on the decline.  The health decline has affected his level of Independence as well as his ability to work, which, in turn has taken a major financial toll on both him and my sister.  Reoccurring pressure sores on his body from years of sitting are a major source of his health problems.  An important solution to his pressure sore problem will be to have an electric wheelchair as opposed to a manual chair that is propelled by his arms.  Shearing forces from his body pushing the manual chair makes the pressure sores open wider and grow deeper. Basically; moving his arms, shoulders, and back cause his hips and butt to move back and forth in the chair, continuously opening the wounds. He often has pain in his shoulders and back region from all the pushing as well. They say it's like constantly doing push ups. This past May, Josh was bed ridden due to infection in one of his sores, and missed 3 months of teaching summer school classes.  Months without income caused all kinds of detrimental affects to this sweet couple, including several late and missed payments on important bills, and the unfortunate need to move out of their apartment. The sores have not disappeared and their is a constant threat of infection.  If they remain open they can get to a stage where they need surgery to help heal them, or worse, they could end up staying open forever. To say the least, they cause tremendous pain, and discomfort, and eventually could be life threatening.  The hopes is that having this electric chair will keep Josh out of bed, out of severe pain, allow his body to heal, and allow him to do what he loves, teach children chemistry/biology/physics/astronomy/math.  Josh is a much loved teacher, and truly missed when he can't be at school.

After much research, the quality chair that he has picked out is called a Quickie P-220 Power Wheelchair. To get a used version of it often costs more than $2,000. Here is a link to give you an example of what they look like:

http://www.marcsmobility.com/quickie-p220-power-wheelchair-used-power-chairs.html

Please feel free to research this brand and see how much more a new chair costs compared to the used chair we are looking to purchase.

The donation that you make will go directly to cover the cost of the chair.  We would like Josh to be moving in the chair as quickly as possible to give his sores a chance to heal, and to decrease his likelihood of further health complications and pain as well as missing anymore work.

If you are unable to contribute at this time, we understand! If you'd like, send healing thoughts to Josh, they always help! And if you can only spare a couple of dollars, there is no limitation to how quickly money can add up.  On behalf of both Josh and Anita, we thank you for taking the time to read this.  Also, feel free to pass this information on via any networking means you feel comfortable with.

A warm thank you to all,

Angela Bemi

story:
THE CAMPAIGN CONTINUES>>> See Part 2!

Fundraising isn't over-- keep supporting the campaign at www.igg.me/at/kb4MJFF

About Me

I am an engineer-turned-MBA who was looking to cap off an incredible experience in graduate school with something similarly amazing.  Imagine my excitement when I found out I had been selected to compete in The Adventurists' Mongol Derby 2014.  At a self-guided 1000km around outer Mongolia, the Derby is hailed as "the world's toughest horse race."  It's not all fun and games, though-- the race is also a fundraiser.  In addition to supporting the Mongolian-focused Onom Foundation, I'm fundraising for the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research.  This is where you come in.

My Goal

I'm aiming to raise $1000 for MJFF for a few key reasons:

  • Years ago, through a teammate, I learned about the MJFF and was impressed enough by its impact that I became a supporter;
  • This fall, the cause became very personal for me as a close family member was diagnosed with early-stage PD.

The Michael J. Fox Foundation's Mission

MJFF's mission is "a single, urgent goal: to eradicate Parkinson's Disease in our lifetime."  Today, it is the largest nonprofit funder of Parkinson's research worldwide.  Last year, MJFF funded over $400M of research, with 0.89 of every dollar going to support research programs.  Thanks to its funding, researchers this year developed a drug to reduce cognitive impairment for PD patients.

Ways You Can Help

There's more than one way to meet a goal!

  • If you can, please give-- any amount helps, even $10.
  • If you can't give, you can still help by getting the word out-- use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU for your support.

story:
We reached our goal! Lots of great people helped make it happen! Thank you thank you! 

We all love being outdoors!
We all need to get enough sun for Vitamin D!
We all need to make sure we don’t get too much sun!

It’s all possible with UVA+B SunFriend®; a new gadget for personal safer daily UV consumption!

Did you know? When you slather on sunscreen, you prevent beneficial ultraviolet B from penetrating the skin, which is what your body needs to make vitamin D! The same goes when you cover up completely! And vitamin D deficiency is at a pandemic level around the world!

On top of that, if you are in the United States, according to the Skin Cancer Foundation, 1 in 5 of us will get skin cancer – despite the increase use of sunscreens! The skin cancer incidents are even higher in Australia!

One solution is to get “Safer Sun Time”! That is why we set out to make a fun, cool, wearable gadget, that tells you when you have had enough sun! You set it to your personal skin color and sensitivity, and it constantly reads any UV you are exposed to – from the sun, reflected from the water, under clouds, through glass! When all your LED indicators have lit up, you have had your safer dose of sun for the day! And SunFriend is waterproof, so you can wear it while you are swimming on the beach!

We designed the SunFriend to help people optimize their vitamin D and reduce the incidence of skin cancer simultaneously.

The UVA+B SunFriend®; designed to be the world’s best personal activity monitor for daily UV exposure!

Is there anything more enjoyable than spending time outdoors on a sunny day? 

These folks are all wearing the new UVA+B SunFriend© with our patented, cutting-edge UV activity technology to help them make the most of their time in the sun. There is a fine line between overexposure, which can lead to skin cancer and sun damage, and underexposure, which can result in vitamin D deficiencies. With our trendy, user-friendly gadget that was inspired by small, powerful UV sensors inspired by NASA, you can safely and confidently enjoy all of your favorite outdoor activities!

Available in early 2014! Get your own SunFriend® by making a contribution today!

The UVA+B SunFriend is the newest gadget to hit the world for self-empowering people to take charge of their own health! After you set your own personal sensitivity level to match your specific skin type and color, and the rest of the work is done as you wear it! A super sensitive UV sensor keeps track of all the UV you encounter - from the sun above, bouncing off the water or snow, and even what you get indoors from lights and through windows. It's taking readings constantly to ensure accuracy, and takes into consideration whether a cloud has gone overhead or you are indoors or outdoors. Our technology is based on internationally recognized scientific research to accurately measure daily UVA and UVB exposure. 

Inventors Shahid Aslam and Karin Edgett shown here at the 2011 Create the Future contest run by NASA TechBriefs. UVA+B SunFriend won Best Consumer Product and Most Popular Vote prizes.

Our team quickly expanded to include passionate engineers, scientists and marketers from all over the country to take us all the way to completed working and tested prototypes. We have spent nearly three years designing and perfecting SunFriend prototypes and have thoroughly tested the technology and product design. Our Mission: Provide the world with fun, effective and affordable new gadgets for Safer Sun Time©.

Learn More from Our Team

 Shahid Aslam Video

 Karin Edgett Video

 Siddharth Potbhare Video

 Stefan Giroux Video

Who Will Benefit from the UVA+B SunFriend Activity Monitor?

Anyone who is concerned about their health! SunFriend works to help you optimize Vitamin D levels naturally from the sun which is at pandemic low levels around the world! It also helps you prevent damage from over-exposure, helping to curb a crisis of skin cancer in countries like USA and Australia. And, practically anyone who loves spending time outdoors! 

UVA+B SunFriend© is waterproof, lightweight and will be available in a variety of colors and designs. Beach goers, outdoor sports enthusiasts such as golfers, cyclists, runner and boaters, parents, people with outdoor occupations, and people with vitamin D deficiencies (just to name a few!) are all folks who will benefit from knowing when you have had enough UVA and UVB for the day!

Why Do We Need Your Support?

  • We need to spread the word! We need to educate consumers about a new tool for Safer Sun Time™.
  • We need to develop strong retailer programs and partnerships around the world.
  • We need to create a dynamic retail website
  • We need to develop the next generation SunFriends®
  • We need to launch our new mobile app

Our thank you gift for supporting us is a frisbee to use with your new UVA+B SunFriend! 

Thank you for your support to help us launch a new tool for Safer Sun Time©!  

Compelling reasons to monitor your daily UV exposure: 

  • 1 in 5 people in the USA will get skin cancer (60 Million People)
  • About 90% of non-melanoma skin cancers are associated with exposure to ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun
  • Skin cancer is the most common form of cancer in the USA
  • According to the World Health Organization “one in every three cancers diagnosed worldwide is a skin cancer.” 

Interesting facts about Optimizing your Vitamin D levels: 

  • Vitamin D deficiency is now recognized as a pandemic. The major cause of vitamin D deficiency is the lack of appreciation that sun exposure in moderation is the major source of vitamin D for most humans. 

    http://ajcn.nutrition.org/content/87/4/1080S.full


  • ...According to research presented at the 25th annual meeting of the Associated Professional Sleep Societies, patients with daytime sleepiness and musculoskeletal pain are likely to have vitamin D insufficiency or deficiency...
  • An excerpt from the Lancet... Studies show melanoma mortality actually decreases after UV exposure. Additionally, melanoma lesions do not predominate sun-exposed skin, which is why sunscreens have proven ineffective in preventing it. Exposure to sunlight, particularly UVB, is protective against melanoma—or rather, the vitamin D your body produces in response to UVB radiation is protective. 

    We suspect that the benefits to heart health of sunlight will outweigh the risk of skin cancer.

  • Vitamin D is intimately involved not only in immune system function, but also brain function. It appears that vitamin D has protective effects and immunomodulatory effects in the brain, and is useful in neurodegenerative and neuroimmune diseases, typified by MS. (http://www.overcomingmultiplesclerosis.org)
  • Optimized Vitamin D Levels can reduce breast cancer risk by 77% over a 4 year period according to a study published in 2007 in the American Journal of Clinical Nutrition. Empower yourself or a loved one with a commemorative breast cancer awareness UV activity monitor. 

In honor of Breast Cancer Awareness Month, we partnered with Voices of Hope, a volunteer organization that supports women recently diagnosed with cancer through empowerment, inspiration and information. We are offering a beautiful limited-edition blue SunFriend with a Voices of Hope commemorative band for a $100 level donation. $25 of this contribution will go directly to Voices of Hope. You will also receive the Special Edition SunFriend® + two copies of the Voices of Hope DVD. You will be supporting SunFriend as well as women in need during a very difficult time.


Read our article Featured in the Hill Rag... http://www.capitalcommunitynews.com/content/new-way-manage-sun-exposure

A New Way to Manage Sun Exposure

story:
Ongoing work is needed at the GGP Disc Golf Course

  • We need tier work on #11/#16
  • Removing Trash from Trash cans on all Holes
  • Finish the great wall on #6.
  • Add Drain rock to all the tees in need
  • There are more tee signs to be replaced
  • constant maintenance due to ever-increasing foot traffic as daily new disc golfers explore their obsession
  • the necessarily vigilant watch over erosion spots on the course

What we need:

Support through funding to keep the workers on the course part/full-time, providing for and serving the rapidly growing disc golf community in San Francisco and the greater Northern California region.

Through their tireless work and dedication, the Golden Gate Park Disc Golf Course will be the premiere free public course in the United States and the standard by which all other courses, private and public, will be judged in the future.

We've made great strides!

Planting grass in numerous locations to stop and control Erosion on our sand based course.

Purchased a truck to use for hauling and course maintainence, its already earned its place in the SFDGC Fam.

Erosion control on pathway on Hole 12

Drain rock placed around teepads #11 and #12 to stop flooding and mud tees.

The TEMPLE structure on Hole #11

The "Great Wall" on hole #6

Improved teebox area on #12

Drastically reduced play-through times on 11,12,14 with proper maintenance of the hill side.That is now covered in GRASS!!!

New Tee Signs!

More seating!

Erosion control tier on 18 to save main tree by the C pin.

...and last but certainly not least the course is continuing to get more GREEN!

story:
I have been working hard for many years now and the time has come to follow my dream of owning a Pilates/fitness studio. Doing what I am passionate about... Helping people with health issues and fitness goals to create strong bodies, a healthy lifestyle/mindset, and making it a fun place to do so! 

I need funding to get equipment, to pay the initial rent,  and put the word out. This will enable me to create a space that has a good energy/vibe, esthetically pleasing, the best equipment, and where people feel at home. I've already found a space and with your help I will be there beginning of 2015!

My intention is to work very hard and make this a success.

I feel very lucky and grateful to have found something that I love doing and am very passionate about. I have been moving since a young age. Dancing, gymnastics, ice skating, and even baton twirling (and haven't stopped since!). I realized the importance of being healthy and taking care of my body at a young age but it didn't really hit me until a terrible car accident put me out of commission for 4 months. 

I really have seen an improvement in people's lives from reducing or completely alleviating pain, to a complete reversal of an osteoporosis diagnosis. Even bringing confidence back to someone who never thought they would walk again. Or just to be stronger and a better version of themselves. 


Those experiences have inspired the idea of helping clients with parkinson's, fibromyalgia, spine disorders, ect... there is nothing more rewarding than at the end of a session someone says"I feel so much better". If you know someone this would help send them to the studio. Even the smallest amount or even some good advice on the business end would mean so much.

Oh, and I intend to "pay it forward"!

I've already found a space and with your help I will be there beginning of 2015!


My intention is to work very hard and make this a success.


I feel very lucky and grateful to have found something that I love doing and am very passionate about. I have been moving since a young age. Dancing, gymnastics, ice skating, and even baton twirling (and haven't stopped since!). I realized the importance of being healthy and taking care of my body at a young age but it didn't really hit me until a terrible car accident put me out of commission for 4 months. 


I really have seen an improvement in people's lives from reducing or completely alleviating pain, to a complete reversal of an osteoporosis diagnosis. Even bringing confidence back to someone who never thought they would walk again. Or just to be stronger and a better version of themselves. 
Those experiences have inspired the idea of helping clients with parkinson's, fibromyalgia, spine disorders, ect... there is nothing more rewarding than at the end of a session someone says"I feel so much better". If you know someone this would help send them to the studio. Even the smallest amount or even some good advice on the business end would mean so much.


Oh, and I intend to "pay it forward"!

Short Summary

Actual small scale prototype was tested with phenomenal success.

This Reactor is 100% Environmentally safe and every single part used in its construction materials are 100% Recyclable and non toxic.

This Reactor brakes no laws of physics

This Reactor dose not use voltages that are not already commonly found in every home in America and the world.

E=MC2 Dose not prevent unlimited Clean Free Electricity! 

It is the formula for Unlimited Clean Free Electricity!

This is not Perpetual motion Generation Reactor 

This Reactor requires occasional maintenance be preformed on the Reactor but do to its modular nature and construction shutting down the hole system completely is not necessary and 90% of all parts are easy to build for even a DIY Backyard Joe for only penny's the remaining 10% can be machined for under $100+/-

Money

story:
For weeks now I've been debating whether or not to set up a crowdfunder because I'm in financial straits, but - having had to do this already less than 12 months ago - I couldn't bear the thought of having to ask you for help again, especially when there are so many other people (particularly the poor refugees) more in need of help than I am. Pride also played its part, I must admit.

But things are now in such a way that pride must be swallowed, and I find I have to place myself at your mercy again.

My wages aren't great. They're not awful compared to others - I get paid just above the minimum wage - nevertheless I'm really struggling to make ends meet. I live in constant dread of payday, because my wage barely covers my bills and there is never much left over for essentials. Having exhausted the avenues at my disposal, My wage 'rise' in January was limited to 1% for the 7th year in a row. As the cost of living vastly outstrips that. I recently had to take out a payday loan, with repayments spread over several months, so that won't be paid off now until January. 

I will be able to cover my bills with the (end of) September wage, but this time I won't be able to buy food or essentials for me or my cats. Can't bring myself to ask my mother for help as she's a pensioner and can't afford it, and I have no one else to turn to.

If it was just me, I'd muddle through somehow, but food banks rarely have supplies for pets, and even then it would only be 3 days worth.

To make matters worse, my cat Frodo Baggins (pictured above) has been passing blood in his urine for a few days now. He has had a problem in the past with sediment in his urine (which was almost fatal), and I do have pet insurance. Unfortunately, any vet bills the cats incur have to be paid before I get refunded (minus £80-ish) by the insurance firm. Kind of defeats the purpose of pet insurance: I got it precisely because I couldn't afford to cough up untold hundreds for vet fees, but there you go.

I'm deeply embarrassed, ashamed, humiliated and sorry to ask this of you again., and if there were any other way to manage, I would take it. But there isn't, and I don't know what else to do, nor do I know how I'm going to make it through the coming month. Losing a few pounds wouldn't kill me, but it would my cats, and I love them and need them and couldn't bear the thought of losing them.

I understand that times are hard for us all, and I absolutely don't want anyone to contribute who can't afford it. I MEAN that. No struggling families or pensioners or anyone else, 'cos the thought of taking food out your mouths (and the mouths of your children) would be far worse than doing without myself. But if anyone can afford it, I would be so very grateful for any assistance you might offer, regardless of how big or small your donation.

Indigogo sets a minimum £500 limit, but anything over £300-£350 would be donated (as previously) to the SSPCA, and buying food for my local foodbank.

Thank you for any help you can offer, whether it be simply best wishes, prayers or £'s. I am in your debt (again).

Maureen

story:
"You are one of the best journalists I know, in terms of digging deep and seeing it through. A good place to put some social action money!"
-- Karyn, one of the early funders

OVERVIEW

None of us would claim that it is okay for a middle-aged businessman to have sex with an abused 13-year-old girl. Yet it happens, in any American city, every day.

According to the FBI, the sex trafficking industry in the United States is a multibillion-dollar industry, in which traffickers target, manipulate, and torture a steady supply of vulnerable children into submission. And yet… it is barely a topic of conversation.
  • Why isn't there a bigger outcry when a 45-year-old youth minister is arrested for going to a motel to have sex with a girl advertised as a 14-year-old prostitute?
  • Aren't we horrified to learn that a family network of men and women targeted homeless and mentally challenged girls and forced them to have sex with an average of five men every night?
  • Why did no one tell when an employee at a technology firm found 30 young girls over three years to sell to coworkers for sex?
The basic facts are available for people to be outraged and inspired to act -- but, as with most overwhelming and complex issues, people must be drawn to the story if those facts are to do some good. Some continue to dismiss victimized youth as "choosing" to prostitute themselves for "easy money" to support drug habits. Even legislators and law enforcement have to be trained to understand this issue if they are to step in and act.

And... the industry is actually growing thanks to the ability of the Internet to connect johns to their “menus.”

As one police officer said, “ordering a child [for sex] is as easy as ordering pizza.”

This project will apply experienced, digital storytelling skills to explain how traffickers do what they do, to undermine the societal ignorance, misperceptions, and silence that enables the industry to thrive under the radar.

The Campaign

The first phase has begun: gathering background research from victims, law enforcement agents, prosecutors, advocates, johns and convicted traffickers. I am based in Minneapolis/St. Paul, one of the U.S.'s top centers of trafficking -- where a strong coalition is coming together to better understand survivor stories; train advocates, hotel workers and police officers; and create best practices in this fight. I am participating in a conference April 24-25 where major players engaged in this issue will gather for the first time to share what they are learning.

The mission of my communication team is to further empower the critical mass of individuals and organizations now gathering to combat trafficking. Your support of the campaign outlined below will enable strong storytelling, with skilled presentation, so that advocates can extend their impact with greater legislative interest, public support for new policies, and community resources to help rescue and strengthen survivors.
"This country has more animal shelters than shelters for exploited children."
The Book: In-depth interviews have begun for a book that will explain how traffickers: 1) Select, 2) Seduce, 3) Subjugate, 4) Package & Deliver, and 5) Psychologically Control their victims. "How I Sell Girls for Sex, in Five Easy Steps," is especially being written for community organizers, lawmakers and enforcement officers who don't have the base of knowledge that is developing in the Twin Cities.

Transmedia Project: A central element of our campaign is the transmedia project, to be launched on CollectiveImpact.Me, which is being developed to increase community awareness of how traffickers do what they do. And this is where you come in. As we begin deeper interviews with certain sources, we need funding to record victim stories in audio and to re-enact trafficker stories in video. Transmedia storytelling will enable people to see and hear how traffickers methodically prey upon and disable the fragile minds and bodies of children.
“I was their Jesus and their savior, their knight in shining armor. I gave them food and shelter.” -- convicted sex trafficker
It will allow us to address misperceptions and misunderstandings about why girls and boys are "allowing themselves" to be sold. What physical and psychological abuse are they subjected to in order to be "delivered willingly" as products to johns?
One pimp estimated his girls were each generating at least a thousand dollars a day. His friends were allowed to gang-rape them for free.
The project will bring us behind the scenes so that this is no longer a story that happens to other people in other locations. How did a woman in a wealthy suburb sell neglected foster care youth out of her apartment without detection? How did an intelligent ROTC college student end up being trafficked for 10 years? How can it be that some victims actually resist being rescued?
A 15-year-old who tried to escape was burned alive in front of the other girls.
The horrors of sex trafficking deserve better story-telling. People are mobilizing around prevention, prosecution, and post-traumatic rehabilitation of survivors. It is time for us to help them.

The Budget

Funding for the various parts of this campaign will come from several sources, but IndieGoGo donors are specifically contributing to these components:

FUNDED thanks to IndieGoGo donations: Audio recordings of survivors, with editing to tell these stories via CollectiveImpact.Me.

WHERE YOUR FUNDING WILL GO NOW:

* Video shot at a shopping mall (using actors), telling the story from the calculated view of a trafficker… how they scan a crowd, decide who to target, approach a victim, build trust, lure them in.

* Infographic map that pinpoints details of arrests around the country – showing how pervasive the industry is.

* Art installation that replicates a powerful campaign executed in Scotland. Read about it here.

TOTAL: $6,750

Why Trust Me?

I am a long-time journalist, website designer and multimedia storyteller, with colleagues who will help tell this story in an innovative print and digital campaign. I founded Be-Mondo Publishing 10 years ago to connect communities and inspire individual and collective change. I have worked in multiple mediums (radio, newspaper, magazine, website development, podcast, television, documentary, book publishing, and workshops). I am the former Executive Editor of Time Inc. Custom Publishing and developed multimedia projects for The New York Times.

About my first transmedia campaign: Six traditional publishing houses bid on the rights to my self-published book "Choosing Single Motherhood: The Thinking Woman's Guide" (2006). With the proceeds, I created the companion ChoiceMoms.org, which features 500 articles, podcasts, discussion boards, and niche e-guides. I hosted 25 workshops around the U.S., Canada and the United Kingdom. The franchise serves thousands of women every month.

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Please contribute here, so that we can add your name on CollectiveImpact.Me to our list of supporters.

2. Contact me through the Be-MondoPublishing.com website if you wish to contribute your skills or networking to this project. (I also am seeking private donations to help defray the costs of publishing the print book version, and have a full outline of that project as well if you are interested in donating to the research/writing process.)

3. Visit CollectiveImpact.Me to see the preliminary website we've started. Let anyone who cares about this issue know about the upcoming book, transmedia project, website, and Collective Impact Me Facebook page.

4. Share this page through your social media channels to others who might want to be part of the solution.
