story:
Yes, a painless cure for cancer


Cancer hurts entirely too much. And so do the treatments.

Before we start, I'd like to share with you the words of C. A. Calhoun, M.D. They are cause both for celebration and for rioting in the streets. Dr. Calhoun worked at the famous cancer M.D. Anderson when he visited Revici's hospital, the Instituto de Biologia Aplicada in Mexico City.

Here is what he wrote about his investigation there:

"But the thing that impressed me more than anything else is the fact that every person in this institution is free of, or practically free of pain without the use of narcotics."

Revici had the same kind of results only better when he set up a new hospital in New York.

Dr. Lawrence LeShan, who was doing independent research at the NY hospital, told me this after he visited another hospital cancer ward for further research...

"I forgot how much pain there is. I was absolutely shocked by the amount of pain there was at a very good research hospital. They were screaming in the halls. They were tearing up sheets. With Revici, which were really all terminal cases, there was very little pain at all."

The shocking part of all this is that Dr. Calhoun wrote his words 68 years ago. That's why I said his words could cause rioting in the streets...because this safe and effective treatment has been kept away from you and your family.

LeShan's experiences came in the 1970's. So the pain reducing cure was continuing to touch a handful of lucky patients.

As you probalby know, sooner or later the pain from cancer can only be described by moaning, plus the treatments you have access to aren't any better. 

That's why I'm both extemely fed up and excited at the same time. I'm fed up that this pain reducing treatment that shrinks tumors has been withheld from you. Perhaps you have had family members who were forced to deal with the unrelenting pain.

But I'm excited that a platform like Indiegogo is going to enable us to end the suffering and end the pain - finally!

So why has no one told you this before?

The only thing standing between our present state of affairs of incredible pain and suffering and being pain free is outreach.  

The Painless Cancer Project will allow me to shout this news from the rooftops, so to speak. The Project will allow us to be touching 100X as many people as I have been able to talk to before. The vision is that no one in your family will suffer like cancer patients do now.

 

In case you're wondering about the book, a reader just wrote an unsolicited comment in the comments section about it:

"The Doctor Who Cures Cancer is one of the most amazing books I’ve run across, and I’ve read hundreds of health-related books." 

     - Holly Dolben

 

About me and The Doctor Who Cures Cancer

Hi ... my name is Kelley Eidem, and I’m the author of The Doctor Who Cures Cancer. I actually slept on a friend’s couch for two years to get this book researched and written. I also travelled to six states, and interviewed lots of former cancer patients and doctors.

After that, I cured my own Stage 4 cancer in two weeks.

So I know what it is like to be faced with cancer first hand. it's no wonder then  that my passion for years has been to help you and your family to overcome this scary diagnosis. Cancer doesn’t scare me. To me, it can be easy to eliminate if you know how.

But doesn’t your heart go out to all of the people here facing the challenge of cancer! Me, too. I just want to tell them there is real hope. And not only that, this particular hope reduces your pain instead of increasing it while you get well.

I hope you can give to all of the ones who are suffering here, and to my project, too. In a sense, when you invest in me, you’re giving to all of them.

Before we get started, what if you and I could create a whole new way of treating cancer in clinics across the country and the world, eliminating pain and shrinking tumors, and we could do it for the cost of one cancer patient’s treatment for one month?

Would you be all in? Of course you would.

BTW, I also have some wonderful gifts for you to thank you for your help, but more about that later.

The Doctor Who Cures Cancer is already starting to make waves.

My book has touched a few thousand readers so far, and is now ready to go to the next level. Even with a relatively small readership, the book has made a positive impact already. In additional to saving lives, here are three more wonderful developments…

  • Professor Mark Noble, who is a world-renowned neuroscientist, told me personally he changed the direction of his research completely after reading my book.
     
  • TDWCC is the inspiration for a clinic and lab being set up in South Africa with doctors to be mentored in how to use the medicines and the method. A successful engineer named Frikkie van Kraayenburg stepped up on his own and started the project.
     
  • There is also talk of a similar arrangement in the Philippines. A successful importer/exporter named Manuel Kiok wants to create the same situation in his part of the world.

If these exciting developments are occurring just from a few thousand readers of The Doctor Who Cures Cancer, how much more would happen with your helping me to reach 100X as many people!

To find out more about The Doctor Who Cures Cancer, please visit here.

 

My goal is to cure cancer painlessly...

What if we get a hundred scientists like Professor Noble and a couple hundred new clinics opened in the next five years!

I have a plan to make it happen … hundreds of clinics, with thousands of doctors trained in the Revici Method. Don’t worry, this isn’t some grand scheme. Rather people get inspired when they read The Doctor Who Cures Cancer and they take action!

So that’s why I want to take this 10 or even 100 levels higher or more. Imagine what would occur with 50,000 readers of my book.

One attorney actually contacted me about optioning the book for a movie! I expect more movie offers in the future. That could mean 20 million moviegoers discovering this incredible story.

I’ve always believed that a cure for cancer will become widely available to us quickly when too many people know the truth. ;-) That’s why your help is the key to our victory over cancer. You donation could tip the scales.


The nitty gritty details

My plan is threefold. Most of the success of The Doctor Who Cures Cancer has come about through word of mouth. I don’t even have a central website other than a sales page! Many readers have bought additional copies to share they were so inspired by my book.

The days of no website are over. I need to set up a site where readers like yourself can ask questions and discover what they need to benefit their own health. For instance, How I cured my own Stage 4 cancer.

Wouldn’t it be great to have that information? It’ll be on my website. :-)

I’ve tried building a website on my own and failed miserably. So I need to hire a real webmaster. For the many interactive features I need, the cost would be about $2,800 plus $1,200 webmaster maintenance for the first year, or $4,000 total.

I’ve invited Lynne August, a physician who worked with Dr. Revici, to be a contributor to the site. She has accepted. I plan to invite more physicians I know to be additional contributors.

The second critical part of this project is to reach hundreds of thousands of lay people and doctors so they can find out about The Doctor Who Cures Cancer. Up until now, it has taken me six years just to get a list of 6,000 subscribers. That’s entirely too slow to produce the major change I’m talking about. I want doctors calling me every day to inquire about training.

The quickest way to explode my list of readers is to start hiring list brokers. List brokers would enable me to reach hundreds of thousands, or even millions of lay people and doctors who are interested in the topic - without spamming - in mere months.

I’ve known about the incredible effectiveness of lists rentals for the past year but have been unable to take advantage of this valuable resource due to the cost of getting started. Alone, I can’t do it. But together, you and I can make it happen.

The estimated costs of developing the lists are about $2,000 a month on average. It might take six months to fine tune the lists for a total of $12,000. The good news is that once the operation is rolling along, the process can be self sustaining and expand rapidly.

Another $5,000 is needed for a copywriter to modify a sales page into a video format.

I've also come upon a method for using Facebook in a truly viral fashion. The cost of that is $296 the first month and $97 each additional month. The first year's expense would be $1,363. 

I have the option to use Facebook advertising in conjunction with the viral Facebook program. My budget calls for $1,000 a month with the first year advertising spend being $12,000. 

Together the total needed is $42,199 including fees paid to Indiegogo. If the total donations exceed our goal, the money will be used to reach even more families with cancer faster.


What we will accomplish together...

This project takes less money than two months of cancer treatment for one person!

For about the same cost of one or two months of treatment for one person with cancer by an oncology team, The Doctor Who Cures Cancer could bring forth relief for thousands or even millions of cancer sufferers around the globe and in your hometown.

Instead of traveling to New York, you or your family member could go to someone nearby if need be.

Let me mention at this point that Dr. Revici also developed effective remedies for migraines, drug addiction, and alcoholism to name a few of his many achievements.

So your assistance will touch many lives whether it be cancer, drugs, alcohol, AIDS, etc.

Experience has shown that The Doctor Who Cures Cancer changes people. They no longer fear cancer. That outcome in itself makes the book worthwhile.

But now you can change 6,000 readers into 60,000 in mere months, and 600,000 in a couple years. That means clinics opening all over the globe…and maybe in your city too.

But it won’t happen without your donations. Or to put it in a positive light, it starts with your generous help.

 

Now about your rewards…

I have lots of rewards because I’ve invented a few wonderful remedies that’ll knock your socks off. For instance, from what people with pain have told me, I invented a pain spray that works better than any narcotic for eliminating a variety of pains – far better, in fact. One lady told me it took away her PMS pain and her daughter's, too!

I’m also the author of "It’s Not Just For Sex: how to lower your blood pressure using a Nobel Prize winning discovery even if you don’t have ED."

Why pay $10 or more for pills that can cause instant blindness when for nickels a day, you could take care of your ED and/or your blood pressure?

I also have one treasured copy of the first edition of my book for a very special donor autographed by Dr. Revici, where he used his nickname. It is the only copy in existence signed by him with his family nickname.

I'm willing to give away everything in return for your support because this goal is so important to me.

So take a look at all of the rewards over on your right and pick the ones that are right for you.

(There might be a duplication of each offer. Please ignore that quirk.)

You can find out more about The Doctor Who Cures Cancer here.

 

Other Ways You Can Help...

In addition to contributing, I hope you can also share this wonderful news on Facebook and Twitter, using the icon below, and “Pin It” onto Pinterest.

Leave a comment or two. I would love to hear from you!

Oh, please visit here often because there are likely to be updates.

Your visits and contributions might also help to keep this project on the front page so that more people can find out about it.

The best to you,

 

Kelley 

Let's end the moaning pain now!
story_txt:
Yes, a painless cure for cancer

Cancer hurts entirely too much. And so do the treatments.
Before we start, I'd like to share with you the words of C. A. Calhoun, M.D. They are cause both for celebration and for rioting in the streets. Dr. Calhoun worked at the famous cancer M.D. Anderson when he visited Revici's hospital, the Instituto de Biologia Aplicada in Mexico City.
Here is what he wrote about his investigation there:
"But the thing that impressed me more than anything else is the fact that every person in this institution is free of, or practically free of pain without the use of narcotics."
Revici had the same kind of results only better when he set up a new hospital in New York.
Dr. Lawrence LeShan, who was doing independent research at the NY hospital, told me this after he visited another hospital cancer ward for further research...
"I forgot how much pain there is. I was absolutely shocked by the amount of pain there was at a very good research hospital. They were screaming in the halls. They were tearing up sheets. With Revici, which were really all terminal cases, there was very little pain at all."
The shocking part of all this is that Dr. Calhoun wrote his words 68 years ago. That's why I said his words could cause rioting in the streets...because this safe and effective treatment has been kept away from you and your family.
LeShan's experiences came in the 1970's. So the pain reducing cure was continuing to touch a handful of lucky patients.
As you probalby know, sooner or later the pain from cancer can only be described by moaning, plus the treatments you have access to aren't any better. 
That's why I'm both extemely fed up and excited at the same time. I'm fed up that this pain reducing treatment that shrinks tumors has been withheld from you. Perhaps you have had family members who were forced to deal with the unrelenting pain.
But I'm excited that a platform like Indiegogo is going to enable us to end the suffering and end the pain - finally!
So why has no one told you this before?
The only thing standing between our present state of affairs of incredible pain and suffering and being pain free is outreach.  
The Painless Cancer Project will allow me to shout this news from the rooftops, so to speak. The Project will allow us to be touching 100X as many people as I have been able to talk to before. The vision is that no one in your family will suffer like cancer patients do now.
 
In case you're wondering about the book, a reader just wrote an unsolicited comment in the comments section about it:
"The Doctor Who Cures Cancer is one of the most amazing books I’ve run across, and I’ve read hundreds of health-related books." 
     - Holly Dolben
 
About me and The Doctor Who Cures Cancer
Hi ... my name is Kelley Eidem, and I’m the author of The Doctor Who Cures Cancer. I actually slept on a friend’s couch for two years to get this book researched and written. I also travelled to six states, and interviewed lots of former cancer patients and doctors.
After that, I cured my own Stage 4 cancer in two weeks.
So I know what it is like to be faced with cancer first hand. it's no wonder then  that my passion for years has been to help you and your family to overcome this scary diagnosis. Cancer doesn’t scare me. To me, it can be easy to eliminate if you know how.
But doesn’t your heart go out to all of the people here facing the challenge of cancer! Me, too. I just want to tell them there is real hope. And not only that, this particular hope reduces your pain instead of increasing it while you get well.
I hope you can give to all of the ones who are suffering here, and to my project, too. In a sense, when you invest in me, you’re giving to all of them.
Before we get started, what if you and I could create a whole new way of treating cancer in clinics across the country and the world, eliminating pain and shrinking tumors, and we could do it for the cost of one cancer patient’s treatment for one month?
Would you be all in? Of course you would.
BTW, I also have some wonderful gifts for you to thank you for your help, but more about that later.
The Doctor Who Cures Cancer is already starting to make waves.
My book has touched a few thousand readers so far, and is now ready to go to the next level. Even with a relatively small readership, the book has made a positive impact already. In additional to saving lives, here are three more wonderful developments…

Professor Mark Noble, who is a world-renowned neuroscientist, told me personally he changed the direction of his research completely after reading my book.   

TDWCC is the inspiration for a clinic and lab being set up in South Africa with doctors to be mentored in how to use the medicines and the method. A successful engineer named Frikkie van Kraayenburg stepped up on his own and started the project.   
There is also talk of a similar arrangement in the Philippines. A successful importer/exporter named Manuel Kiok wants to create the same situation in his part of the world.
If these exciting developments are occurring just from a few thousand readers of The Doctor Who Cures Cancer, how much more would happen with your helping me to reach 100X as many people!

To find out more about The Doctor Who Cures Cancer, please visit here.
 
My goal is to cure cancer painlessly...
What if we get a hundred scientists like Professor Noble and a couple hundred new clinics opened in the next five years!
I have a plan to make it happen … hundreds of clinics, with thousands of doctors trained in the Revici Method. Don’t worry, this isn’t some grand scheme. Rather people get inspired when they read The Doctor Who Cures Cancer and they take action!
So that’s why I want to take this 10 or even 100 levels higher or more. Imagine what would occur with 50,000 readers of my book.
One attorney actually contacted me about optioning the book for a movie! I expect more movie offers in the future. That could mean 20 million moviegoers discovering this incredible story.
I’ve always believed that a cure for cancer will become widely available to us quickly when too many people know the truth. ;-) That’s why your help is the key to our victory over cancer. You donation could tip the scales. 

The nitty gritty details
My plan is threefold. Most of the success of The Doctor Who Cures Cancer has come about through word of mouth. I don’t even have a central website other than a sales page! Many readers have bought additional copies to share they were so inspired by my book.
The days of no website are over. I need to set up a site where readers like yourself can ask questions and discover what they need to benefit their own health. For instance, How I cured my own Stage 4 cancer.
Wouldn’t it be great to have that information? It’ll be on my website. :-)
I’ve tried building a website on my own and failed miserably. So I need to hire a real webmaster. For the many interactive features I need, the cost would be about $2,800 plus $1,200 webmaster maintenance for the first year, or $4,000 total.
I’ve invited Lynne August, a physician who worked with Dr. Revici, to be a contributor to the site. She has accepted. I plan to invite more physicians I know to be additional contributors.
The second critical part of this project is to reach hundreds of thousands of lay people and doctors so they can find out about The Doctor Who Cures Cancer. Up until now, it has taken me six years just to get a list of 6,000 subscribers. That’s entirely too slow to produce the major change I’m talking about. I want doctors calling me every day to inquire about training.
The quickest way to explode my list of readers is to start hiring list brokers. List brokers would enable me to reach hundreds of thousands, or even millions of lay people and doctors who are interested in the topic - without spamming - in mere months.
I’ve known about the incredible effectiveness of lists rentals for the past year but have been unable to take advantage of this valuable resource due to the cost of getting started. Alone, I can’t do it. But together, you and I can make it happen.
The estimated costs of developing the lists are about $2,000 a month on average. It might take six months to fine tune the lists for a total of $12,000. The good news is that once the operation is rolling along, the process can be self sustaining and expand rapidly.
Another $5,000 is needed for a copywriter to modify a sales page into a video format.
I've also come upon a method for using Facebook in a truly viral fashion. The cost of that is $296 the first month and $97 each additional month. The first year's expense would be $1,363. 
I have the option to use Facebook advertising in conjunction with the viral Facebook program. My budget calls for $1,000 a month with the first year advertising spend being $12,000. 
Together the total needed is $42,199 including fees paid to Indiegogo. If the total donations exceed our goal, the money will be used to reach even more families with cancer faster.

What we will accomplish together...
This project takes less money than two months of cancer treatment for one person!
For about the same cost of one or two months of treatment for one person with cancer by an oncology team, The Doctor Who Cures Cancer could bring forth relief for thousands or even millions of cancer sufferers around the globe and in your hometown.
Instead of traveling to New York, you or your family member could go to someone nearby if need be.
Let me mention at this point that Dr. Revici also developed effective remedies for migraines, drug addiction, and alcoholism to name a few of his many achievements. 
So your assistance will touch many lives whether it be cancer, drugs, alcohol, AIDS, etc.
Experience has shown that The Doctor Who Cures Cancer changes people. They no longer fear cancer. That outcome in itself makes the book worthwhile.
But now you can change 6,000 readers into 60,000 in mere months, and 600,000 in a couple years. That means clinics opening all over the globe…and maybe in your city too.
But it won’t happen without your donations. Or to put it in a positive light, it starts with your generous help.
 
Now about your rewards…
I have lots of rewards because I’ve invented a few wonderful remedies that’ll knock your socks off. For instance, from what people with pain have told me, I invented a pain spray that works better than any narcotic for eliminating a variety of pains – far better, in fact. One lady told me it took away her PMS pain and her daughter's, too!
I’m also the author of "It’s Not Just For Sex: how to lower your blood pressure using a Nobel Prize winning discovery even if you don’t have ED."
Why pay $10 or more for pills that can cause instant blindness when for nickels a day, you could take care of your ED and/or your blood pressure?
I also have one treasured copy of the first edition of my book for a very special donor autographed by Dr. Revici, where he used his nickname. It is the only copy in existence signed by him with his family nickname.
I'm willing to give away everything in return for your support because this goal is so important to me.
So take a look at all of the rewards over on your right and pick the ones that are right for you.
(There might be a duplication of each offer. Please ignore that quirk.)

Other Ways You Can Help...

Oh, please visit here often because there are likely to be updates.

The best to you,
 
Kelley

story:
*UPDATE: KAT LAWSON THROWS HER WEIGHT BEHIND ALMA'S FUNDRAISER!:*

I feel very fortunate to be able to officially announce a new perk provided by Kat Lawson, my personal friend and author of the web comic Magnetic North. She's now accepting commissions at a great deal in two donation levels. For $75, you get a black and white character piece, or a full color piece for $100! This is a STEAL. You can see examples of her work here and here!

 

Short Summary

In the beginning of the summer, I was a 26-year-old woman trying to get by, just like most. After having spent the last three years basically starting over from scratch in a new city, things were looking up. I was finally getting somewhere with my Pastry and Baking degree with a new job in a new bakery, had just found an amazing roommate, and started up with the urban farmstead thing. I had just left one job and had a few weeks' break, and just enough money, before starting the next one. I was using the time to work on myself personally as well as in my relationship with my boyfriend, Matt, who moved just this year to Portland from Virginia to be with me after years of dating long-distance. We were just getting ready to enjoy our first summer together in the three years we've known each other, when the accident happened.

On July 4th, Matt and I were invited to a party at a park just a few blocks from my house, so we rode our bikes over to join the festivites. During the course of the evening, a slackline was set up between a tree and one of the park's cement light posts. No one realized how bad the condition of the lamp post was, and when the line was being checked out for stability, the cement lamp post cracked, separated from its base, and came tumbling down. Onto my head.

The metal-and-glass lantern on the top of the post connected directly with my forehead, lacerating my scalp (which received four staples); the top of the cement post landed on my thigh, which knocked me over (and left two large lacerations that needed about 30 stitches), and caused a broken fibula and foot bone as well as torn ligaments in my ankle and foot. The impact from hitting the ground has affected my shoulders and back, making it painful to get dressed or use crutches or even sit up in bed for too long. I have bruises from head to toe, and myriad other scrapes that didn't require stitches. The severtity of the break in my ankle, coupled with the ligament damage, required surgery to fix and over two weeks of keeping my leg elevated for 23 hours a day minimum.

If I had been standing just a few inches in the wrong direction, the post would have landed directly on my head and I probably wouldn't be able to type this right now. I'd be a vegetable, at best. So I realize how lucky I am to have gotten away with so little harm. However, because I'm unemployed and worked in a food cart for the last 1.5 years, I don't have health insurance (and haven't in about three years at this point). I have applied for Medicaid, but the state of Oregon works on a lottery system still, so there's a one-in-thousands chance that I'll get chosen, and the likelihood is that I won't receive state help. I have applied for assistance from the hospital, but that only covers a portion of the care I received from them. And, perhaps the part that hurts the most, because of the kinds of injuries I have, I had to quit my new job before I even started it, and there aren't many jobs in kitchens or bakeries that I can do while I recuperate; there's not much else I'm qualified to do. The doctor's office has estimated 15 weeks before I go back to work, a business-as-usual, 8-hour workday, 40 hours a week. This is where you come in.

I need help paying my medical bills. As it stands, I have about $127 left in my bank accounts after spending the end of June unemployed and paying bills for July. Matt, my wonderful boyfriend and now-caretaker, has promised to help, but on his salary working in retail, there's not much to draw from. Our families will support us as best they can, but the fact of the matter is, even with our combined efforts, we can't do this alone.

There's a long road ahead of me, including physical therapy, maybe for up to a year, and possibly other surgeries. On top of paying the hospital bills I've already incurred, I've also had to purchase a wheelchair, crutches, and shower chair, not to mention various other items to make personal hygiene possible. The funds I hope to raise with this campaign will make a dent in those expenses and others to come (physical therapy, specifically). This has been a life-altering injury, but with the funds I raise here, I can get back on my feet

What We Need

As it stands, the financial burden resting on me is $35,271, not including the most recent doctor visit where I received an air compressing boot and had stitches removed. Here's a breakdown of what I owe and to whom:

  • Emergency Room:
    • Exam, X-Rays, bone-setting, and stitches: $997
    • Radiology (6 CT scans, 3 X-Ray): $1,291.22
    • Hospital stay (including room and board): $14,627.08
    • Ambulance service: $973.56
  • Surgery:
    • Hospital stay (I didn't stay overnight this time): $14,937.31
    • Orthopaedic services: $555
    • Anesthesiologist: $1890
    • Incidentals (stuff I've already paid for):
    • A shower chair for bathing: $45
    • Wheelchair rental:$75 a month (with elevated leg rest)
    • Various prescription refills: $70

There are still some bills floating around out there that haven't made their way to me yet regarding the surgery: they just started arriving today. As you can see, $15000 isn't going to cover everything. It's less than half of what I owe, but it'll get me on the right track. With your help, I can get back to the life I've worked so hard to make for myself.

What You Get

I know that, often, people in my situation say that the reward will be in knowing you've helped someone's life better, and it's true: if you decide to support me, you'll make my suddenly-painful life a lot easier. The thing is, I want you to know how much your support means to me. I want to give back to you in whatever way I can, because you chose me, out of so many other campaigns, and if there's anything I can do to make it worthwhile, I'll do it.

Fortunately for you, I am something of an artist. I'm not the biggest news on the block, but I've got a little skill in the stationary department, and whole lot of supplies. As some are already aware, I make postcards (some of which you can see over at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Shenanigans-Ink/166205153466046). Starting with the beginning of this campaign, I'll make custom-desiged sets of 10 postcards for each donation over $50, sets of 5 for each donation over $25, single postcards for each donation over $10, and custom minis for donations of $5. The designs for each group will be posted as I make them, and they'll probably change as time goes by, but you're guaranteed something hand-made by me, from scratch. I've had people frame the postcards and keep them around the house, but they're mail-worthy and delightful, and my way of saying THANK YOU!

As a donor, of course, you'll also be entitled to updates as I recover, but that may not be as exciting as postcards.

The Impact

When I moved to Portland, I invested everything I had into making it work. I took my old life apart, sold what I could and gave away the rest. I had recently lost my mom, and was on the verge of losing my childhood home, as well. I took out massive student loans to make my dream of attending pastry school come true. I have scraped and scrimped and lived in dubious homes and eaten nothing but rice with Tony Chachere's for months. Through hard work, I graduated from culinary school, got myself a job, and then another one, and then another one, all in an economy where people with more expensive educations couldn't get jobs. I was paying my loans, making my rent and all my other bills. I even started to accrue savings for the first time in years. I felt like a real person.

After all this time struggling to make my life as an adult feasible, it takes a great deal for me to ask for help. I wish more than anything that I could do this on my own. I want to walk again so badly that I dream about it at night. But I can barely afford the prescriptions they give me, to say nothing of the doctor visits still ahead of me. I need your help to get the care I need to get back to my life. I cannot state more emphatically how much it means to me that you've read this far, and what it would mean if you donate.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, I know what it means to be poor. I've been poor most of my life. If you can't donate, then help me get the word out. Talk about it to people you know, or people you don't know, and share. If they can't donate, ask them to spread the word, too. We can still work together to meet my goal. It means just as much to me to know there are some people out there, cheering me on.

story:
Short Summary

Thank you!!!  I am compiling the well wishes and a few late contributions.  I hope to give it to Miss Sally early next week.  Most people left a name with their contribution or comment.  For some, I only have e-mail handles that are hard to interpret.

Short Summary
Thank you!!!  I am compiling the well wishes and a few late contributions.  I hope to give it to Miss Sally early next week.  Most people left a name with their contribution or comment.  For some, I only have e-mail handles that are hard to interpret.

story:
Waiting Isn't An Option

If you watched the video, then you already know my son died from brain cancer. It is heart-wrenching losing a child. What makes it worse is not knowing who might be next. Brain cancer doesn't discriminate and they don't know what causes it. So we may never have it affect our family again - or it could take someone else close to me. I don't want to wait to find out. I want to stop this disease NOW. Before it takes someone else I love. Before it takes someone YOU love.

I have spent most of my life working in some sort of service. Key Club in high school, Paralyzed Veterans as a working adult, and PTA as a mom. I never had a true focus or passion until I saw how vastly under-funded brain cancer research is and how much help they need.

I found some other people here in Wichita who are excited to help me with this cause, but brain cancer awareness month is coming up fast. We are too late to get on most corporate budgets for this year, but we didn't want to let the chance to do an event go by. We've pooled our resources and are seeking corporate sponsorships to make the concert a reality, but it isn't enough. We need more funding to ensure that we not only cover expenses, but can also make a sizeable donation to research.

What We Need

We need to cover the expenses of the concert so we can donate all of the money from ticket sales to research. We have gotten a lot of "gift in kind" donations that have helped us with some of the expenses. Here are the projected expenses we will still need to pay for:

  • Theater rental $1,000
  • Professional Sound Tech & Equipment Rental $800
  • Professional Stage Hands $158
  • Ticketing Fees (assuming 800 tickets sold - theater holds 1293) $1,320

 

Get The Ball Rolling

I have done many fundraisers throughout the years, and the first year is always the hardest. Once people see an event is successful, they want to be a part of it. We are confidant we can put on a fabulous event that will have everyone coming back for more! We just need your help to get this first year event off the ground.

story:
Summary

Over the past four weeks, attacks by the Israeli army in the Gaza strip have resulted in the injury of over 10,000 Palestinians and the deaths of 1,800- and counting. The UN reports that the vast majority of fatalities have been civilians including over 1300 children; and many women and the elderly.

Some 425,000 Palestinians - a quarter of Gaza's population - have been displaced by fighting, the UN says.

Hospitals, clinics and medical facilities have sustained extensive damage. On 21 July, the third and fourth floors of Al-Aqsa hospital were targeted, destroying the emergency, orthopaedics and surgical departments, and intensive care unit. Operation and procedures ceased due to lack of oxygen. At Al Wafa Medical Rehabilitation hospital, 17 patients in critical condition were evacuated before it too was bombed on 23 July. In addition, the Balsam Hospital suffered damage to the paediatric and surgery departments, and CT Scan and X-Ray facilities.

As air and ground attacks continue, the remaining medical facilities face critical shortages in medical supplies and equipment, and struggle to treat the wounded who are mostly civilians, many of them children.

The Emergency Relief Committee of the Galilee Society, in cooperation with Physicians for Human Rights – Israel (PHR-Israel), seek donations to purchase and deliver urgently needed medical supplies for Gaza hospitals. We have received directly from the hospitals an itemized list of the products needed, including for example bandages, pain medication and specific equipment.

Your support will not only help ease suffering and save lives but it will also show solidarity with the people of Gaza - that they have not been forsaken by the world.

What We Need & What You Get

For eight years the Gaza strip has suffered a blockade and severe restriction on the freedom of movement and the import of many goods, including urgently needed supplies. Before the Israeli operation began, hospitals in Gaza were not well equipped but now the situation is desperate.

Every donation, no matter how small or large, will help us reach our target of $100,000 and go directly to purchasing and delivering critically needed medical supplies and equipment to save the lives of children and civilians in Gaza.

Our colleagues in Gaza described the situation as heart breaking. Patients suffering extreme pain from severe injuries are often not offered pain medication simply because it is unavailable. Further, there is an acute shortage of nutrition and fluids, antibiotics, insulin and anticoagulants and basic medical equipment to measure blood pressure or blood glucose are no longer available.

Usually here we should offer you ‘perks’ for supporting this campaign. No t-shirts or post cards here, your perk is simply knowing that you are directly contributing to ease the suffering that is happening right now in Gaza.

The Impact

The attack on Gaza could be described as “shooting fish in a barrel” – it is often referred to as one of the most densely populated places on earth, with closed land, water and air borders, and no opportunity for people to seek safe shelter anywhere. The number of civilian casualties has been estimated so far at 70% of total casualties – innocent children, women and people who wanted no more than to live life in dignity and peace.

Both the Galilee Society and PHR-Israel have extensive experience working in conflict environments and delivering medical aid. For example, during the severe winter of 2013/14, the Emergency Relief Committee of the Galilee Society delivered aid to the Syrian refugee camps in Jordan valued at more than $200,000 (20,000 blankets and 60 tons of winter clothing). In recent days PHR-Israel facilitated the delivery of over $200,000 worth of medicines and medical supplies into Gaza.

However there are still critical shortages. Your support will enable us to keep delivering this humanitarian aid and show the Palestinian population in Gaza that they have not been forgotten.

Risks & Challenges

While entering Gaza at the moment is not easy, it is possible, and PHR-Israel have facilitated the delivery of two trucks of medical aid in recent weeks. It has the necessary expertise and resources to rapidly purchase medical equipment and deliver it to Gaza.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a donation at this time, spread word of the campaign through social media and tell your friends and family about it. It all makes a difference.

We thank you deeply for your support.

The partners

The Galilee Society – The Arab National Society for Health, Research and Services (R.A.) – is a leading Palestinian Arab non-partisan, community-wide, non-governmental organization located in Israel, which was established by four healthcare professionals in 1981. The over-riding goal of the Galilee Society is to achieve equitable health, environmental and socio-economic conditions, and to increase development opportunities for Palestinian Arabs inside Israel, both as individual citizens and as a national minority living in their homeland. The Emergency relief Committee is a voluntary committee activated in times of emergency to deliver aid where needed.

Physicians for Human Rights-Israel (PHR-Israel)is a non-profit, non-governmental organization that strives to promote a more fair and inclusive society in which the right to health is applied equally for all. It is PHR-Israel’s view that Israel’s prolonged occupation over Palestinian territory is the basis of human rights violations. For this reason we oppose the occupation and endeavor to put an end to it. PHR-Israel stands at the forefront of the struggle for human rights – the right to health particularly - in Israel and the occupied Palestinian territory.

We take this opportunity to thank Camera 48 and activestills.org for the pictures.

story:
The AirVisual Node is now commercially available - ready for direct purchase from either Indiegogo or the AirVisual webpage. Check out the world's best CO2 & PM2.5 sensor here.

 

 

 

AirVisual Node is a smart air quality monitor that displays immediate, accurate air quality data both indoors and out, to help you create healthier, more productive environments.

As the most precise consumer air quality monitor on the market, the Node displays real-time PM2.5 and CO2 levels by combining laser technology and artificial intelligence. We made the device to pack all the essentials you need to breathe clean, healthy air.

The AirVisual Node was designed to medical-grade standards in order to be of special benefit to those who suffer from asthma, COPD, lung cancer and high blood pressure.  Use the AirVisual Node to instantly see invisible threats in your air and understand where they come from.  Take control to ensure you and your loved ones are breathing healthy air wherever you go.  

 

 

Every day, we make conscious decisions about the food we eat, the calories we burn, and the hours we sleep. The air we breathe has always been perceived as beyond our control - until now.

 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

With the AirVisual Node you can track a ubiquitous, invisible threat both indoors and out.  The device will provide actionable insights and advices to help you optimize your health wherever you are.

 
Turn Insights into Actions

 

   

 

 

 

 

Currently AirVisual monitors and forecasts air quality for more than 8,000 locations around the world.  This intelligence is already offered for free on the AirVisual app and website.  Check it out!

 

 

 

Your AirVisual Node will connect to our established platforms to provide you with enhanced features, including:

 

  • Health Recommendations: to lower your health risk and improve your well-being.
  • Advanced Analytics: Detailed figures on 6 key pollutants for 8,000+ locations in 35+ countries.
  • Air Pollution Community News: to keep you up-to-date on air pollution news and medical findings. 

Get the free app today to view air pollution and weather forecasts worldwide:                                                       

There are still many places that lack local air quality monitoring stations. By placing your Node outdoors under protected, shaded areas, you can become an air quality data source for your local community. 

 

 

At AirVisual, we share a vision where everyone has access to clean, healthy air.  However, we need help from the global community to realize this. When you purchase the AirVisual Node, you add another data point to our crowd-sourced world air pollution map. Together, we analyze and share air quality information around the world to help people, businesses and governments implement change.

Our prototype is ready for production: We have already partnered with manufacturers that are qualified to produce medical-grade equipment and are waiting to finalize the monitor’s external mold before starting mass production.
Within the first 48 hours of our campaign, we reached our initial goal.  We have since added the below stretch goals to keep the momentum going!  The more crowd-funding we secure, the more we can give back! 
  • Help us reach 20,000 USD and we’ll offer “over the air” software update so you can get the latest UI and calibration mechanisms with the click of a button. - REACHED
  • At 30,000 USD we’ll donate Phnom Penh, Cambodia their first ever outdoor PM2.5 air quality monitoring station.  - REACHED
  • At 40,000 USD and we’ll provide a widget that you can add to your webpages to display the current air quality of your Nodes surroundings.  This is particularly useful for businesses like coffee shops, gyms, schools, hospitals, etc. - REACHED
  • Get us to 50,000 USD and we’ll offer an API so that you can create your own applications to use the data. - REACHED
  • When we reach 70,000 USD  we'll give you the ability to use the Node to connect to your smart home devices (IFTTT support).  This will allow you to create action based rules for air purifiers and humidifiers, etc. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We are a global team hailing from 6 countries in 4 continents, dedicating our work to 1 overarching goal: to empower everyone to breathe clean, healthy air. 

 

After a year of development and testing, our prototype is finally ready. We will use Indiegogo’s funds to begin production and make the AirVisual Node a reality.

At this stage, time is our only source of uncertainty.  We are currently trying to finalize and perfect our mold, which is the biggest cause of any potential delay in our timeline. While we don’t foresee any direct risks, we acknowledge that there may be unforeseen obstacles that can interfere with getting the AirVisual Node into your hands on time.

We hold our product to the highest quality standards. As a result, we will not ship a product until the AirVisual Node meets our standard of excellence, after thorough QA/QC testing.

Important things to note -

1) Minor changes in user interface design - we are currently working with a graphic designer to improve our user interface (to be released soon). Our device screens will undergo some small changes. These changes will be purely aesthetic and will not influence the quality of information that’s being displayed.

2) China resident restrictions for information sharing - government restrictions prohibit residents of China from sharing outdoor air quality information publicly.  China residents will be able to enjoy all the features of the AirVisual Node, but will not be able to place their station outdoors and broadcast the air quality.

3) Outdoor data for select cities only - AirVisual reports outdoor air quality data for more than 5,000 cities worldwide and our coverage grows every day. Unfortunately, we still lack data from areas that do not have monitoring stations. To see if your city is covered, visit https://airvisual.com/world

 

What is the battery life?

Battery life is dependent on variables such as screen brightness, connectivity, and the sample rate for taking air quality readings.  Based on these variables, your device could last anywhere from 4-6 hours.

How is Artificial Intelligence used in the AirVisual Node?

AirVisual uses Machine Learning, a subset of Artificial Intelligence, for a variety of purposes including forecasting air pollution movements, validating data points, and the sensor calibration.

Why doesn’t the device take VOC’s into account?

While exposure to VOCs is a health concern, the AirVisual Node does not include a VOC sensor because VOC cover a wide range of compounds, some harmful and some not. AirVisual has researched over 20 different VOC sensors and as of yet, there are no low cost sensors that provide accurate values. Accurate VOC sensors sensitive to particular compounds cost over $500. AirVisual keeps monitoring the development of VOC sensors and we’re confident some technological breakthrough will occur in the next few years.

One way to protect yourself from indoor VOCs is to frequently ventilate your environment. The AirVisual Node CO2 sensor shows you when your air is confined and more subject to a VOC threat.

Why did AirVisual make the decision to create a stationary, rather than portable, air quality monitor?

Air quality is incredibly dynamic.  In order to employ artificial intelligence technologies we needed a stable environment that our computers could learn from.  A portable device lacks consistency and makes it difficult to recognize trends in one’s environment.  Because we wanted our monitor to provide insights to help users improve their air quality, we needed a stationary device to determine actionable solutions.

What are the temperature and humidity sensors used for?

The temperature and humidity sensors gives you information on your environment’s well being. Environments that are too dry can cause throat and skin problems while environments that are too humid are at risk for mold.

Temperature and humidity can also affect the accuracy of laser-based PM2.5 air quality readings.  As a result, the AirVisual device has been carefully calibrated, using our own “secret” algorithm, to take these factors into account in order to provide the highest level of accuracy possible.  

How does AirVisual collect real-time data?

AirVisual uses new laser technology to provide live air quality readings.  Within milliseconds time these readings are automatically calibrated to account for temperature, humidity and outlying data points.

Is AirVisual suitable for outdoor environments?

Yes. The AirVisual monitor is a technologically advanced tool. In order to get the most accurate and detailed information from outside, it’s important that weather doesn’t interfere.  When you set up your outdoor device, make sure that it is protected from exposure to water, strong wind and direct sunlight, and has access to an electrical outlet.  Optimal locations for your device include a shaded porch or roofed balcony. The AirVisual Node is NOT waterproof; by design it needs air flow into the sensor.
How big is the AirVisual network?  Does AirVisual report official air quality readings and forecasts for my location?
Currently AirVisual reports more than 8,000 stations, in 25 countries around the world - and we continue to grow bigger every day!  When you purchase a station station for public outdoor placement, you help grow air quality transparency, fill in data gaps and increase the accuracies of our analytics and forecasts.  To see if your town is covered visit us online, or download the app.

How does AirVisual forecast pollution?

AirVisual's air quality forecasts are generated by using cutting-edge machine learning technologies which analyze more than 100 million data points daily!  These predictions are derived from factors such as historical information, weather trends, wind movement, geography, human behavioral patterns and current air pollution readings in surrounding areas. All of this information is provided on the device’s screen - as well as on our free app and website - so that you can plan ahead and optimize your well-being when outdoors.

story:
My name is Jeanne Wright I am a hard working woman that is currently experiencing major health issues and I am unable to work even though I wish I could.

I have a job to go back to but I just have to get my physical issues taken care of before I can go back. So this is a temporary situation but I am desperate at this point and don't know what else to do to try to get money coming in to pay my bills and buy food. My friend suggested this site and I Realized I had nothing else to lose at this point.

I am a very giving person and in the past have always tried to help out people in need never thinking I would ever be in the position that I had to have help. My friends can't help because everyone is struggling that I know so I am turning to this site.

Due to my health I can't pay my bills or even survive at this rate because I have no money whatsoever other than the few dollars my friends have been able to give me to be able to eat. I eat one meal a day when possible and trust me I have no luxuries that I blow money on. I have no cable or computer because I can't afford either one.

I just need help ASAP to try to save me from losing what little I have left. Such as my trailer that I live in and my feral cat that I have taken in. If I am evicted from my trailer I don't know where I can go with my cat since she is only comfortable with me. To even think of turning her in to a shelter is not an option because they'd have to euthanize her and its not her fault that I have had this tragic chain of events.

Then to make matters worse I won't even have a car to sleep in with my cat because they are repossessing it due to non payment anytime now. I just need this help until I can get back to work and slowly try to catch Up on my bills.

Please help me ! Even if everyone can just donate $5 that will help me keep from losing my trailer and allow me to eat. That is my priority right now not losing my home.

Thank you for taking the time to read my story and again anything you can donate is a blessing for me.

I will also be happy to pay anyone back that donates to me if they want to just loan it to me. Just send me your name and address and once I am on my feet I will start paying everyone back that helped me and requested it back. This is a promise !

Bless you all and even if you can't donate would you please just share my link. I do have a Facebook account you can look at its jeanne Anderson wright, I can't get into it for messages but I can see my timeline thru a friends computer.

Anyone who would like more information can contact me via email and I will be happy to send you my phone number. My email is japrettyman@aim.com

Jeanne Wright

story:
Help me develop the next evolution in sportswear and medical products.

Hi, I am Tim Brownstone, the founder of KYMIRA Ltd. Before I ventured into the world of business I was a scientist specialising in the photobiological field of Infrared research and an athlete. During a research project into the biological effects of infrared, I realised that the benefits could be utilised in sportswear and medical products... KYMIRA Ltd. was born.

We are launching on Indiegogo to gain exposure for our young company and spread the word about the technology we are developing. The campaign is important to me personally as it will help us on our way to developing more sustainable products using recycled materials and adapting the technology for medical products that will have a universal benefit rather than just to sportsmen and women. I hope that in the future through funding sporting projects and our medical research we can have a positive social impact in both our local communities and in projects world wide.  


What We Need & What You Get

What we need and where will it go?

  • We have set our funding target at £5,000 as this is our first ever campaign with crowd funding. While this will not be enough to develop our medical products, or fund a subsequent run of sporting products it will help us get off the ground and spread the word about our mission.
  • If we do not reach our target the funds will be split between future campaigns to raise awareness about what we are doing here at KYMIRA and research to further prove the efficacy of our products.

What is unique about our products?

  • All of our products are made right here in the UK

Our sports products have been clinically proven to help enhance an athletes performance and recovery by:

  • Increasing circulation
  • Increasing tissue oxygen levels
  • Reducing recovery times
  • Alleviating pain 
  • Increasing energy production

In addition our fabrics have also been clinically proven to be:

  • more heat retentive than other fabrics on the market
  • very quick drying 
  • this has the combined effect of making for a very thermoregulatory garment

If you choose to back our project you will receive one or more products from our KYMIRA Sportswear range, and of course - a personal thank you from me!

The Impact

As I have said, this campaign will hopefully be the catalyst that starts us off on our course to introducing the world to the technology in our products. Which will lead to us being able to have a more positive social impact, through medical developments and sports participation schemes world wide.


Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that not everyone can help us financially, but if you think that you would be able to help us with your expertise please do get in touch!

Of course please help spread the word about our campaign through social media and using the Indiegogo share tools.

For more information visit:

Twitter: @KYMIRAsport
Facebook: www.facebook.com/kymirasport

www.kymira.co.uk

story:
The Path
I am on a quest to give and hoping I can encourage you to become a part of this movement. My path begins in a devotion to myself and my practice of yoga at Rishikesh Yog Peeth, in India, to obtain my yoga certification. It then continues to wind east to Nepal while I experience giving myself for volunteer service in Nepal. My final step on this journey is the execution of my movement to contribute to clean water security for an area of people in Nepal.

The Growth
As a girl, yoga and meditation were a very common and comfortable practice in my home. Both my mother and father believed that one receives benefits from a time of focus and personal exercise. I was blessed to be introduced early, and have continued a practice into my current, daily lifestyle. On this trip of giving, I am giving to myself the gift of learning and devotion to the practice of Hatha yoga on my first stepping-stone in Rishikesh, India.

The Spark
There has always been a distinct passion for helping others within me, which has come from my many experiences and basic good nature.  My experience with volunteer is felt back to memories of my mother bringing me to do my homework with her study group of children at CAPTAIN youth center. Later on, in my sophomore year in high school, I embarked on a service trip with a group of girls to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for a life changing experience! There for just short of two weeks, I spent time volunteering at the orphanage centers run by Adoption Advocates International. I was dipped into a new culture and fell in love with everything about it: the people, the stories, the geography, the traveling, and the service. While at the orphanage, time was spent with the children aging from infancy to sixteen years old. All of the children spent their days in classes, and took breaks for courtyard play and mealtime, which volunteers helped plan and facilitate. There were three compounds at the Addis Ababa location, which volunteers contribute with: healthy children, mentally/physically disabled children, and HIV/Aids positive children. 

                

Since this trip, I have participated in Habitat for Humanity projects, donated to local Food Pantries, and offered other volunteer service to my surrounding community, which has deepened my desire to give support to others.
I have decided to put aside time to dedicate myself to more time of service and volunteer with children of another community. I have been accepted to a program with International Volunteer HQ, working as a volunteer at placement orphanages in Nepal. Because I am planning on spending a few months, contact members at IV-HQ say they will give me the opportunity of spending time at multiple orphanages. I will be taking part in daily classes, including English and other skill strengthening activities.
To give a more personal touch, I am constructing a project to share with the children on my travels; something that is a large part of my daily meditation: Hula Hooping! Word has been sent to numerous hoop-crafting companies and individual hoopers, to get an entire community involved in my service trip and work. As a collective, there are sponsors and donations of hula-hoops and hoop decorating materials to bring with me on my journey!

Keep tuned for the hoop companies apart of this project!

The Ripple

With the help of this gathered community, we will be funding the establishment of water security for a large amount of people in Nepal. When researching my travels and information about my destination to Nepal, warned everywhere was a major resource crisis for clean water. Lacking of adequate waste management and clean surface water, areas are in need of resources such as ground wells for easier access to water. Surface water has been contaminated, including rivers that were once being used as a source to families for miles around. One of the simplest and most essential things in a being’s life is water, and without a clean source poor health and disease spreads. I will not put a number or limit on how many wells will be established; there is no number in relief support or reach of love.
I am connected with Splash, an organization with established projects in Nepal and five other countries.  They have established water purification systems in hospitals, schools, orphanages and other village centers so that this campaigns efforts will be focussed towards improved sanitation efforts, to contribute to a cleaner future.  What I hope for in volunteering is to make a small ripple effect; something that will continue making changes and broadening its reach. No matter what, this movement will be ever changing and growing. Join this wave.



 For more information about Splash and their ongoing projects.

Click to like the Facebook page, which will follow the progress of this project!

story:
We believe a change in healthcare is coming. Maybe you can feel it, too. The time for herbal medicine is now.

Do you have a vision to revolutionize healthcare? Are you working to connect people with plants in your community? Are you ready for a wellness system focused on the health of people and planet?

We believe that herbal medicine has a vital role to play in the emerging integrative healthcare system. We're excited to be a part of this work and we know that, together, we can seed the growth of a system that is grounded in nature, empowers individuals and connects communities.

Everyone's contribution is necessary. The work you do in your community is the foundation of this grassroots movement. We'd like to offer support, if we can (check out the project consultation perk for ideas). Any donation you make will also support the work we do to provide direct care in our community and to educate skilled herbalists who work on the front-lines in kitchens and clinics nationwide.

Here's how we're working towards change:

Re-skilling our community, one person at a time. We inspire individuals to take care of themselves and their families and provide them with the knowledge and skills to do it. Individuals then become valuable resources in their local communities, too.

Our tools:

  • an annual intensive gardening and medicine-making apprenticeship

  • an ongoing schedule of community workshops and special events

  • learning gardens and a teaching kitchen

  • sliding-scale community herbal clinics, offering individuals education in self-care with herbs, diet and lifestyle recommendations

Seeding the culture with change-makers. We train clinical herbalists who take their knowledge and experience to communities across the country. These herbalists replicate and expand the educational work we do in exponentially widening circles.

Our tools:

  • a three-year clinical herbalist training program

  • sliding-scale community herbal clinics in multiple locations, the primary training venue for clinical interns

  • a professional lab and fully-stocked apothecary for intern use

Who we are:

Vermont Center for Integrative Herbalism (VCIH) is an educational grasssroots non-profit, founded in 2007 by a group of experienced herbalists and activists, working through collaborative leadership to change what healthcare looks like. 

The founding directors are Betzy Bancroft, Larken Bunce and Guido Masé, who were joined later by co-director Laura Litchfield and outreach coordinator Lisa Weiss. Shona MacDougall rounds out the clinical staff, along with our directors, and Julie Mitchell, Iris Gage, Mischa Schuler and Joann Darling contribute their expertise as adjunct faculty. We also have a wonderful Board, led by Amy Goodman, supporting and guiding us.

To learn more about our team, visit our website, www.vtherbcenter.org.

“I just wanted to thank you for your wonderful herbal clinic. The herbalists I met with were incredibly professional and quite astute as well. I feel nourished in a whole new way. The tinctures have been fabulous and not only do I feel the medicine of the herbs within, I feel the equally important good medicine of the people who made the tincture, just for me.”  VCIH  student clinic client


The impact we're making ~ the nitty gritty details:

Since we began this work, we’ve been steadily increasing our impact both locally and further afield. Here’s a snapshot of some of what we’ve accomplished:

Thirty individuals have completed our Herbs from the Ground Up gardening and medicine-making apprenticeship over the past 4 years. We've enrolled 10 more this summer. These students have the knowledge and skills to cultivate medicinal gardens and make herbal remedies for self and family-care.

Ninety-nine people have completed our one-year Family Herbalist training program, and 30 more are currently enrolled. These individuals have the knowledge and skills to support their own and their families’ health using herbs, nutrition, and lifestyle choices. Approximately half of these students continue on to the Clinical Herbalist training program.  Our students come to us from our local and regional area, as well as all over North America.

Thirty-one individuals have completed our 3-year Clinical Herbalist training program and 12 more are currently enrolled. These individuals have developed advanced clinical skills and return to their own communities prepared to offer herbal education and professional consultations to their community and work integratively with other health-care professionals.

“I’m so thankful to Larken, Betzy and Guido for forming an herb school that includes real clinical practice.They have trained us in every possible clinical scenario we could encounter as practicing herbalists.” Clinical Herbalist  program student

Since 2010, the professional clinic has provided 1828 hours of service, while our student clinics have offered 1620 hours of service, costing us approximately $152,000 to provide. Our professional practitioners are currently working with 496 individuals while our student clinics currently serve 308 individuals, with many others having passed through the clinic in the past 7 years. Many of these clients have taken advantage of our sliding-scale payment options to reduce the cost, and $26,695 worth of consultation time was provided as a gift, free of charge.

The professional clinic provides observation opportunities for our clinical students in training, while our student clinic gives interns the chance to practice directly with clients under supervision for a full year. Of course, our clinics also provide one-on-one education to the clients seeking knowledge about taking care of themselves with herbs. It's a win-win experience.

Since 2010, we’ve also provided $204,000 worth of herbal products to our community, all at two thirds of retail cost, or below. In fact, we’ve given away $58,000 worth of herbs since 2010 (an average of $15,000/year). Our apothecary provides both a direct source of herbs to our clients and a learning environment for our students. As with consultations, herbs are available to clients on a sliding-scale and as gifts, when needed. 

Less easy to quantify, but no less important, have been our efforts in developing and enhancing models for accessible and socially just clinics, and in maintaining environmental sustainability alongside of growth. We've worked hard on payment policies that incorporate sliding-scales, the use of Time Banking and elements of gift economy. We are diligent in improving our delivery of herbal education in ways that reflect the creativity and diversity of the plants and our students. We seek to consistently enhance the quality of our own clinical practices and have developed methods for peer support and professional development. We share our work freely with our community through national teaching and international travel, as well as our organization's journal. We increasingly engage in research partnerships, as well as educational affiliations. We are also committed to our model of collaborative leadership, an ongoing experiment in complexity, care and visionary community.

We invite you to visit our website for much more information about our community classes, training programs, herbal clinics and our mission and vision for herbalism and healthcare and for creating a revolution in plant-based wellness!

Why we're asking for support:

In 2013, VCIH doubled in physical size and student capacity and our provision of clinical services has grown along with our expansion. Students come to Vermont from all over the country to study with us. We’re excited to meet the growing demand for herbal education locally and nationally and we need your help to do it.

We are asking for contributions towards our operating costs during this exciting period of growth. As we’ve expanded and the interest in our work and demand for our services and programs has increased, so have our expenses. At the same time, we are not yet at full capacity in terms of tuition revenue, which supports the rest of our work substantially. Our current projected deficit is $15,000 for this year. We expect to reach our enrollment goals in 2015, while also continuing to fine-tune our systems and budget in our new space, returning us to sustainability.

Your contribution will specifically support the delivery of our Family and Clinical Herbalist training programs and the maintenance of the sliding-scale community clinics and apothecary that support them. This means paying faculty and clinical supervisors, maintaining our facilities and stocking the apothecary for this current fiscal year.

We took a leap of faith to better serve our local and national communities and the students who come from far and wide. We believe a revolution is needed and we can help make it happen. We are confident that we will land on solid ground, but we need your support while we grow.

What you get:

The online fundraising model is based on giving "perks" in exchange for donations to support an organization's work. We hope you'll agree that we have a lovely list of these to offer you, donated to us by fantastic herbalists around the country. Read more below about the excellent folks providing these goodies and support their work when you can!

We also want to be sure that we offer tangible resources for the work you are doing--so we've created perks that go beyond "thank you" and provide direct support on your projects and ideas.  You can choose to consult with one of our four directors, Betzy Bancroft, Larken Bunce, Laura Litchfield and Guido Masé on the topic of your choosing. Areas in which we might be of help include designing your herbal education, setting up clinics, crafting great herb walks and workshops, engaging the medical community as a practitioner, medicine-making and apothecary set up, or anything else*, just ask!

*Doesn't include personal health consultations.

***

Here are more details about the perks we're offering, along with the individuals and businesses who generously donated them:

Traci Picard at Fellow Workers Farm Apothecary (blogging at www.fellowworkersfarm.com) donated Calamus Bitters, White Pine Salve, and Tree Power Salve. All of her products are made by hand and with love.

Steph Zabel at Flowerfolk Herbal Apothecary (www.flowerfolkherbs.com) donated a Nourishing Tea Blend, a Comfrey Salve Healing Balm, Rose Empress Moisturizing Elixir, and mini plant photo cards. Steph helps to inspire people about how and why they would want to incorporate herbs into their lives. As a community herbalist she teaches about local plants, wildcrafting, and how to make herbal remedies at home. She makes small batches of herbal products, which are often seasonal in nature, and is the organizer of the lovely Herbstalk conference.

Galen’s Way, committed to crafting the highest quality, therapeutically active herbal skin care since 1999, donated Riot of Roses Cream, Skin Salve-ation, and Lip Salve-ation (Chocolate, Vanilla, and Mint). Galen’s Way brings the pure and powerful spirit of whole plant extracts to the human senses. The deep colors, complex aromas, and sensuous textures signal the herbal richness alive in their skin care line. Galen's Way products are saturated with life. Owner Matthew Persico purchases herbs from small, family-owned organic growers, with a few ethically wild harvested exceptions.

Herbal Revolution, a small organic herb company based in mid-coast Maine, donated an “Eat Your Weeds” T-shirt, Amber and Rose Luscious Body Butter, California Poppy Tincture, Elderberry Plus Maine Mushrooms and Roots Double-Extracted Elixir, Maine Mushroom and Roots Double-Extracted Elixir, Wild Rose and Honey Elixir, Lemon Squeeze Honey Love Tea, and Chaga Chai Tea. Herbal Revolution products are made by Kathi Langelier in small batches to ensure the integrity and quality of the herbs. Every step in the process is taken with great care and respect, infusing the herbs and the products with positive intentions of health and wellness. 

Urban Moonshine, specializing in organic digestive bitters and herbal tonics, donated many of their lovely herbal formulas. Founded by Jovial King, Urban Moonshine formulates for accessibility, affordability and effectiveness to support the modern lifestyle. Their products are widely applicable, extremely safe, and delightfully palatable, helping you spark a revolution in your health!

Kate Gilday at Woodland Essence, bringing you the healing essence of the woodland, donated 3 $75 gift-certificates, a Tree Flower Essence Set, a Chakra Flower Essence Set, After the Sun Crème, Calendula Flower Salve, Chaga Skin Crème, Birch Velvet Face & Body Crème, Crème of the Forest Face & Body Crème, Warming Muscle Balm, and Restorative Herb Powder. You can purchase Kate’s beautiful products at woodlandessence.com. Kate also offers special classes in flower essences, sacred plant medicine, herbal studies, and forest adventures--providing others with a way to experience the magic and deep healing that can take place in Nature.

The Activist Self-Care Kit: Supporting Change Makers for the Long Haul was put together and donated by Mandala Botanicals, Dandelioness Herbals and Wake Robin Botanicals. The Kit includes Speak Truth! Throat Spray, Tulsi Glycerite and Solidarity Salve. You can check out all the great things these herbalists are up to at: dandelionessherbals.blogspot.com, mandalabotanicalsvt.com and wakerobinbotanicals.com. 

Guido Masé and Larken Bunce, two of our founding co-directors, also contributed perks. Guido is offering his book, The Wild Medicine Solution, and Larken is offering a selection of her botanical photography greeting cards.

Other ways you can help:

Even if you can't contribute financially, we'd so appreciate you spreading the word on social media, or even better, send an email to your networks to let folks know you support our work and invite them to do the same. We are so grateful!

Spread the vision of a plant-based wellness revolution far and wide...
