Any donation you make will also support the work we do to provide direct care in our community and to educate skilled herbalists who work on the front-lines in kitchens and clinics nationwide.
Here's how we're working towards change:
Re-skilling our community, one person at a time. We inspire individuals to take care of themselves and their families and provide them with the knowledge and skills to do it. Individuals then become valuable resources in their local communities, too.Our tools:
an annual intensive gardening and medicine-making apprenticeship 
an ongoing schedule of community workshops and special events
learning gardens and a teaching kitchen
sliding-scale community herbal clinics, offering individuals education in self-care with herbs, diet and lifestyle recommendations
Seeding the culture with change-makers. We train clinical herbalists who take their knowledge and experience to communities across the country. These herbalists replicate and expand the educational work we do in exponentially widening circles.Our tools:
a three-year clinical herbalist training program
sliding-scale community herbal clinics in multiple locations, the primary training venue for clinical interns 
a professional lab and fully-stocked apothecary for intern use
Who we are:Vermont Center for Integrative Herbalism (VCIH) is an educational grasssroots non-profit, founded in 2007 by a group of experienced herbalists and activists, working through collaborative leadership to change what healthcare looks like. The founding directors are Betzy Bancroft, Larken Bunce and Guido Masé, who were joined later by co-director Laura Litchfield and outreach coordinator Lisa Weiss. Shona MacDougall rounds out the clinical staff, along with our directors, and Julie Mitchell, Iris Gage, Mischa Schuler and Joann Darling contribute their expertise as adjunct faculty. We also have a wonderful Board, led by Amy Goodman, supporting and guiding us.To learn more about our team, visit our website, www.vtherbcenter.org.
“I just wanted to thank you for your wonderful herbal clinic. The herbalists I met with were incredibly professional and quite astute as well. I feel nourished in a whole new way. The tinctures have been fabulous and not only do I feel the medicine of the herbs within, I feel the equally important good medicine of the people who made the tincture, just for me.”  VCIH  student clinic client


The impact we're making ~ the nitty gritty details:Since we began this work, we’ve been steadily increasing our impact both locally and further afield. Here’s a snapshot of some of what we’ve accomplished:Thirty individuals have completed our Herbs from the Ground Up gardening and medicine-making apprenticeship over the past 4 years. We've enrolled 10 more this summer. These students have the knowledge and skills to cultivate medicinal gardens and make herbal remedies for self and family-care.Ninety-nine people have completed our one-year Family Herbalist training program, and 30 more are currently enrolled. These individuals have the knowledge and skills to support their own and their families’ health using herbs, nutrition, and lifestyle choices. Approximately half of these students continue on to the Clinical Herbalist training program.  Our students come to us from our local and regional area, as well as all over North America.Thirty-one individuals have completed our 3-year Clinical Herbalist training program and 12 more are currently enrolled. These individuals have developed advanced clinical skills and return to their own communities prepared to offer herbal education and professional consultations to their community and work integratively with other health-care professionals.
“I’m so thankful to Larken, Betzy and Guido for forming an herb school 
that includes real clinical practice.They have trained 
us in every possible clinical scenario we could encounter as practicing 
herbalists.” Clinical Herbalist  program student
Since 2010, the professional clinic has provided 1828 hours of service, while our student clinics have offered 1620 hours of service, costing us approximately $152,000 to provide. Our professional practitioners are currently working with 496 individuals while our student clinics currently serve 308 individuals, with many others having passed through the clinic in the past 7 years. Many of these clients have taken advantage of our sliding-scale payment options to reduce the cost, and $26,695 worth of consultation time was provided as a gift, free of charge.The professional clinic provides observation opportunities for our clinical students in training, while our student clinic gives interns the chance to practice directly with clients under supervision for a full year. Of course, our clinics also provide one-on-one education to the clients seeking knowledge about taking care of themselves with herbs. It's a win-win experience.Since 2010, we’ve also provided $204,000 worth of herbal products to our community, all at two thirds of retail cost, or below. In fact, we’ve given away $58,000 worth of herbs since 2010 (an average of $15,000/year). Our apothecary provides both a direct source of herbs to our clients and a learning environment for our students. As with consultations, herbs are available to clients on a sliding-scale and as gifts, when needed.  Less easy to quantify, but no less important, have been our efforts in developing and enhancing models for accessible and socially just clinics, and in maintaining environmental sustainability alongside of growth. We've worked hard on payment policies that incorporate sliding-scales, the use of Time Banking and elements of gift economy. We are diligent in improving our delivery of herbal education in ways that reflect the creativity and diversity of the plants and our students. We seek to consistently enhance the quality of our own clinical practices and have developed methods for peer support and professional development. We share our work freely with our community through national teaching and international travel, as well as our organization's journal. We increasingly engage in research partnerships, as well as educational affiliations. We are also committed to our model of collaborative leadership, an ongoing experiment in complexity, care and visionary community. We invite you to visit our website for much more information about our community classes, training programs, herbal clinics and our mission and vision for herbalism and healthcare and for creating a revolution in plant-based wellness!Why we're asking for support:In 2013, VCIH doubled in physical size and student capacity and our provision of clinical services has grown along with our expansion. Students come to Vermont from all over the country to study with us. We’re excited to meet the growing demand for herbal education locally and nationally and we need your help to do it.We are asking for contributions towards our operating costs during this exciting period of growth. As we’ve expanded and the interest in our work and demand for our services and programs has increased, so have our expenses. At the same time, we are not yet at full capacity in terms of tuition revenue, which supports the rest of our work substantially. Our current projected deficit is $15,000 for this year. We expect to reach our enrollment goals in 2015, while also continuing to fine-tune our systems and budget in our new space, returning us to sustainability.Your contribution will specifically support the delivery of our Family and Clinical Herbalist training programs and the maintenance of the sliding-scale community clinics and apothecary that support them. This means paying faculty and clinical supervisors, maintaining our facilities and stocking the apothecary for this current fiscal year.We took a leap of faith to better serve our local and national communities and the students who come from far and wide. We believe a revolution is needed and we can help make it happen. We are confident that we will land on solid ground, but we need your support while we grow.What you get:The online fundraising model is based on giving "perks" in exchange for donations to support an organization's work. We hope you'll agree that we have a lovely list of these to offer you, donated to us by fantastic herbalists around the country. Read more below about the excellent folks providing these goodies and support their work when you can!We also want to be sure that we offer tangible resources for the work you are doing--so we've created perks that go beyond "thank you" and provide direct support on your projects and ideas.  You can choose to consult with one of our four directors, Betzy Bancroft, Larken Bunce, Laura Litchfield and Guido Masé on the topic of your choosing. Areas in which we might be of help include designing your herbal education, setting up clinics, crafting great herb walks and workshops, engaging the medical community as a practitioner, medicine-making and apothecary set up, or anything else*, just ask!*Doesn't include personal health consultations.***Here are more details about the perks we're offering, along with the individuals and businesses who generously donated them:Traci Picard at Fellow Workers Farm Apothecary (blogging at www.fellowworkersfarm.com) donated Calamus Bitters, White Pine Salve, and Tree Power Salve. All of her products are made by hand and with love.Steph Zabel at Flowerfolk Herbal Apothecary (www.flowerfolkherbs.com) donated a Nourishing Tea Blend, a Comfrey Salve Healing Balm, Rose Empress Moisturizing Elixir, and mini plant photo cards. Steph helps to inspire people about how and why they would want to incorporate herbs into their lives. As a community herbalist she teaches about local plants, wildcrafting, and how to make herbal remedies at home. She makes small batches of herbal products, which are often seasonal in nature, and is the organizer of the lovely Herbstalk conference.Galen’s Way, committed to crafting the highest quality, therapeutically active herbal skin care since 1999, donated Riot of Roses Cream, Skin Salve-ation, and Lip Salve-ation (Chocolate, Vanilla, and Mint). Galen’s Way brings the pure and powerful spirit of whole plant extracts to the human senses. The deep colors, complex aromas, and sensuous textures signal the herbal richness alive in their skin care line. Galen's Way products are saturated with life. Owner Matthew Persico purchases herbs from small, family-owned organic growers, with a few ethically wild harvested exceptions.Herbal Revolution, a small organic herb company based in mid-coast Maine, donated an “Eat Your Weeds” T-shirt, Amber and Rose Luscious Body Butter, California Poppy Tincture, Elderberry Plus Maine Mushrooms and Roots Double-Extracted Elixir, Maine Mushroom and Roots Double-Extracted Elixir, Wild Rose and Honey Elixir, Lemon Squeeze Honey Love Tea, and Chaga Chai Tea. Herbal Revolution products are made by Kathi Langelier in small batches to ensure the integrity and quality of the herbs. Every step in the process is taken with great care and respect, infusing the herbs and the products with positive intentions of health and wellness.  Urban Moonshine, specializing in organic digestive bitters and herbal tonics, donated many of their lovely herbal formulas. Founded by Jovial King, Urban Moonshine formulates for accessibility, affordability and effectiveness to support the 
modern lifestyle. Their products are widely applicable, extremely safe, and 
delightfully palatable, helping you spark a revolution in your 
health! Kate Gilday at Woodland Essence, bringing you the healing essence of the woodland, donated 3 $75 gift-certificates, a Tree Flower Essence Set, a Chakra Flower Essence Set, After the Sun Crème, Calendula Flower Salve, Chaga Skin Crème, Birch Velvet Face & Body Crème, Crème of the Forest Face & Body Crème, Warming Muscle Balm, and Restorative Herb Powder. You can purchase Kate’s beautiful products at woodlandessence.com. Kate also offers special classes in flower essences, sacred plant medicine, herbal studies, and forest adventures--providing others with a way to experience the magic and deep healing that can take place in Nature. The Activist Self-Care Kit: Supporting Change Makers for the Long Haul was put together and donated by Mandala Botanicals, Dandelioness Herbals and Wake Robin Botanicals. The Kit includes Speak Truth! Throat Spray, Tulsi Glycerite and Solidarity Salve. You can check out all the great things these herbalists are up to at: dandelionessherbals.blogspot.com, mandalabotanicalsvt.com and wakerobinbotanicals.com.  Guido Masé and Larken Bunce, two of our founding co-directors, also contributed perks. Guido is offering his book, The Wild Medicine Solution, and Larken is offering a selection of her botanical photography greeting cards.Other ways you can help:Even if you can't contribute financially, we'd so appreciate you spreading the word on social media, or even better, send an email to your networks to let folks know you support our work and invite them to do the same. We are so grateful!Spread the vision of a plant-based wellness revolution far and wide...

story:
Hello Everyone. =3


I'm Cassandra Tognoni! I'm a Transgender Cosplayer, Amtgard Nobel woman, and just an all around nice gal who hopes to achieve a sense of normality within my own mind, through Transitioning into a woman.


This campaign is for my first surgery, Breast Augmentation and the aim is to raise $6,000.00. I know this a large amount to ask for and if my goal is not met, the funds raised will still go towards the procedures mentioned, as I am saving myself as well.


In this life, all of us have answered a question wrong, done something wrong, felt wrong, and that feeling is the feeling I have lived with my entire life. Growing up, every morning I would wake, feeling as if I was wrong, that my entire life was wrong. I didn't know why and was scared that the answer would never come to me. For twenty years I searched for a way to wake up each morning and feel as if the life I was living was simply right.


I'm not a narcissist , but I do believe in myself, and believe that no matter who you are, no matter how you choose to live your life it should be lived with that feeling of doing right by yourself, feeling right within your own body, mind and soul. I will continue to believe this even if I don't ever get a single cent toward my own goal, and it will not stop me on my path, it will simply be another mountain that I climb. 


I am extremely grateful for the experience of life itself. I mean, it is simply indescribable! Life is amazing, its a story that is told differently each day, each second, and with each breath we take. We wake each day without the promise of there being a light at the end of tunnel, yet, we live on. 


I believe that with a will there is always a way, and that hope will never fade.


Live your life, how you think it should be lived, and don't forget to smile. =)


Everything is appreciated, even if you cannot contribute.


Please spread the word of my fundraiser if you support me, I would greatly appreciate it.


With Hopeful Sincerity,


-Cassandra Tognoni



Perks

1$

Ask a Transwoman?

Ask me anything, about anything. I will answer openly and honestly to the best of my ability any question you ask. It can be about transgender or anything else. It can be something personal about me or any general question. Don't be scared to ask anything you've been too scared to ask about transgender. Ask respectfully and I will answer without judgement. Give me your e-mail address and ask away!!


10$ Personalized Thank You Card

Receive a personalized 'Thank You' card from me, sent in the mail. Be sure to put your preferred name where it asks for name, if it's different then the name listed on your billing and mailing address.


25$ A Head Shot of Me!

As a giant thank you, I will send you a personalized 6x4 Head shot of me, sent in the mail. Be sure to put your preferred name where it asks for name, if it's different then the name listed on your billing and mailing address.


50$

A Signed Cosplay Picture of Me! 

I might not get to shake your hand for helping me in such a way as this but I can sign a Picture of me, 8x10 in a random cosplay of my choosing to send to you in the mail. Be sure to put your preferred name where it asks for name, if it's different then the name listed on your billing and mailing address.


100$

A Signed Cosplay Picture of Me and A Foam Boffer Sword! 

I can't express how amazing it is to swing a foam Amtgard swords as built by yours truly. In a sign of my truest and deepest regard for you help, in this way, I will send you a not only a random picture of me in cosplay, but also Special Amtgard Boffer Sword. Be sure to put your preferred name where it asks for name, if it's different then the name listed on your billing and mailing address.


500$

A Story that changed my life.

Want to know some of the things that influenced me? I've got a lot, you would definitely enjoy this =) Also comes with signed cosplay photo.


1,000$

A Day/Night in Burque!

I know my home like the back of my hand! I cant wait to show you around the city of Albuquerque, you know the place that Bug Bunny always missed the left turn? Well If you donate this much, I will gladly meet you in the city and we can either go have a wonder day on the town or hit the night club scene and hit the bars or clubs.


1,500$

A Day/Night with you!

I know my home like the back of my hand, do you? If you donate this much I will go to you, we can hang out in the tourist traps or you can show me the cute little hidden away places that only you know about.

story:
Meet the Yoga Teachers!!!


Meet Suheir - Yoga Teacher from Palestine (English)


Meet Mira - Yoga Teacher from Palestine (Arabic)


What We Are About

My name is Dr. Katherine Bisharat. I am Board Certified in Internal Medicine, Holistic Medicine and Yoga Therapy. I am the owner of an Integrative Medical Practice which includes focus on Functional Medicine, Holistic Nutrition. As founder of SAHA Wellness and Yoga, our studio is designed for all bodies, all ages and all abilities. I have also started a nonprofit called Inspired Medicine that will be taking integrative care to a grassroots level in our global community.

Our purpose is to bring two yoga teachers from Palestine, here to the United States for additional yoga therapy training. These women are committed to taking home their new tools to mitigate the consequences of human trauma, affecting all ages in
Palestinian daily life. 

Politics in the Middle East has been a thorn in everyone's side for decades. None of this has ever been up to women. What if we totally rethink this and offer effective ways to families, schools and health professionals to handle their daily stress and trauma? What if we allow people's hearts to heal?

Will you help us make this happen?

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3,000 to defray the travel costs of our yoga teachers to come from overseas. There are already people lined up here, to house, transport and host these women. 

These funds no matter what will be earmarked for this purpose whether we raise all or part of the monies we have requested. Our vision is to continue to foster exchanges of learning between both countries.


The Impact

If we teach two women and they each have made the commitment to teach 35 more women and then those women teach to their families, their schools, their workplace, we will have a profound ripple effect that will only expand in its healing influence.


Other Ways You Can Help

We have TWO informative and empowering events with SAHA that we would like to share with you! We would love for you to come to one or both and join us in BEING the change! The first is our Indiegogo fundraiser on the International Women's Day on Saturday, March 8th at SAHA Wellness - 5931 Stanley Ave, Ste 7 Carmichael, CA 7:00-9:00pm. Contact us at 916.484.7175

http://www.sahawellness.com      http://www.sacramentobethlehem.org    http://www.niroga.org       http://californiaspiritfestival.com

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to share our fundraiser with your friends and family! Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

story:
Surviving Childbirth: Changing Uncertainty to Joy

 

Our work is simple: We help women in remote, rural regions of Senegal, West Africa, experience healthy and joyful childbirth. Five women and 41 newborns die each day in Senegal due to complications related to pregnancy and childbirth. These sad statistics are preventable. With your help, we can fully staff community health workers in Saraya, Senegal, who will in turn provide quality care to mothers, resulting in long-term impacts to the community and economy.

 

Mariama, who sells water to feed her children, told us she's pregnant with her fifth child. Her husband died three months ago. "I don't know what I'm going to do," she said. Our work will provide quality care and peace of mind to women like Mariama.

 

 

With the help of a local midwife, Sally gave birth to a beautiful baby boy at the maternity clinic in Daloto, Senegal. Welcome to the world, little one.

 

 

 

 

 

ABOUT WWHI

• Every 90 seconds, a woman dies from pregnancy or childbirth-related complications. 99% of maternal deaths each year occur in developing countries, such as Senegal.

• Our vision is that women and girls in developing countries have positive, healthy experiences with pregnancy and childbirth. That they know their options, can make their own choices, and can access quality care.

• Malaria is one of the leading causes of maternal mortality. Last year, WWHI launched a community-based malaria program that educates women of child-bearing age, as well as prevents and treat the deadly disease from killing them. Having enough trained local health workers is the number one priority in continuing this program.

-------------------------------

OUR FUNDRAISING GOAL

Our goal is to raise $8,000. By giving $700 for one health worker, we can provide access to healthcare to 152 women. If we can support 8 health workers with only $8,000, we will multiply our reach to 1,216 women. More than half of these very women have never accessed or had access to help. Can you imagine the impact on these women and their families?

  

DO THE MATH

 

 

 

 

THE WWHI TEAM

 

Dana Allison, founder and executive director of WWHI, has been a champion of social justice since childhood. A native of Alberta, Canada, she has long believed that the strength of a country's women determines the strength of a nation. After graduating from the University of Chicago, Dana researched the mental health of HIV-infected refugee women. Her interest in medicine grew and in 2006 she began medical school at the University of Utah. During her studies, she interned with the UN Refugee Agency in Mae La, Thailand, and participated in and researched obstetrical and infant care. Because of her experiences in the developing world, Dana founded WWHI to help empower vulnerable communities.

 

  

Dr. Youssoupha Ndiaye is a practicing physician in Saraya, Senegal. He has dedicated his career to increasing access to basic healthcare in the rural communities of Senegal. He received his MD at Cheikh Anta Diop University and a doctorate in public health at Leeds University in England. He has held many leadership positions, including his role as deputy medical chief officer at the Kedougou Health District and as the medical chief officer in Saraya, Senegal.

 

 

 

Dr. Mamoudou Bocoum, a specialist in occupational medicine, graduated with an MD from the University Cheikh Anta Diop. He works as chief medical doctor for Oromin Joint Venture Group. He also oversees the social health program at Oromin, which includes training and capacity building of health workers, community matrons and the supply of essential drugs and the prevention of HIV / AIDS. "I'm pleased to work with WWHI to fight against maternal and infant mortality."

 

 

 

And, of course, our Board of Directors

Dr. Youssoupha Ndiaye is a practicing physician in Saraya, Senegal. He has dedicated his career to increasing access to basic healthcare in the rural communities of Senegal. He received his MD at Cheikh Anta Diop University and a doctorate in public health at Leeds University in England. He has held many leadership positions, including his role as deputy medical chief officer at the Kedougou Health District and as the medical chief officer in Saraya, Senegal.
 
 
 

Dr. Mamoudou Bocoum, a specialist in occupational medicine, graduated with an MD from the University Cheikh Anta Diop. He works as chief medical doctor for Oromin Joint Venture Group. He also oversees the social health program at Oromin, which includes training and capacity building of health workers, community matrons and the supply of essential drugs and the prevention of HIV / AIDS. "I'm pleased to work with WWHI to fight against maternal and infant mortality."
 
 
 
And, of course, our Board of Directors

story:
Envision... a world where mental health is viewed and treated with the same gravity as physical health. Screening for Mental Health and the Thomas Scattergood Behavioral Health Foundation are taking action to make this a reality but we need your help.

The Issue: Currently, one in four Americans has a diagnosable behavioral health condition in the United States yet the vast majority do not seek treatment. In Philadelphia, these rates rise to 30%. One of the leading deterrents for seeking treatment for those living with these conditions is fear and stigma.

Taking Action: This year we created the first of its kind behavioral health kiosk, located in a Philadelphia-based ShopRite QCare clinic. Designed for use in public spaces, our kiosks aim to reduce stigma by making learning about and screening for treatable conditions like depression or anxiety as commonplace as a blood pressure screening.

Our kiosk provides users with:

  • An assessment of their behavioral health

  • Information on whether their assessment is consistent with a behavioral health disorder

  • An overview of the signs and symptoms of behavioral health disorders

  • Information on local treatment options

Why We Need Your Help

Screening for Mental Health and the Thomas Scattergood Behavioral Health Foundation are launching a crowdfunding campaign to five behavioral health kiosks to the Philadelphia area, continuing our collaboration with Philadelphia's Department of Behavioral Health and Intellectual disAbility Services.

We will:

  1. Develop new kiosks

  2. Identify and secure locations

  3. Assist locations with promotion

  4. Coordinate kiosk delivery

  5. Train staff on kiosk use and mental health awareness

  6. Evaluate kiosk use

The Scattergood Foundation will match the first $5,000, underscoring their commitment to the city of Philadelphia. Donations beyond our goal will fund the development and placement of additional kiosks.

The Impact: Organizations throughout Philadelphia have the opportunity to serve as pilots for a leading national best practice health model. Two organizations, Drexel University Office of Counseling & Health and the 11th Street Family Health Services are the first kiosk sites for this pilot.

For more information about behavioral health kiosks, please visit Screening for Mental Health, Inc. at mentalhealthscreenin.org. 

About Us

Screening for Mental Health, Inc., the pioneer of large-scale mental health screening for the public, provides innovative mental health and substance abuse resources, linking those in need with quality treatment options. Programs, offered online and in-person, educate, raise awareness, and screen individuals for common mental and behavioral health disorders and suicide.

The Thomas Scattergood Behavioral Health Foundation is a facilitator of innovation and conversation concerning behavioral health. During the past year we convened a national conference on behavioral health, organized and presented an Innovation Award, which received entries from 61 organizations, hosted a web-based design challenges, and launched a stigma-reduction project.

story: My friend, a recent Nuclear Engineering Graduate, applied to Professional Engineers of Ontario on paper, as engineers are used to doing, so that he may become an Engineering Intern (EIT) and thus begin a fulfilling career in engineering. Within 6 months of graduation, such an application qualifies one for the financial credit program, by which Professional Engineers of Ontario waives the $300 application fee. My friend applied within that time frame in good faith, only to be told after the 6 month window to reapply online. The ruthless bureaucracy failed to yield yet again, refusing his petition for an extension in light of the fact that he had already applied. Without an engineering licence, my friend will have no choice but to get a job in IT, HR, or a regulator. Imagine if you will, the immensity of the heartbreak for an engineer to be wasting away in HR - doing nothing, being nothing. Please donate generously this holiday season - donate to save a soul.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Merril and I am a member of the Moreton Bay Table Tennis Association Inc., based in Queensland, Australia.  

At our club, we are passionate about the cause of women's table tennis and we don't believe we are the only ones.

For too long the major prize money at Table Tennis events has gone to the men. While there is often a ‘Women’s Only’ event in a tournament, the larger prize money and prestige is attached to the men's events.  This just seems wrong to us, as we know the women work just as hard as the men.  

The Women's National Table Tennis Challenge demonstrates our desire to give women and girls, a tournament that not only offers substantial monetary incentives for competitors, but also allows them to enjoy being feminine.

Through your contribution we believe that the Women's National will open the eyes of the public to a sport that is safe and fun for women to play. We also believe that both the elite and aspiring club women of Table Tennis in Australia, will feel valued and supported by the offering of a prestigious, well-run and lucrative tournament.

What We Need & What You Get

With your help we hope to raise $2,000.  Of this $400 will go towards covering the cost of hosting the event, and $1,600 will go towards the prize pool. Any additional funds raised will go towards both the prize pool, and future Women's National events.  All money raised will be used only for the Women's National Table Tennis Challenge event.


The field is limited to 24 players, ranging in ability from elite to competent club players.  It is our desire to give back to, not just the best, but to those regular women players, who hone their skills and play in clubs across our nation. 

Twelve places will be reserved for the top twelve seeds who nominate.  The host club will allocate positions to four players, while the final 8 places will be determined by ballot (if there are more nominations than available places.)

We intend that, through the money raised from this campaign, every player who comes will be rewarded, both for their participation in the event and as a thank you for their involvement in our sport.  All monies raised will be used only for this event and the more we raise, the greater the reward for the players will be. 

As a small incentive and thank you for contributing, everyone who donates will have their name on an honour board displayed at the event.  Those who donate $50 will also receive a unique “I support the Women’s National Table Tennis Challenge” bumper sticker.  Those who contribute $100 or more will receive the bumper sticker and a limited edition Women’s National Table Tennis Challenge cap.

Should we fail to achieve our goal, all monies raised will still go towards rewarding the players and the running of this event.

The Impact

With limited funds this event was held for the first time in 2013 and its impact was immediately positive.  Feedback from those who participated included “….a wonderful day for Women's Table Tennis…” “…struck the right balance between a competitive yet friendly, welcoming and sociable atmosphere…”  “…not only was it a pleasure to participate, I think the hundreds of speculators enjoyed the event too…”  “…Thank you so much for a great weekend of table tennis. [My daughter] having an intellectual disability finds it extremely hard to have competition. This event was absolutely brilliant for her. She was not intimidated by the strong males that she normally needs to play but had some great matches from all age levels and abilities…”

By contributing to this event you will be acknowledging the part women play in making the sport of table tennis the great family friendly sport it is.  You will also be saying to the world that you believe that woman’s table tennis deserves greater recognition.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially.  If this is you, you can still help us immensely by getting the word out there about our dream.  Please share this with as many of your friends as possible.  Like a rock thrown into a pond, the effect of your sharing can help create a ripple that makes its way around the world.

Thank you so much for hearing out what we are very excited about.  We trust our excitement has an infectious quality that will cause you to give and/or share, and help us make this event the celebration of women’s table tennis we believe it can, and will, become.

story:
Support our efforts in advancing drug discovery research to develop DJ-1 targeting clinical candidates with the ability to slow down and potentially prevent the onset of these neurodegenerative diseases!

At Gardedam Therapeutics jointly with our academic and biopharmaceutical collaborators, we have been engaged in drug discovery research for Parkinson’s disease and Alzheimer’s disease for over 5 years in the USA and world-wide. 

Our main therapeutic target is the DJ-1 protein. Loss and reduced function of DJ-1 has been linked to the onset of a variety of diseases such as Parkinson’s disease (link to study) , Alzheimer’s disease (link to study), stroke, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, and type II diabetes. The DJ-1 protein is considered to be one of the primary therapeutic targets for Parkinson’s disease and targeting it could yield added mechanistic benefits such as protection from oxidative stress and protein misfolding, which are pathological hallmarks of these neurodegenerative diseases.

Using our unique pharmaceutical chaperone drug discovery strategy, we identified novel small molecule drug candidates which interact with DJ-1 and were shown to have a therapeutically positive effect in neuronal models of Parkinson’s and Alzheimer's disease. To fully develop this therapy, we need additional mechanism of action studies in cells and in vivo models. Therefore, via this crowdfunding campaign we are raising funds to support our efforts in advancing our drug discovery research to develop a DJ-1 targeting clinical candidate.


Campaign Objectives

We have three main objectives, which we aim to pursue and fund independently from the funds raised according to the success of this campaign. In case our funding goal is exceeded we will use the additional funds for further in vivo studies as described in objective 1.


About Gardedam Therapeutics

Gardedam Therapeutics is an early-stage biotechnology company founded in 2009. Our objective is to pursue groundbreaking research to develop novel and first in class drug candidates as well as imaging agents for the treatment and diagnosis of Parkinson’s and Alzheimer’s disease. We operate with an innovative mindset and in an open partnership with patients and their families, scientists, clinicians and other professionals from academic and biopharmaceutical organizations world-wide. More information about our team and collaborators is given at the Gardedam Therapeutics website and below.



So far we have received financial support for our research activities primarily from non-profit organizations such as the M. J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson’s Disease Research and from collaborative governmental grants.


Link to grant details: https://www.michaeljfox.org/foundation/grant-de..., https://www.michaeljfox.org/foundation/grant-de...).


About Parkinson’s (PD) and Alzheimer’s Disease (AD)

PD and AD are degenerative, neurological disorders, which are characterized by the loss of neurons in the brain, ultimately causing death over a period of 2 to 20 years. PD triggers motor symptoms and cognitive impairment, ranging from mild memory difficulties to dementia, and mood disorders, such as depression and anxiety. AD results in loss of memory, cognitive functions, language skills, and behavioral changes. There is no cure for these diseases, only symptomatic, temporary treatments. Approximately, 40 million people are affected by AD and further 7 million people by PD world-wide. 


Misalignment between the costs for our society of AD and PD and funding research to find a cure: why crowdfunding?

The global disease burden is incredibly high for neurological diseases such as AD and PD.  It is estimated to be about $200 billion in the US per year for AD and other dementias according to a recent report by the Alzheimer’s Association and about  $11 billion per year for PD. The amount of money spent on funding research has been just one-hundredth compared to what we as a society spend on treating and taking care of patients.  More innovative and high-risk research and clinical trials can deliver highly sought after therapies and potentially a cure. However, not having enough funding for these activities have been limiting progress. Crowdfunding is an alternative funding route that may be able to partially deliver the highly needed financing of these research and development efforts.

Take Action Today for Tomorrow's Health

story:
Hi there, my name is Vivian Grace Ostan and I'm here to tell you my story.

For over a year and a half, I have been on a journey of self-discovery and self-care. Working with practitioners in naturopathy, soul guidance, and health and fitness has helped me to better understand who I am and how to respect my body.
My New Year's goal of 2013 was balance: standing on one foot and two, eating right, living and working, exercising, and resting. It was a give and take process, took a lot of effort, and had amazing results.

Today and every day, I honour my body, its resilience and its physical, mental, artistic, and emotional abilities. Each step has been a personal achievement and fills me with pride, from:

  • learning what motivates me;
  • trying, failing, trying, failing... yet never giving up;
  • strengthening my back muscles for improved posture;
  • understanding my body composition and accepting its changes;
  • pushing myself further; and
  • defeating 16 years of being diagnosed as borderline diabetic.

On September 29, 2014 I begin a new journey of continued courage, growth, strength, and commitment to myself and others. I start my training to be a contender fighter in the third annual Fight 4 The Cause. A charity boxing event, that brings community together, on many different levels from those training and fighting, to their coaches and support teams, to the local charities. Past charities who have benefited include The Mustard Seed, Help Fill a Dream, Free the Children, and Leukemia and Lymphoma Society.

www.fight4thecause.ca

I have teamed up with my amazing friend and local small business owner, Kate Shelton of Tonic Spatique to sponsor me for this event. Kate's expertise in health and posture, relaxation, and how to restore and vitalize is her support contribution to ensuring my body is relaxed and ready during my 8 week training program and fight night. I am so grateful for her support.

In registering for the Fight 4 The Cause there is a monetary portion for training. I am paying this on my own. However, I am asking anyone that knows my story, believes in my courage and strength and in supporting the local Victoria community, to consider making a contribution towards my goal. My goal is one-third of the total costs for my training.

All support and generosity is greatly appreciated.

While financial contributions will not receive a tax receipt, please check out the Perks to see what you will receive in exchange.

Thank You!
Vivian Grace :)

Imagine

Imagine lying in a hospital bed nearly 2,000 miles away from your home, in a tropical country, with no one to reach out to and being told by the local
doctors that your immune system is dangerously low and would require an immediate blood transfusion.
A frantic team of doctors persistently alerting you of the severity of your condition.  Weighing 337 lbs, exploding with mucus, 105 temperature, unable to walk due to exhaustion and extremely low potassium levels.
While gazing out of the hospital, at the Caribbean sea,  a gentle voice whispers "Nature will heal you".  In that moment you  realize the gift and opportunity to connect with your "true self".
You release yourself from the hospital in full confidence of an absolute recovery and begin the healing journey with Mother Nature.
This is my true and ongoing story of how honoring my inner voice inspired me to take my health, mind and body to a higher level while sharing the gift of life with you!

Health issues are directly linked to the lack of integrating a holistic sustainable approach to every day living.
~Akashi

I Am Because Of You!


Living Akashi has touched the lives of a few thousand people in 300 homes, 35 states and 5 countries globally since 2010!
Supporting others on their personal journey to wholeness by sharing the message of self love and how to align with it is the fuel that continues to charge my soul today.
Living Akashi is a path to aligning ones self with your inner ability to heal which begins by making a commitment to live and live life abundantly.
Daily commitment to eating vegan living foods, participating in mind/body therapy through meditation, yoga and intentional love, herbal compounds, a naturally healing environment and a guide to assist in your personal transformation is the
Journi.


Realizing The Vision


After six years of global travel, experiencing very personal and intimate stories,  disheartening diagnosis and transformations to many, I Am now ready to realize my vision in an environment suited for healing. 
In 2017,  I will launch my own sustainable wholeness community in the rich and healing parish of Portland, Jamaica.
This community will include organic farming,  an herbal clinic, healing foods cafe, meditation and yoga center, arts and culture therapy space, outdoor spa, and nine cottages for long term healing therapy.
This is The Living Akashi Transformation Center
I Am grateful to introduce a holistic platform to sustainable community development.  
Our health is our greatest asset, make an investment that will return to you abundantly

~Akashi

Our Goal & Gift To You

Sowing seeds of love into our Holistic Sustainable Community will transform the lives of the individuals that partake in this experience as well as the natives that live in Portland, Jamaica.  There will be opportunities for the natives to share their gifts of healing through their ancient and passed down knowledge of the healing powers of herbs, ital/natural plant based foods, the transforming powers of the waters, natural skin and body products and endless ways to align you with your inner power to heal yourself.  We currently hold retreats in this area and have access to many of the beautiful treasures that Portland has to offer however we do not own the land.
This is what our campaign is about.
We are prepared to make an offer this season and are here to raise additional funds to seal the deal!
The total cost to purchase  the land, begin clearing and farming is $9,000.
Several generous supporters have agreed to be present to assist by volunteering their time to farm, build and share their experience of "how to create" a sustainable community.
We welcome you to join this effort!
Please stand with us in our mission by giving whatever feels right for you.
Share this project with all of your friends, family, social media connections and anyone who you know will benefit from what we are offering

Don't forget to select your perk on the right side bar by clicking on it -
We have several exciting perks for our generous contributors
One of my favorites:
Contribute $9,000 and you will be buying into the land to use 10 consecutive days annually until 2022.  This part of the land is yours to use in accordance with holistic guidelines and keeping the integrity of this intentional community in tact.
(Excellent Opportunity For Retreat Facilitators)

The Land



Wellness Discovered In Paradise

Portland, Jamaica is thee gateway portal to the ultimate healing for your soul. Tranquility and peace will be your guide as you discover ancient mystical rain forest with backdrops of wise musical calls of the bird Queendom. Abundant herbs, roots and fruits await your palette...Prepare to be pleased. Nights are cool and complement the warming rise of the sun. Stand in your Power as you on look the sea from your Royal mountain views. The Blue Mountains peak reaches a glorious 7,402 ft above sea level and what you will behold are seemingly infinite waves of cove, blue lagoon, coral reef, roaring rivers, cascading falls. Divine elements surround you and you will be humbled by it's magnitude. Stars bright, stars light and guide you to your destiny true. Allow yourself to be fully present with Jamaica and all of her soothing and rejuvenating powers.

Welcome To "Living Akashi" in Portland, Jamaica.


Thank You For Supporting My Vision




________________________________________________  

What is low immune function?

Low immune function refers to an underactive and poor performing immune system. The immune system’s prime function is to protect the body against infection and the development of cancer. Support and enhancement of the immune system is perhaps the most important step in achieving resistance to disease and reducing susceptibility to colds, flu and cancer. Supporting the immune system involves a health-promoting lifestyle, stress management, regular body movement, a healthy vegan lifestyle and the appropriate use of nutritional supplements and herbal medicines.

If you answer “yes” to any of the following questions, it is a sign that your immune system needs support:

  • Do you catch colds easily?
  • Do you get more than two colds a year?
  • Are you suffering chronic infection?
  • Do you get frequent cold sores or have genital herpes?
  • Are your lymph glands sore and swollen at times?
  • Do you have now or have you ever had cancer?

Recurrent or chronic infections-even very mild colds-only occur when the immune system is weakened. Under such circumstances, there is a repetitive cycle that makes it difficult to overcome the tendency toward infection: a weakened immune system leads to infection, infection causes damage to the immune system, which further weakens resistance. Enhancing the immune system can provide the answer to breaking the cycle.

What causes low immune function?

The health of the immune system is greatly impacted by a person’s emotional state, level of stress, lifestyle, dietary habits and nutritional status. Nutrient deficiency is the most frequent cause of a depressed immune system. An overwhelming number of clinical and experimental studies indicate that any single nutrient deficiency can profoundly impair the immune system.



By supporting this project you will co create a sacred space that offers health education, self empowerment, body purification and healing to people who have experienced a compromised immune system due to multiple circumstances and various diagnosis of the mind, body and spirit who are seeking a holistic and effective approach to their situation.

We are so grateful to you and your support ~Living Akashi
story_txt:
ImagineImagine lying in a hospital bed nearly 2,000 miles away from your home, in a tropical country, with no one to reach out to and being told by the local doctors that your immune system is dangerously low and would require an immediate blood transfusion.A frantic team of doctors persistently alerting you of the severity of your condition.  Weighing 337 lbs, exploding with mucus, 105 temperature, unable to walk due to exhaustion and extremely low potassium levels.While gazing out of the hospital, at the Caribbean sea,  a gentle voice whispers "Nature will heal you".  In that moment you  realize the gift and opportunity to connect with your "true self". You release yourself from the hospital in full confidence of an absolute recovery and begin the healing journey with Mother Nature. This is my true and ongoing story of how honoring my inner voice inspired me to take my health, mind and body to a higher level while sharing the gift of life with you!Health issues are directly linked to the lack of integrating a holistic sustainable approach to every day living.~Akashi

I Am Because Of You!

Living Akashi has touched the lives of a few thousand people in 300 homes, 35 states and 5 countries globally since 2010!Supporting others on their personal journey to wholeness by sharing the message of self love and how to align with it is the fuel that continues to charge my soul today.Living Akashi is a path to aligning ones self with your inner ability to heal which begins by making a commitment to live and live life abundantly.Daily commitment to eating vegan living foods, participating in mind/body therapy through meditation, yoga and intentional love, herbal compounds, a naturally healing environment and a guide to assist in your personal transformation is the Journi.
Realizing The Vision
After six years of global travel, experiencing very personal and intimate stories,  disheartening diagnosis and transformations to many, I Am now ready to realize my vision in an environment suited for healing.  In 2017,  I will launch my own sustainable wholeness community in the rich and healing parish of Portland, Jamaica. This community will include organic farming,  an herbal clinic, healing foods cafe, meditation and yoga center, arts and culture therapy space, outdoor spa, and nine cottages for long term healing therapy.This is The Living Akashi Transformation CenterI Am grateful to introduce a holistic platform to sustainable community development.   Our health is our greatest asset, make an investment that will return to you abundantly~Akashi 

   Our Goal & Gift To You

Sowing seeds of love into our Holistic Sustainable Community will transform the lives of the individuals that partake in this experience as well as the natives that live in Portland, Jamaica.  There will be opportunities for the natives to share their gifts of healing through their ancient and passed down knowledge of the healing powers of herbs, ital/natural plant based foods, the transforming powers of the waters, natural skin and body products and endless ways to align you with your inner power to heal yourself.  We currently hold retreats in this area and have access to many of the beautiful treasures that Portland has to offer however we do not own the land. This is what our campaign is about. We are prepared to make an offer this season and are here to raise additional funds to seal the deal!The total cost to purchase  the land, begin clearing and farming is $9,000.Several generous supporters have agreed to be present to assist by volunteering their time to farm, build and share their experience of "how to create" a sustainable community. We welcome you to join this effort!Please stand with us in our mission by giving whatever feels right 
for you. Share this project with all of your friends, family, social media connections and anyone who you know will benefit from what we are offeringDon't forget to select your perk on the right side bar by clicking on it -We have several exciting perks for our generous contributorsOne of my favorites:Contribute $9,000 and you will be buying into the land to use 10 consecutive days annually until 2022.  This part of the land is yours to use in accordance with holistic guidelines and keeping the integrity of this intentional community in tact.(Excellent Opportunity For Retreat Facilitators)The Land









Wellness Discovered In Paradise





Portland, Jamaica is thee gateway portal to the ultimate healing for your soul.  Tranquility and peace will be your guide as you discover ancient mystical rain forest with backdrops of wise musical calls of the bird Queendom. Abundant herbs, roots and fruits await your palette...Prepare to be pleased. Nights are cool and complement the warming rise of the sun. Stand in your Power as you on look the sea from your Royal mountain views. The Blue Mountains peak reaches a glorious 7,402 ft above sea level and what you will behold are seemingly infinite waves of  cove, blue lagoon, coral reef, roaring rivers, cascading falls. Divine elements surround you and you will be humbled by it's magnitude. Stars bright, stars light and guide you to your destiny true.  Allow yourself to be fully present with Jamaica and all of her soothing and rejuvenating powers.  

Welcome To "Living Akashi" in Portland, Jamaica. 



Thank You For Supporting My Vision 




________________________________________________   

What is low immune function?

Low immune function refers to an underactive and poor performing 
immune system. The immune system’s prime function is to protect the body
 against infection and the development of cancer. Support and 
enhancement of the immune system is perhaps the most important step in 
achieving resistance to disease and reducing susceptibility to colds, 
flu and cancer. Supporting the immune system involves a 
health-promoting lifestyle, stress management, regular body movement, a healthy vegan lifestyle and the 
appropriate use of nutritional supplements and herbal medicines.
If you answer “yes” to any of the following questions, it is a sign that your immune system needs support:

Do you catch colds easily?
Do you get more than two colds a year?
Are you suffering chronic infection?
Do you get frequent cold sores or have genital herpes?
Are your lymph glands sore and swollen at times?
Do you have now or have you ever had cancer?

Recurrent or chronic infections-even very mild colds-only occur when 
the immune system is weakened. Under such circumstances, there is a 
repetitive cycle that makes it difficult to overcome the tendency toward
 infection: a weakened immune system leads to infection, infection 
causes damage to the immune system, which further weakens resistance. 
Enhancing the immune system can provide the answer to breaking the 
cycle.
What causes low immune function?
The health of the immune system is greatly impacted by a person’s 
emotional state, level of stress, lifestyle, dietary habits and 
nutritional status. Nutrient deficiency is the most frequent cause of a 
depressed immune system. An overwhelming number of clinical and 
experimental studies indicate that any single nutrient deficiency can 
profoundly impair the immune system.
 




By supporting this project you will co create a sacred space that 
offers health education, self empowerment, body purification and healing to people who have 
experienced a compromised immune system due to multiple circumstances and various diagnosis of the mind, body and spirit who are seeking a holistic and effective approach to their 
situation.
We are so grateful to you and your support ~Living Akashi

story:
Born and raised in Sri Lanka, Gaya Samarasingha had the opportunity to come to the United States to go to college thanks to an entrepreneurial mom who was determined to provide her children the opportunities she never had. After graduating, Gaya worked in corporate America for nearly a decade before making the decision to found Kalaia™. Kalaia's mission extends far beyond beautiful skin. We are a company that is built with the mission to empower female entrepreneurs, just like Gaya's mom, both through our sales and marketing strategy, and our charitable program, Kalaia Cares™. By supporting this  project,  you are going to impact the lives  of  many  hardworking, savvy women who  are  brave enough to go after  their  dreams.  

We  combined   wholesome, natural  ingredients from around the world with modern technology and delivery systems to  create  a product  line that will  leave  you with  glowing,  smooth, beautiful skin.  

Beauty is all  about preventing damage,  enhancing  the natural beauty and aging beautifully! 

Keep Smooth Day & Night Serum™ - A multi-tasking serum that combines Indian Gentian leaf extract - a unique natural ingredient native to India, peptide molecules, Kalaia's proprietary Bright & Blur Complex™, and a proprietary blend of Fragrance with Purpose™ to brighten the skin while improving its texture leaving you with glowing, silky-smooth skin day and night. 

 Hold Tight Overnight Moisturizer™ - A moisturizer that is designed to work its magic overnight combines bamboo silica, pea extract, Kalaia's proprietary Bright & Blur Complex™, and a proprietary blend of Fragrance with Purpose™ to blur the look of fine lines and wrinkles by increasing skin hydration for rejuvenated and firmer looking skin. 

Kalaia's proprietary Bright & Blur Complex™ combines Gotu Kola and Turmeric, two natural ingredients that are native to Sri Lanka, with vitamin B3, vitamin E, and stable vitamin C to brighten and blur the look of fine lines and wrinkles for glowing, youthful skin that is Photo Fresh™ and selfie ready at all times. 

Kalaia's Fragrance with Purpose™ is the natural, non-synthetic, fragrance blend found in Kalaia products. Made from a hand-picked proprietary blend of essential oils and extracts that are known to have unique skin benefits and have been used in skin care rituals around the world for thousands of years. Fragrance with Purpose means it’s good for you, beautiful! 

Dreams are universal, but opportunity is not—to make a difference 1% of all Kalaia sales go towards supporting female entrepreneurs around the world through our charitable program, Kalaia Cares. Kalaia Cares will support savvy, hardworking women through a micro loan program. We are proud to partner with Kiva.org to reach these entrepreneurs and to provide them the financial resources that they may not have through their own communities. 

All perks include Indiegogo exclusive FREE shipping, many perks include a generous discount or exclusive items as a way of us saying thank you for being an early supporter of the Kalaia Movement™.

story:
**Thank you for everyone who contributed to Round 1 of Funding!  Let's make it the final round!**

Our Story

You may be familiar with Tammy Sytch, wrestling's Original Diva (Sunny from the WWE), for her abilities in the wrestling industry, but did you know she's an avid and passionate cook?  We are launching her first cookbook and would love you to be apart of it in a very unique campaign!


 
 

The Impact

This book will include recipes from Tammy as well as stories from the road!  With your contribution to help us raise funds for the publication of this project, you too will be apart of history!  This is the first book that will ever be published with the help of wrestling fans in the wrestling industry where they will also be part of the success!

 
 

What We Need & What You Get

For your contribution, you will receive:


-$15:  8x10 photo of Tammy 

-$20:  Personalized 8x10 photo of Tammy

-$25:   Name listed in Thank You section of book

-$50:   Name listed plus personally signed copy of book

-$100:  Name listed plus personally signed copy of book plus photo of Tammy signing the book

-$500:  Name listed plus personally signed copy plus short video of Tammy signing and thanking you for your donation.  Be a part of History. Anyone who donates $500 not only receives a signed copy of the book, but will also have one of YOUR recipes featured. Yes, Tammy will make you famous!



 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  Thanks for supporting Tammy!
Bambi Weavil
Tammy's Agent

TammySytchOnline.com

OutImpactProductions.com

story:
(The photo above was taken by BIll and Janet Montgomery, with whom I may have the opportunity to serve. It is entitled 'Children of Pays-Pourri' and you can find other pictures like it on their website justmercy.org)

  As part of the global one percent, my development has been the focus of great support: a loving family, healthy food on the table everyday, security where ever I go, education, outdoor experiences and the opportunity to become who ever I wish to be. I consider it my proud duty to give back to the world which has allowed me such affluence. It is my heartfelt wish serve where I am needed most.

  On January 18th I am traveling to Haiti with a team of nurses. Our goal is to make a difference to the lives of individuals by providing basic healthcare and nutrition. For two weeks we will operate out of a clinic, then the nurses will return to the USA. I, however, will stay for as long as I can be of help (at least a year I hope). 

  As some of you know, I recently achieved a wilderness EMT certification. Over my years with the Adventure Leadership Institute (at Oregon State University) I have gained experience with medicine, travel, logistics and leadership in an outdoor setting. This will allow me to fill a variety of support roles in my team and with local communities. 

My personal goals for the trip are as follows: 
- Makes a difference to the lives of individuals.
- Gain experience in my medical and outdoor skill sets, and learn how a disaster context affects application.
- Experience first hand the extreme poverty in which billions worldwide live, so that I may choose a course in life which addresses the roots of inequality. 

  Unfortunately such trips do not come 'all expense's paid' nor with an income. I am working and doing portraiture to raise money and so far I have bought a plane ticket, travel insurance, and a few other necessities out of pocket however, I need help. 
  Your donations will directly affect my ability to aid the people around me. The first $1000 will go to keeping me safe (inoculations and malaria medication primarily). The $400 after that will go toward room and board: to the organizations and people who will house me while I find my footing. That last $600 will be dedicated to buying over the counter medications, antibiotics and vitamin supplements (adult, child and prenatal) in bulk. These simple conveniences of our country will save lives in Haiti.

  I understand that we are in difficult economic times, but realize that this is a global problem for which the poorest 50% will suffer more then you or I. Every dollar counts.

 Thank you for your support and blessings,
  with love and gratitude, 

        Jake Welch

story:
Josh Needs Your Help

Joshua Smith turned 21 in December.  A week before his 21st birthday he was diagnosed with synovial sarcoma; a rare cancer (only 1 out of 1 million people) that affects children and young adults.  
 
Joshua will be undergoing inpatient chemotherapy (three day courses every three weeks for 6 months) and radiation twice a day for 6 weeks, surgery and physical therapy.  
 
Due to the economy, I have lost my job and have no income and of course, Joshua cannot work.  
 
We have to travel back and forth as no one treats this type of cancer where we live and it is a 4 hour drive one way.   We need to raise $10,000 for lodging, gas and groceries to help throughout this long process.

Since the economy started falling I have lost my house, my car and my job  I really need help with funds to get my son back and forth to Shands where they specialize in this type of rare cancer.  We are looking at trips back and forth to Shands for chemotherapy and radiation through May 2013.  I know he has to have surgery but I have not been given a date for that.
 
Please help with a donation, no matter how small, if you can.
 
Missy,
Josh's Mom.

Other Ways You Can Help

If a financial contribution isn't possible for you right now, you can still help. We welcome all the assistance we can get just spreading the word.  You can email friends, post to Facebook, Twitter and any other social networks you use.......whatever you feel is appropriate to do.  Indiegogo has some great share tools that make it easy.  

Thank you, thank you, thank you!

story:
What Would One Million Toonies Do?

 

For a toonie (Canadian $2 coin)  you could buy half a latte?

Buy just over a liter in gas?

Part of a bus ride?

This is a call for people’s two toned coins to help fund cancer retreat in the Rockies. More cancer patients than ever are surviving the intensive cancer treatments. The mental and physical impact of cancer does not disappear when treatments are done and yet we stop providing any treatment.

Cancer survivors often face physical, emotional, psychosocial, spiritual and financial challenges as a result of their diagnosis and this retreat would offer a place for survivors to unplug, and unwind to focus on what matters most in their lives. The retreat would also offer practical health behavior counselling specific to cancer survivors on physical activity and nutrition to help prevent secondary disease, recurrence, and aid long-term effects of treatment. Helping them get on track and make the best of the rest of their lives. This will all be accomplished in the most beautiful scenery in the world.

Fueled by a truly inspiring passion, PhD student at the University of Alberta, Lisa Belanger has started the seemingly impossible task of raising 1 million toonies (or 2 million dollars) to purchase and operate a retreat for cancer survivors in the Rockies.

Lisa’s  Inspiration

When I was 16, my best friend, Jane Knight, was diagnosed with cancer. That phone call – those words – changed my life.  In the time we had left we did everything we could to make every day count. Two years later, Jane passed away. I miss my friend every moment of every day, but that drive to live my days to the fullest, which Jane and her struggle had brought into life, continues to shape my outlook on life and to propel me forward – I do it not just for myself, but for both of us.

Inspired by Jane, I based my Masters and, later, my PhD studies around work with cancer survivors and exercise. Over the course of my academic endeavours I have been honored to work with some absolutely incredible and stimulating individuals, whose determination and strength have given my studies focus.

From the very first step survivors take on the treadmill, they are taking back control of their health. That initiation of change – those brave first steps – have become my passion. I have long pondered how we can provide not only the tools for taking control of health but also the inspiration – Knight’s Cabin is my answer.

I realize this is a HUGE dream- but I think we can all see the value in it. I will not stop until it is realized. Please pass this on to anyone who may be interested. THANK you soooo much!!!

 

- LB

story:
Swinging! Wheee! Children love to swing all over the world. Unfortunately, many kids have never even seen a swing... That's why we're going to Uganda - in East Africa - to install 10 swing sets at isolated rural orphanages and schools. 

Swinging isn't just "all fun and games." Neuroscience reveals it promotes brain development, plus it stimulates the vestibular (inner ear), enables sensory integration and attentiveness, improves coordination, visual perception, muscular development, and proprioception (body awareness). Plus, it provides opportunities for socialization. 

Uganda is a impoverished land-locked country that has a per capita income of only $567/year. Uganda also the highest rate of orphans in the world - more than 9% of the population is parentless due to AIDS, civil wars, and abandonment.  

Poverty forces Ugandan children to work incessantly. When we build swing sets, we give them a place to play. Swing sets also serve as "Kid Magnets” encouraging children to attend and stay in school. 

The swing sets cost $500 each. We have collected $2,000 thus far, enough money to purchase the parts and install four swing sets. Our goal now is to collect an additional $3,000 - this would enable us to put up 10 swing sets.

We buy all the swing parts in Uganda, to stimulate the local economy.

Here's a breakdown of our expenses, per swing set:

$36 each for the 4 legs and 1 crossbar  = $180

$50 each for the 2 joints that connect legs and crossbar  = $100

$24 each for the 4 hangers that hang the seats - $120

$20 each for the 5 chains and swing seats = $100 

TOTAL  $500 per swing set

6 swing sets = $3,000
