story:
*Update: (11/17/13) : the 181 Shirts were delivered through University of the Philippines instead of DSWD. they were now on the way to either Samar or Tacloban.

*Update: (11/14/13) : 181 Shirts will be delivered in Areas in Leyte through DSWD.



Short Summary

I'm Hanz Ray Ronquillo (26), I live in Manila, Philippines and working as a full-time freelance webdesigner.

Just 2 Days ago Philippines was hit by Super Typhoon Haiyan which is comparable to a Category 5 Hurricane. There were 10,000 feared dead and thousand more injured and missing, there were bridges, buildings, schools, and houses collapsed. 

*Update: as of now the total death toll were 2,300

and what's more sad is that southern part of Philippines was hit by Magnitude 7.1 earthquake just a week before the super typhoon haiyan cast it's catastrophe.

Just this morning I've seen the aftermath of the typhoon and thought of any means to help the victims, and crowd funding if the only way I can think of to raise funds for the medical and relief assistance of the victims.


This campaign aims to provide assistance to the victims in Southern Philippines specially in Leyte, Samar, and Palawan.


What We Need & What You Get

I need to reach whatever amount, $1 will go a long way for the victims of the typhoon.

I can only provide Pictures (If the foundation allows me to go with them) of people smiling while receiving there relief goods and medical assistance.

$1 = 5* Paracetamol (Medicine)
$5 = 14* 1L Bottle Water
$10 =  20* Canned Goods
$20 = 12* Shirts or 8* Blankets
$50 = Can Feed 10 Families in a Day
$100 = Can Feed 10 Families in a day and provide Dry Clothings
$350 = Can Feed 10 Families for a Week
$1000 = a small bamboo hut for 1 family
$2500 = a stone house for 1 family.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

    - You can share, tell, or blog about this campaign to other people and let them know that Philippines, Specially, Tacloban City needs there help.

    You can also send your donations to any reputable charity foundation that aims to help the victims of Typhoon Haiyan in the Philippines. 

    I also have a shirt which cost only $14 in teepublic. all commisions I get in there will go to support the relief operations.

    https://www.teepublic.com/show/7782-bangon-pilipinas


    Please Do Not Send your donations directly to the Philippine Government.

    *sad to say we have a corrupt government.
story_txt:
*Update: (11/17/13) : the 181 Shirts were delivered through University 
of the Philippines instead of DSWD. they were now on the way to either 
Samar or Tacloban.*Update: (11/14/13) : 181 Shirts will be delivered in Areas in Leyte through DSWD.Short SummaryI'm Hanz Ray Ronquillo (26), I live in Manila, Philippines and working as a full-time freelance webdesigner.Just 2 Days ago Philippines was hit by Super Typhoon Haiyan which is comparable to a Category 5 Hurricane. There were 10,000 feared dead and thousand more injured and missing, there were bridges, buildings, schools, and houses collapsed. *Update: as of now the total death toll were 2,300and what's more sad is that southern part of Philippines was hit by Magnitude 7.1 earthquake just a week before the super typhoon haiyan cast it's catastrophe.Just this morning I've seen the aftermath of the typhoon and thought of any means to help the victims, and crowd funding if the only way I can think of to raise funds for the medical and relief assistance of the victims.This campaign aims to provide assistance to the victims in Southern Philippines specially in Leyte, Samar, and Palawan.What We Need & What You GetI need to reach whatever amount, $1 will go a long way for the victims of the typhoon.I can only provide Pictures (If the foundation allows me to go with them) of people smiling while receiving there relief goods and medical assistance.$1 = 5* Paracetamol (Medicine)$5 = 14* 1L Bottle Water$10 =  20* Canned Goods$20 = 12* Shirts or 8* Blankets$50 = Can Feed 10 Families in a Day$100 = Can Feed 10 Families in a day and provide Dry Clothings$350 = Can Feed 10 Families for a Week$1000 = a small bamboo hut for 1 family$2500 = a stone house for 1 family.Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:- You can share, tell, or blog about this campaign to other people and let them know that Philippines, Specially, Tacloban City needs there help.You can also send your donations to any reputable charity foundation that aims to help the victims of Typhoon Haiyan in the Philippines. I also have a shirt which cost only $14 in teepublic. all commisions I get in there will go to support the relief operations.https://www.teepublic.com/show/7782-bangon-pilipinasPlease Do Not Send your donations directly to the Philippine Government.*sad to say we have a corrupt government.

story:
I have reached my goal of $1500 for 1 year of service.  Help me get to $3000 so I can stay for one more year and make sure this program is successful!


About Me

Hey, all!  My name is Kyle Lansden, and I'm a soon-to-be graduate of Gonzaga University in Spokane, WA.  I've been passionate about serving those who need it the most for many years in my life.  I've done mission trips to Nicaragua and the Blackfeet Indian Reservation in Browning, MT, as well as work with other service organizations in the past. 

I'm finally at the point in my life where I can do it for an extensive period of time and truly become invested in the community.  My philosophy about service is that I'm by no means going there to "fix" their problems.  I am simply using my skills in collaboration with the local people to help meet their needs. 

Education & Skills: I have a background in Spanish (B.A.) as well as health sciences (pre-requisites for nursing school) in addition to teaching many years of adaptive swim lessons and working with those who have disabilities.  This opportunity to work for and with those at Nuestros Pequeños Hermanos (NPH) is the perfect fit to put all of my skills to use. 

About the Organization

NPH is a wonderful organization (watch the video above, or click the link provided for additional info.).  With orphanages for abandoned children all over Latin America and the Caribbean, they try to provide resources to children who would otherwise have none.  They do not adopt the children out, and they are there as part of a permanent family to provide stability in their historically unstable lives.  Their idea is simple: provide rare opportunities so that the kids can one day become contributing members of society to raise their country out of poverty.  I firmly stand by the philosophy of NPH, and I can't wait to get started working for them! 

While the organization does so much in terms of providing quality education, housing, and food, in addition to other things that we often take for granted, they have asked me to perform a very specific task, which is rarely available to the disabled in developing nations: developing a water therapy program for their special education students and the local community!



My Work

My time with NPH will be a time for me to provide a much needed service that the orphanage in San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic has a great need for: providing therapy to their special education students.  A new special needs home has been constructed in the DR complete with a therapy pool. 

Main Objective: Because of my background with adaptive swim lessons and working with people with disabilities, along with my interests in one day entering the health field, they have asked me to collaborate with their physical and occupational therapists to provide a form of therapy that both builds the muscular strength as well as the self-esteem of the kids that I work with.  Because the program is brand new, I have also been asked to lay the foundation, in conjunction with the current staff, for the program and teach skills to the permanent caretakers so that the program becomes sustainable. 

Additional Work: In addition to my work as the pool therapist, I may be assigned to be the new health clinic assistant when the current volunteer leaves in June.  I will also be assigned to a house of boys, already managed by their permanent caregiver(s)), and be their mentor during my year in the DR.  I will eat lunch and dinner with them every day and plan weekend activities with them to further develop the NPH family.

I feel incredibly blessed to have been selected for this job, and I am honored to help in the formation of a rare program that will hopefully benefit the residents of the orphanage and the local community for years to come.

Your Donation

How the Money Will be Used: Your donation will help me to finance my year-long service in the Dominican Republic.  As a soon-to-be college grad (graduation is on May 11th!!!), I have accrued approximately $30,000 in debt during my four years at Gonzaga.  However, I will only be given a small stipend (about US$100 a month) from the organization, which I will use to buy personal necessities, and I need some way to help pay the interest on my loans while I am away. 

In the Perfect World...: Ideally, I would raise enough money to be able to stay for two full years so that I can really become immersed in the community and make sure that I am able to help lay a solid foundation for their new pool therapy program, but that all depends on my ability to keep up with my student loans (gosh darn financial responsibility!!). 

Your donation will make a life-long dream of making a real difference come true in addition to helping me discern where I am called in life with regards to my future career.  I will carry my experience in the Dominican Republic with me for the rest of my life in my calling to serve the least of our brothers and sisters. 

My Goal

I hope to raise $1500 to help pay the interest on my loans while I am abroad.  The closer I come to this goal, which I hope to surpass, the longer I will be able to serve in the Dominican Republic to give this developing program the attention that it needs and deserves.  Any donation, large or small, helps this dream become a reality.

The Impact

  • Supporting someone accomplish a task that is greater than his self
  • Enabling a rare program to develop and flourish
  • Allowing those with physical and mental disabilities to grow stronger physically, mentally, and emotionally through my dedicated work

Related Experience

Water Experience: I have been a lifeguard and taught regular and adaptive swim lessons at the Ventura Aquatic Center in Ventura, CA for approximately 6 years.  In addition, I coached our youth LA84 Foundation water polo team.  I have experience as a swimmer and water polo player.  

Working with People with Disabilities: My freshman and sophomore year at Gonzaga University, I was one of the coordinators for Gonzaga University Specialized Recreation (GUSR).  This is a program for adults with disabilities from the greater Spokane area to come and form relationships with members of the Gonzaga community.  We organized a play, which we performed at the end of every semester, as well as Special Olympics sports, which we competed in throughout various times of the year.  

Community Outreach & Project Design: In Spokane, WA, I currently work for a non-profit health clinic and treatment and community outreach center called NATIVE Project/NATIVE Health of Spokane.  I am their college intern, and my responsibilities have been to help with community outreach events.  We have Wellness programs every Wednesday night where I am in charge of the tutoring room, and this year I am on the board of our Youth Leadership Camp, which is designed to empower young, at-risk youth.

I hope to use these past skills and experiences to best serve the kids at NPH, share in struggles and triumphs, contribute to the betterment of an impoverished community, and form a relationship of mutual respect in which learning and the exchange of ideas goes in both directions. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Send prayers and positive thoughts so that I am successful in my endeavors
  • Get the word out, and make some noise about my campaign
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Our Story

Two years ago this December, our oldest boy was diagnosed with high-risk leukemia at two years of age.  Since then, we have been supported in so many ways by loved ones and strangers alike.  So in an effort to give back & to raise money for Childhood Cancer Research we have organized a few different fundraisers, while always trying to keep it creative and fun (like hosting a dodge ball event last year).

This year, in an effort to continue that creative approach we have created a weight loss challenge that invites everyone to participate with us. Over the course of the next two months I (John) will attempt to lose 35 lbs.  Anyone who wants to participate can do so in the following options:

·  You can make a single one-time donation OR

·  You can pledge an amount for each lb I drop

Here’s where it gets fun …since Katherine thinks I cannot achieve this goal, we have created a competition between the two of us.  For every pound I make over my goal (i.e. for every pound I lose in addition to the 35lb goal), Katherine must perform a challenge from a collection of ‘dares’.  Vice versa, for every pound I am under my goal amount, I must draw a dare and perform it.

If you decide to pledge a certain amount per pound lost, all you need to do is make the pledge on my FB page (John Griese).... then you can donate the amount once the final weigh loss is known.

For every participant that donates or makes a pledge for any amount, you will have the opportunity to add your own creative dare to the mix.  At the end of the two months we will put all of the dares in a hat and will draw them out one at a time.  Also, for every 50 likes we get on FB, I (John) will draw and perform an additional dare.

Remember, in the end, this is all about the kids!! ...September is Childhood Cancer Awareness (as well as Blood Cancer Awareness) Month.  We thank you all in advance for your support and participation.  Now get to work thinking of some creative dares!!

Thank you,

John and Katherine Griese 


**P.S. Dares must be safe, clean and relatively reasonable – remember these will be posted online so lets keep it classy San Diego!!

story:
The Lowdown on the Throwdown

Camp Cannibal is returning for its sixth SOAK!  It has been our privilege and pleasure to bring Oregon Burners our infamous ribs, hot dogs, bacon treats and breakfast fritters at SOAK all these years, and we are excited to do it again this summer. 

Camp Cannibal has become an indispensable institution of the Portland Burner community, and not just because of the quality and quantity of the animal flesh (okay, and vegetarian fare) that we sling.  Our camp also serves as an important social hub, one where people can strengthen the bonds of their relationships, forge new friendships and exchange furtive, flirty glances – all with barbecue sauce splattered on their face and rib meat stuck in their teeth. 

We need your support to make it this year!  With twenty-five volunteers working to feed more than two hundred people over a single weekend, your financial contribution will ensure there is an abundance of juicy, sizzling festival fare for everyone.

Please help us keep the Camp Cannibal grill burning at SOAK 2014!

Let's Talk Business

When you make a donation to Camp Cannibal, you won't just get the visceral satisfaction of seeing hundreds of hungry festivalgoers stuff their faces with sizzling flesh.  Here is a breakdown of how we will handle the money the community generously donates to our efforts - and what you can expect in return:
  • We have a higher fundraising goal this year, because we try to bring a bigger, better Camp Cannibal to SOAK every year.  We need $3500 for food costs, transportation of equipment, propane, plates, napkins and cleaning supplies, and food handlers' permits for our cooks (we are committed to exacting safety standards.) 
  • The Quid Pro Quo:  For your donations, you'll get all the tasty grub available to other SOAKers, and more:  Stickers, patches and aprons bearing the distinctive Camp Cannibal logo, and for our most generous donors, special culinary events like The Big Feed and The Fancy Feast.  
  • In order to bring you the biggest, best Camp Cannibal ever this year, we need to hit our fundraising goals.  If we come up short, however, rest assured that your donations are still being put to good use: Supplies, propane and the essentials for a skeleton operation at SOAK, including the "You Kill It, We Grill It" event where you bring us your food and we cook it for you.  If we don't meet our goals, we run the risk of food shortages, rationing and long lines - but we will be out there no matter what.  Any donations you make will help us do the best we can.
  • If we exceed our fundraising goals, you can look forward to brand new smokers and extra food for everyone - ensuring that all who come to us hungry can eat to their hearts' content.

Count On Us

Camp Cannibal has been a staple of the Portland Burning Man community, cooking at events like the Town Hall, the Burner Blender and SOAK, as well as at our famous Camp Cannibal Throwdowns.  At SOAK, we specialize in hangover recovery, recharging dancers and moonwalkers alike, and feeding the hungry masses of miscreants, misfits and mendicants that make ours the greatest regional Burn in the world.

Of course, as in previous years, we continue to keep a special grill free of contact with any meat in support of vegetarian and vegan festivalgoers.

As mentioned before, we have a perfect record of success in bringing Camp Cannibal to SOAK, so you can be sure that when you donate to us, we will accomplish what we set out to do.

We'll Take All The Help We Can Get

Not everyone can make a financial contribution, but everyone can participate.  Please help us get the word out about our IndieGoGo campaign by using the site's social media sharing tools, and telling your friends that we need help to make it back!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Graze Potter, 7010. I started playing Roller Derby in 2011 with the Sirens of Smash in Nelson, New Zealand. In 2012 i crossed the ditch and joined with Melbourne's Northside Rollers.
At that point I wasn't quite at bouting level but attended the bi-annual Great Southern Slam, Which is the largest Roller Derby event in the southern hemisphere, held in Adelaide, as a non-skating official. I had a blast, fell totally in love with roller derby and vowed that the next Great Southern Slam I would be skating in! Now that's happening this year, and I've made a team, now i just have to actually get there!

What I Need 

I need new skates. Desperately. I'm still skating on the second hand Riedels I bought when I first started Fresh Meat back in 2011. The wheels fall off while I'm skating. The boots have holes in them. It's tragic. I haven't got my heart set on anything in particular. depending on how successful this campaign is I may just be getting new trucks to keep my wheels on, or I may be able to get some nice new shiny skates. That parts up to you guys. I also need new protective gear. Mainly knee pads. I feel it every time i hit the ground, which, is every time I jam.

The other aspect this funding is going toward is travel and accommodation. I live in Far North Queensland. The Great Southern Slam is in Adelaide. That's 38 and a half hours of CONTINUOUS driving away. Each way. I'd really like to be able to fly.

 What You Get

Derby love. Unlimited amounts of derby love from a really broke, eager derby girl!

Good Karma

I'll make you dinner

The Impact

You get to help a Derby girl from a small-ish town in New Zealand go to the largest Roller Derby event in the southern hemisphere! which would make me really really happy! Which earns you good karma.
Also, If you're going to The Great Southern Slam you'll get to hit me :) :) :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my campaign, every time you share one person on your friends list might feel like being awesome and helping out a derby girl, and every single cent will help. If you live in Adelaide, a couch for queens birthday weekend would be magnificent, even somewhere to hand my hammock would be hugely appreciated!

story:
We are Primosand Productions and we've built a better mousetrap. 


We are a product development company located in Hermosa Beach Ca. Our new sports ball bag design has just been awarded a US non-provisional patent.

What's different: 
These are not your grandfather's ball bags. Our bags are completely different from anything you've ever seen or used in the past. 

To start with our bags are not hollow inside. Our bags have a bladder system inside of each bag. This patented bladder system is what allows our bags to hold their shape.

You can stand the bags on end or even sit on a bag filled with balls and it holds it shape. 

Our bags come in three sizes. 

We offer a 12 ball:

 

We offer a 16 ball bag:

 

and we offer a 20 ball "coach’s bag":


Our bags definitely turn heads when seen in public, from the eye popping, diamondback iridescent colors of our lightweight ripstop nylon body fabric to the shiny, soft and supple, yet strong nylon mesh. We use only the finest materials throughout our bags, like world renowned “YKK” coil zippers. Our bags are well made, elegant, eye catching and they offer ample exterior surface area for brand promotion and advertising.


Functionality:
What our ball bags have managed to do is take up to 20 of your particular sports balls and corral them into the smallest, most efficient space possible and lock them there until you are ready to unzip and release them.


With the stowable backpack straps in place the bag becomes a functional hands free backpack. 

With the backpack on your back and one bag in each hand, carried by our center handles,

one individual can unload from a vehicle and transport up to 60 sports balls to an event, tournament or large practice session.



We have been designing, revising, improving and prototyping our volleyball bags for a couple of years now.
Now that we have a finalized design and our patent is in place we are ready for our first "production run".


We invite you to donate to our project so we can make our dream of taking a new "product idea" from concept to fruition. 


Thank you for your support.

Jeff Byers

Primosand Productions
story_txt:
We are Primosand Productions and we've built a better mousetrap. 
We are a product development company located in Hermosa Beach Ca. Our new sports ball bag design has just been awarded a US non-provisional patent.What's different: These are not your grandfather's ball bags. Our bags are completely different from anything you've ever seen or used in the past. To start with our bags are not hollow inside. Our bags have a bladder system inside of each bag. This patented bladder system is what allows our bags to hold their shape.You can stand the bags on end or even sit on a bag filled with balls and it holds it shape. Our bags come in three sizes. We offer a 12 ball: We offer a 16 ball bag: and we offer a 20 ball "coach’s bag":
Our bags definitely turn heads when seen in public, from the eye popping, diamondback iridescent colors of our lightweight ripstop nylon body fabric to the shiny, soft and supple, yet strong nylon mesh. We use only the finest materials throughout our bags, like world renowned “YKK” coil zippers. Our bags are well made, elegant, eye catching and they offer ample exterior surface area for brand promotion and advertising.Functionality:What our ball bags have managed to do is take up to 20 of your particular sports balls and corral them into the smallest, most efficient space possible and lock them there until you are ready to unzip and release them.


With the stowable backpack straps in place the bag becomes a functional hands free backpack. With the backpack on your back and one bag in each hand, carried by our center handles, one individual can unload from a vehicle and transport up to 60 sports balls to an event, tournament or large practice session.
We have been designing, revising, improving and prototyping our volleyball bags for a couple of years now.Now that we have a finalized design and our patent is in place we are ready for our first "production run".

story:
We are HDScores, a Baltimore, Maryland based Startup founded in 2012, focusing on Food Safety, Data Transparency, and Data Distribution to get this important data into the hands of concerned consumers. 

Our App can tell you… “How clean is the restaurant you’re about to eat in?” 

HDScores wants to democratize health department inspection data on scale. Our Goal is to create the world’s largest health inspection report database, and make this data available in an easy to read, search and understand format for concerned consumers.

Some of the Application's Features:
Search by Location, Type of Cuisine, Hours of Operation
Save your Favorite Clean or Dirty Establishments
See How all Restaurants Compare to each other in Any Jurisdiction
See Featured Restaurants
See Recently Viewed Restaurants
Share Scores with your Friends via Facebook and Twitter

Our app was developed by a team of people Who Love to Eat Out... Led by a Chef and Few Talented Serial Entrepreneurs... We understand there are many factors in your choice of dining establishments. HDScores feels restaurant inspection reports put into an easy to read, search, and understand format will help you make better informed decisions. We see this as a chance to help you avoid restaurants with bad health inspection reports and highlight the good ones.   

With Your Support By Selecting a Perk on the Right Column, Together we can make the HDScores App a Reality.

What are HDScores Indiegogo’s Primary Goals?

iOS App with inspection data from around the United States at $5,000
- (Expected Delivery in June 2014)

What are HDScores Indiegogo’s Stretch Goals?

Android Version at $15,000 - (Expected Delivery in July 2014)
Windows 8 Phone Version at $20,000 - (Expected Delivery in August 2014)
Adding Additional Jurisdictions to the App in Launch at $30,000 
- (Expected Delivery in June 2014)

What Jurisdictions will our App be launching with?

HDScores App will be launching (currently) with the following Jurisdictions. 
(More may be added)

This is 40% of the 1,500,000 establishment and represents 43% of the population; 135,000,000+ people in jurisdictions that we have data for.  

Why Does HDScores needs so much money to build an our application? 

When you include the cost of all of our rewards, we have only an average 33% margin, including Indiegogo’s fees and Payment Processing Fees. While our cost for design and development is low, this is the financial model a Indiegogo campaign. Rest assure, we reviewed our costs and fees to make sure we can complete our project for our backers.

App Specs

Our app will support iOS 7 - (Expected Delivery in June 2014)

Stretch Goals

Android 4.x and Higher (Jelly Bean and Kit Kat) - (Expected Delivery in July 2014)

Windows 8 phone - (Expected Delivery in July 2014)

We Need Your Help!

We currently have a prototype of the HDScores App, and continuing to aggregating inspection data. We're also working on finalizing our design to make sure it meets our own and customers standards for a production ready scalable application. The funding from this Indiegogo campaign will allow us to finish designing developing and to distribute our complete application to our backers and the world.

Your funds will help us:

Finish development of the mobile applications.

Hopefully Hitting our Stretch Goals.

Aggregate more Inspection Data, Faster.

Get HDScores App in your Hands!


Meet our Team
HDScores has assembled a team of serial entrepreneurs with various backgrounds and the vision to change the way everyone works with inspection data, effecting public health and food safety. 

CEO/Founder – Matthew Eierman • Johnson & Wales University Alumni • Chef/Pastry Chef turned Serial Entrepreneur • 8 years Restaurant Industry • 4 years B2B Financial Services Company Management • 5th Startup

Co-Founder – William Sanford • Merchant Marine

CFO – Sanford Richardson • Old Dominion University Alumni • University of Virginia, MBA • Former CFO at JAVA, Taken a startup through all phases of an IPO, Eventually negotiated all JAVA Assets to Sun Micro Systems. • Managed contracts directly with Microsoft, Dell and DOD.

COO – Matthew Fleischer • CEO at Hook and Ladder Brewing Company•University of Maryland College Park, Smith School of Business,MBA • University Of Mary Washington Alumni

CTO – Andrew Phillips • Marquette University Alumni, (BS) in Electrical Engineering • Certified Scrum Master • 10 years Experience in Hardware, Software, Web and Mobile Development.

Data Analyst Intern - Arianna Brown • Towson University Student • Applied Mathematics/Computer Science Background • Working on Trend/Pattern Analysis and Data Visualizations for HDScores. 

Advisory Board
Data Scientist –Sean Murphy 
Sanitation Expert – Edward McKeown 
Sanitation Expert – Karen Recker 
Technical Writer – Aaron Sichel
Hospitality Advisor – Keith Rogers

Board of Directors Member – Mike Kavis 

Every Restaurant is required to have a health department inspection annually to be allowed to sell food to the public. 
However, every jurisdiction handles this data differently… all 3100 jurisdiction each have their own data formats, polices, procedures, and established laws for working with data. We understand this. HDScores has developed many innovative solutions to combat these challenges.

What does a Health Department Inspection Report Look Like? 

Inspection reports vary in every jurisdiction, but here is just one example from Washington, DC. Unless you have the time, and expertise to find and understand this form you will not gain any value from the existing government interface. 

Washington DC Health Inspection Report

The Same Data an Early Prototype of our System

We have a system that Geo-Locates each piece of data, creates an (HDScore) our Proprietary Scoring Algorithm and puts Regulations and Violations into an Easy to Read and Search Format regardless municipal borders. A simple search can include a search area, type of establishments, cuisine, and type of violations. 

Our App can tell you… “How clean is the restaurant you’re about to eat in?”  

HDScores will be the World's Largest Health Department Inspection Database, The only source needed to look up inspection data, no need to go to multiple government websites to find this important information anymore. 

What does is the example of a closed Restaurant for Sanitation Violations? 

This establishment is an extreme example and has been closed three times for critical violations; the owners have been fined, and banned from owning a restaurant ever again in that jurisdiction.

Mold Build up in the Refrigerator (Above 41 Degree Fahrenheit)

General Filth, Black Mold on the Walls

Black Mold Office Sign

Dead Mouse, Mouse Droppings

Mold in the Ice Machine

Know Before You GO!!! How Clean is the Restaurant you are about you Eat in?


The Last Major Innovations with Inspection Data happened around Y2K! 

Think about the computer you were using in 1999. Now try adding 150,000,000 inspection reports, with hundreds of unique data fields on each report; spread across 3,100 Jurisdictions each using their own format. All while standardizing this data using only CSV Files, PDF’s, Access, or MySQL Databases. This is still the current technology used by almost every government agency or private company working with inspection data. 

The Access, Aggregation, Processing, and Visualization of the Inspection Data is Everything. 

HDScores has access to 3100 jurisdictions health departments’ inspection data, while we have not currently aggregated everything. We have the ability to handle and aggregate both digital and paper formatted data at reasonable costs. We know where the data resides, and how often the inspection data is updated. HDScores can bring this data to consumers in real-time.

HDScores uses a modern technology architecture, which enables concern consumer’s complex searches while still getting results back fast and in an easy to read, search, and understand format. While we have a complex back-end, for consumers our front end is simple, if you can click on a pin on a map then you already know how to use app.

No other inspection querying system allows our level of search granularity, and the existing, less-precise queries are generally quite slow, stemming from others' inappropriate technology and architecture for solving this problem. With existing competition not thinking large enough: from the beginning, our system has been designed and built to accommodate, process, and distribute hundreds of millions of records.

HDScores wants to SHARE THIS DATA!
Our goal is to create a secure, trusted, and transparent, platform for concerned consumers to view health department inspection data on scale, without having to become a trained Chef, Data Scientist or Health Inspector. We do not require the health department to do anything different, we only worked with the finished publicly available data unlike other inspection systems.

How does Food Borne Illness affect Consumers?

47% of every food dollar spent is in a dining establishment.
56% of all sporadic Food Borne Illnesses occur in Restaurants, Schools and Hospitals.
The Food Industry in the United States is 4% of GDP, and employees 10% of the entire workforce. 
The annual economic cost to the US Economy caused by Food borne Illness is $77,700,000,000. From lost productivity, medical expenses, waste, and premature deaths due to foodborne illnesses.

48,000,000 People have a Food Borne Illness annually
(16% of the US Population or 1 in 6 Americans)
30,000,000 People at High Risk Susceptibility to Food Borne Illness Annually 
13,000,000 Chronic Secondary Complications resulting from Food Borne Illness annually
3,800,000 Doctor Visits related to Food Borne Illness annually
128,000 Hospitalizations related to Food Borne Illness annually 
 3,000 Deaths related to Food Borne Illness annually

The average food Borne illness related death costing $7,000,000.
For every foodborne illness case that is reported, as many as 40 more illnesses are not reported or lab-confirmed.

More than 30 million people in the United States are likely to be particularly susceptible to foodborne disease. Very young, elderly, and immune-compromised persons experience the most serious foodborne illnesses.

Chronic, secondary complications resulting from foodborne illness occur in 2-3 percent of all cases.

How common are food safety violations?
32% of Food Service Professionals believe that food safety violations could cost them their professional and/or restaurant’s reputation.

30% of consumers worry about getting a food borne illness and/or food poisoning.

56% of all sporadic Food Borne Illnesses occur in Restaurants, Schools and Hospitals.

In New York City in 2012, there were 273,999 fines for food safety violations.

35% of Schools in Chicago have failed at least one health inspection since 2011.

61 Restaurants were closed in Los Angeles in the last 3 months.

How will this make restaurants cleaner?
According to historical trends, when data is made transparent and publicly available. Sanitation scores and restaurant sales increase in cleaner establishments. In historical trends, both high and low income, urban and rural communities increase across the board when inspection data is made available and used.

There will be 3 types of restaurant owners:

Those who care

Those who fix enough to stay open

Those who do not care and repeat violations. 

If a consumers and health department uses data analytics like HDScores, you can better mitigate risks of food borne illness.. We see this causing less friction between Restaurant Owner’s and the Health Departments in the future.

Who currently reports restaurant inspection reports?

Government Agencies & Health Departments release data not necessarily in a consumable format.

Newspapers – Generally on put as many inspection reports as they have space. Saving Inspection reports until, they are ready to publish these reports. When data is available. 

Internet Companies - Various companies are distributing data, there are lots of local companies, very few work with multiple jurisdictions on scale.

TV News/Media stations in the top 40 Media Markets do 3200+ dirty dining segments annually.

6,500,000 people watch restaurant disaster shows on a weekly basis. (Food Safety issues are a common issue).

Does HDScores have Competition?

Yes, HDScores is not the first company to think of this idea; we have seen a number of companies fade in and out over the last two years. We are one of the few companies working on scale, using modern technology and have multiple relevant domain expertise (Food Service, Sanitation, Technology, Data Science, and Business). HDScores is also working to solve the data distribution issue in jurisdictions that does not currently have this problem solved.

YELP – Launched the LIVES Standard in January 2013 to a lukewarm reception. Which links five linked CSV files together to share the data, Yelp does not use their powerful API for inspection data. Sharing health department inspection data currently in five cities (SFO, NYC, Louisville KY, Wake County NC, Part of Los Angeles CA) not the original planned cities (Boston, Chicago, and Philly) that were supposed to launch by the end of the first year. They have only gone into jurisdictions that already have this data and problem solved or found someone to convert the data to their format.

Dinesafe – Currently in beta, they are largest inspection site to date, prior to HDScores launching with 270,000+ establishments, spread across seven US States and six Canadian Providences. With a less then friendly search and user interface.

HDScores Data Access

HDScores has great digital data access, and the ability to handle paper only jurisdictions in a cost effective, timely manner.

HDScores Data Access

In the US

HDScores has digital access to the data for 1718 Health Departments of the 2550 Health Departments/Agencies. (Some Jurisdictions share Health Departments) in the US.

Currently HDScores has digital access to 67.37% of all the Health Departments in the US.

Encompassing Health Departments with data for 77.62% percent of the total US Population. (239,651,212 people according to the 2010 Census Data)

HDScores will expand data access to as many jurisdictions as possible, rolling out new jurisdictions in a timely manner.

Expanding Internationally

HDScores already has a detailed understanding of the inspection data in Canada, and the United Kingdom. The economic impact of food borne illness in the UK was £1.5 Billion and $1.1 Billion in Canada. We have 100% data access in the UK, and 76% data access in Canada. While rules are slightly different in each country, we have already mapped out our path towards our expansion and have data access. We are aware of several other countries we can expand into next in Asia, the Middle East and Europe.

HDScores Future

Over the last 2 years, HDScores has explored a number of Business Models with traction we will be able to develop some of those plans in the future. HDScores has plans for the creation of Free Public API Portal for access to historical inspection data for the public, non-profit, and academic use, and deployment of a Universal Sanitation FICO Score in the near future. HDScores is starting here, with our App and we need your help.

What others say about HDScores?


Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) 


How does the HDScores Work?
HDScores aggregates health department inspections across the United States, Canada, and United Kingdom into an easy to read, search, and understand format. Each jurisdiction has their own policies, procedures and laws for inspection data. HDScores understands and respects these standards. While aggregating, processing, storing and visualizing data for easy consumer consumption.

What is the HDScores App Function?
To answer a simple question for concerned consumers, HDScores can tell consumers “How clean is the restaurant you’re about to eat in?”

What Jurisdiction does HDScores have in the application?
Unlike other food safety and review sites, HDScores will not sticking to only Major Metropolitan Cities or Jurisdictions that have already solved this problem. HDScores will be launching our app in the following Jurisdictions listed above.

What if you can’t contribute? Are there other ways you can help?
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.
We are asking our supporters to get the word out and make some noise about our IndieGoGo campaign.

What is the money being used for?
To cover the cost of the rewards, app development, design and server costs, plain and simple that is it.

What Technology Does HDScores Use?
HDScores use a number of modern developed computer languages, frameworks, and hardware such as solid state hard drives and CDN's. We do development in-house for all of our applications, data aggregation, processing, and distribution.   

What is the Revenue Model?
HDScores has opted for a real time bidding display ad model in our consumer apps. All the data will be free for all jurisdictions, once aggregated. We will be using Search, User and Demographic Data, to increase the value of Targeted Real-Time Bidding Ads and User Profiles.

Why so many charge for their Restaurant Inspection Apps?
The Average Paid Restaurant Inspection Application Gets 4,000 Downloads and must split that revenue with the application platforms. Only Generating Revenue a one time from their applications. HDScores makes more money as more people use our applications. 

Why is the HDScores App Free? 
We will never charge consumers for free publicly available government data.

What benefits does HDScores bring to Consumers?
When concerned consumers have access to accurate, easy to read, search and understand format, they trust that data more. In jurisdictions that inspection data is widely distributed food borne illness outbreak drop, and restaurants get cleaner.

What benefits does HDScores bring to Business?
According to historical trends, when data is made transparent, sanitation scores and sales increase.
We also have a separate B2B offering.

What benefit does HDScores bring to Government?
HDScores has figured out the complicated standardization, normalization and visualization problems of working with inspection data on scale.
We also have a separate Government offering.   

Who is HDScores, Inc?
For full team and advisor bios please visit: http://hdscores.com/our-team/

When was the idea of HDScores conceived?
On January 21st 2012, while helping 2 friends open their dream restaurant.

What has HDScores been doing Since 2012?
We recruited an amazing team and advisory board. Built out at least 3 early prototypes in various technologies, market and user testing, along with brand development on various media platforms. 

What has HDScores done since then?
HDScores has solved a number of complex data, technology and business development issues to build a system that works locally and will scale internationally. We have access to 3100+ jurisdictions (2.5 Million Establishments) across the United States, Canada, and United Kingdom. HDScores has the mission to be the World’s Largest Health Department Inspection Database.

Tell us what your own financial stake is?
The Founding Team of HDScores, Inc has spent 2 years growing the concept of HDScores all bootstrapping on sweat equity. We do not currently have any investors in HDScores.

Hey I’m a member of the press, how can I get intouch?
Email the CEO – Matthew@HDScores.com

HDScores as seen in the media:
HDScores has been seen in a number of local and regional tech, business and food safety publications, from Technically Baltimore, to the Washington Post, and Food Safety Talk.
To see our full media coverage please visit: http://hdscores.com/news-media/

HDScores recognized by:
American Public Health Association in April 2013.
The CEO/Founder was nominated as a White House Champion of Change for Public Health and was recognized by Health and Human Services HHS in Sept 2013.
Open Data 500 a joint program by NYU Governance Lab and the Knight Foundation.

A simple search can include a search area, type of establishments, cuisine, and type of violations. Our App can tell you… “How clean is the restaurant you’re about to eat in?”  HDScores will be the World's Largest Health Department Inspection Database, The only source needed to look up inspection data, no need to go to multiple government websites to find this important information anymore. What does is the example of a closed Restaurant for Sanitation Violations? This establishment is an extreme example and has been closed three times for critical violations; the owners have been fined, and banned from owning a restaurant ever again in that jurisdiction.Mold Build up in the Refrigerator (Above 41 Degree Fahrenheit)General Filth, Black Mold on the WallsBlack Mold Office SignDead Mouse, Mouse DroppingsMold in the Ice MachineKnow Before You GO!!! How Clean is the Restaurant you are about you Eat in?The Last Major Innovations with Inspection Data happened around Y2K! Think about the computer you were using in 1999. Now try adding 150,000,000 inspection reports, with hundreds of unique data fields on each report; spread across 3,100 Jurisdictions each using their own format. All while standardizing this data using only CSV Files, PDF’s, Access, or MySQL Databases. This is still the current technology used by almost every government agency or private company working with inspection data. The Access, Aggregation, Processing, and Visualization of the Inspection Data is Everything. HDScores has access to 3100 jurisdictions health departments’ inspection data, while we have not currently aggregated everything. We have the ability to handle and aggregate both digital and paper formatted data at reasonable costs. We know where the data resides, and how often the inspection data is updated. HDScores can bring this data to consumers in real-time.HDScores uses a modern technology architecture, which enables concern consumer’s complex searches while still getting results back fast and in an easy to read, search, and understand format. While we have a complex back-end, for consumers our front end is simple, if you can click on a pin on a map then you already know how to use app.No other inspection querying system allows our level of search granularity, and the existing, less-precise queries are generally quite slow, stemming from others' inappropriate technology and architecture for solving this problem. With existing competition not thinking large enough: from the beginning, our system has been designed and built to accommodate, process, and distribute hundreds of millions of records.HDScores wants to SHARE THIS DATA!Our goal is to create a secure, trusted, and transparent, platform for concerned consumers to view health department inspection data on scale, without having to become a trained Chef, Data Scientist or Health Inspector. We do not require the health department to do anything different, we only worked with the finished publicly available data unlike other inspection systems.How does Food Borne Illness affect Consumers?47% of every food dollar spent is in a dining establishment.56% of all sporadic Food Borne Illnesses occur in Restaurants, Schools and Hospitals.The Food Industry in the United States is 4% of GDP, and employees 10% of the entire workforce. The annual economic cost to the US Economy caused by Food borne Illness is $77,700,000,000. From lost productivity, medical expenses, waste, and premature deaths due to foodborne illnesses.48,000,000 People have a Food Borne Illness annually(16% of the US Population or 1 in 6 Americans)30,000,000 People at High Risk Susceptibility to Food Borne Illness Annually 13,000,000 Chronic Secondary Complications resulting from Food Borne Illness annually3,800,000 Doctor Visits related to Food Borne Illness annually128,000 Hospitalizations related to Food Borne Illness annually  3,000 Deaths related to Food Borne Illness annuallyThe average food Borne illness related death costing $7,000,000.For every foodborne illness case that is reported, as many as 40 more illnesses are not reported or lab-confirmed.More than 30 million people in the United States are likely to be particularly susceptible to foodborne disease. Very young, elderly, and immune-compromised persons experience the most serious foodborne illnesses.Chronic, secondary complications resulting from foodborne illness occur in 2-3 percent of all cases.How common are food safety violations?32% of Food Service Professionals believe that food safety violations could cost them their professional and/or restaurant’s reputation.30% of consumers worry about getting a food borne illness and/or food poisoning.56% of all sporadic Food Borne Illnesses occur in Restaurants, Schools and Hospitals.In New York City in 2012, there were 273,999 fines for food safety violations.35% of Schools in Chicago have failed at least one health inspection since 2011.61 Restaurants were closed in Los Angeles in the last 3 months.How will this make restaurants cleaner?According to historical trends, when data is made transparent and publicly available. Sanitation scores and restaurant sales increase in cleaner establishments. In historical trends, both high and low income, urban and rural communities increase across the board when inspection data is made available and used.There will be 3 types of restaurant owners:Those who careThose who fix enough to stay openThose who do not care and repeat violations. If a consumers and health department uses data analytics like HDScores, you can better mitigate risks of food borne illness.. We see this causing less friction between Restaurant Owner’s and the Health Departments in the future.Who currently reports restaurant inspection reports?Government Agencies & Health Departments release data not necessarily in a consumable format.Newspapers – Generally on put as many inspection reports as they have space. Saving Inspection reports until, they are ready to publish these reports. When data is available. Internet Companies - Various companies are distributing data, there are lots of local companies, very few work with multiple jurisdictions on scale.TV News/Media stations in the top 40 Media Markets do 3200+ dirty dining segments annually.6,500,000 people watch restaurant disaster shows on a weekly basis. (Food Safety issues are a common issue).Does HDScores have Competition?Yes, HDScores is not the first company to think of this idea; we have seen a number of companies fade in and out over the last two years. We are one of the few companies working on scale, using modern technology and have multiple relevant domain expertise (Food Service, Sanitation, Technology, Data Science, and Business). HDScores is also working to solve the data distribution issue in jurisdictions that does not currently have this problem solved.YELP – Launched the LIVES Standard in January 2013 to a lukewarm reception. Which links five linked CSV files together to share the data, Yelp does not use their powerful API for inspection data. Sharing health department inspection data currently in five cities (SFO, NYC, Louisville KY, Wake County NC, Part of Los Angeles CA) not the original planned cities (Boston, Chicago, and Philly) that were supposed to launch by the end of the first year. They have only gone into jurisdictions that already have this data and problem solved or found someone to convert the data to their format.Dinesafe – Currently in beta, they are largest inspection site to date, prior to HDScores launching with 270,000+ establishments, spread across seven US States and six Canadian Providences. With a less then friendly search and user interface.HDScores Data AccessHDScores has great digital data access, and the ability to handle paper only jurisdictions in a cost effective, timely manner.HDScores Data AccessIn the USHDScores has digital access to the data for 1718 Health Departments of the 2550 Health Departments/Agencies. (Some Jurisdictions share Health Departments) in the US.Currently HDScores has digital access to 67.37% of all the Health Departments in the US.Encompassing Health Departments with data for 77.62% percent of the total US Population. (239,651,212 people according to the 2010 Census Data)HDScores will expand data access to as many jurisdictions as possible, rolling out new jurisdictions in a timely manner.Expanding InternationallyHDScores already has a detailed understanding of the inspection data in Canada, and the United Kingdom. The economic impact of food borne illness in the UK was £1.5 Billion and $1.1 Billion in Canada. We have 100% data access in the UK, and 76% data access in Canada. While rules are slightly different in each country, we have already mapped out our path towards our expansion and have data access. We are aware of several other countries we can expand into next in Asia, the Middle East and Europe.HDScores FutureOver the last 2 years, HDScores has explored a number of Business Models with traction we will be able to develop some of those plans in the future. HDScores has plans for the creation of Free Public API Portal for access to historical inspection data for the public, non-profit, and academic use, and deployment of a Universal Sanitation FICO Score in the near future. HDScores is starting here, with our App and we need your help.What others say about HDScores?

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) 
How does the HDScores Work?
HDScores aggregates health department inspections across the United States,
Canada, and United Kingdom into an easy to read, search, and understand format.
Each jurisdiction has their own policies, procedures and laws for inspection
data. HDScores understands and respects these standards. While aggregating,
processing, storing and visualizing data for easy consumer consumption. What is the HDScores App Function?To answer a simple question for concerned consumers, HDScores can tell
consumers “How clean is the restaurant you’re about to eat in?” 
What Jurisdiction does HDScores have in the application?Unlike other food safety and review sites, HDScores will not sticking to
only Major Metropolitan Cities or Jurisdictions that have already solved this
problem. HDScores will be launching our app in the following Jurisdictions listed above.

What if you
can’t contribute? Are there other ways you can help?Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.
We are asking our supporters to get the word out and make some noise about our IndieGoGo
campaign.What is the money being used for?
To cover the cost of the rewards, app development, design and server costs,
plain and simple that is it. What Technology Does HDScores Use?HDScores use a number of modern developed computer languages, frameworks, and hardware such as solid state hard drives and CDN's. We do development in-house for all of our applications, data aggregation, processing, and distribution.   What is the Revenue Model?
HDScores has opted for a real time bidding display ad model in our consumer apps. All the data will be free for all
jurisdictions, once aggregated. We will be using Search, User and Demographic
Data, to increase the value of Targeted Real-Time Bidding Ads and User Profiles.
Why so many charge for their Restaurant Inspection Apps?The Average Paid Restaurant Inspection Application Gets 4,000 Downloads and must split that revenue with the application platforms. Only Generating Revenue a one time from their applications. HDScores makes more money as more people use our applications. Why is the HDScores App Free? We will never charge consumers for free publicly available
government data.What benefits does HDScores bring to
Consumers?When concerned consumers have access to accurate, easy to read, search and
understand format, they trust that data more. In jurisdictions that inspection
data is widely distributed food borne illness outbreak drop, and restaurants
get cleaner. 
What benefits does HDScores bring to Business?According to historical trends, when data is made transparent, sanitation
scores and sales increase. 
We also have a separate B2B offering. 
What benefit does HDScores bring to Government?
HDScores has figured out the complicated standardization, normalization and
visualization problems of working with inspection data on scale.We also have a separate Government offering.   
Who is HDScores, Inc?For full team and advisor bios please visit: http://hdscores.com/our-team/
When was the idea of HDScores conceived?On January
21st 2012, while helping 2 friends open their dream restaurant. What has HDScores been doing Since 2012?We recruited an amazing team and advisory board. Built out at least 3 early prototypes in various technologies, market and user testing, along with brand development on various media platforms. 
What has HDScores done since then?
HDScores has solved a number of complex data,
technology and business development issues to build a system that works locally
and will scale internationally. We have access to 3100+ jurisdictions (2.5
Million Establishments) across the United States, Canada, and United Kingdom.
HDScores has the mission to be the World’s Largest Health Department Inspection
Database. Tell us what
your own financial stake is?The Founding Team of HDScores, Inc has spent 2 years growing the concept of
HDScores all bootstrapping on sweat equity. We do not currently have any
investors in HDScores. Hey I’m a member of the press, how can I
get intouch?
Email the CEO – Matthew@HDScores.com HDScores as seen in the media:HDScores has been seen in a number of local and regional tech, business and
food safety publications, from Technically Baltimore, to the Washington Post,
and Food Safety Talk.
To see our full media coverage please visit: http://hdscores.com/news-media/ 
HDScores recognized by:American Public Health Association in April 2013.
The CEO/Founder was nominated as a White House Champion of Change for Public
Health and was recognized by Health and Human Services HHS in Sept 2013.
Open Data 500 a joint program by NYU Governance Lab and the Knight Foundation.

story:
Afflux Natural Energy Drink

Afflux is a 100% natural Cranberry & Lychee flavoured energy drink, it's a healthier/tastier alternative to the more chemical based energy drinks already out there on the market. 
Afflux is also the UK's first female friendly energy drink, as it's an energy drink that caters for both genders within its marketing and branding techniques. 
Afflux Website: www.affluxuk.co.uk


What does Afflux stand for?
The word Afflux means the movement of fluid towards a point, we like to think of it as the coming together of things. As a brand we aim to unify people through a shared passion or hobby, therefore the word Afflux represents whom we are and what we aim to achieve! 



What we've achieved so far
October 2013 saw the official launch of Afflux Energy, however before we even launched we had gained a great deal of traction. In September 2013, Afflux was a sponsor for London Fashion Week with the drink being sent out in many of the hand delivered VIP hampers.
At the begging of the Summer season Afflux was the main sponsor for the Enchanted Garden Ball, the largest student ball in the UK. This was a notable achievement as we managed to beat other leading energy drinks to the role. 
Finally to top if all off, Afflux was named Intuit UK Start Up Buzz of the year. We beat 1100 other business to the title, by gaining the majority of the 120,000 votes cast.  

We need your help! 
With growing interest from Asian and American markets we need your help to expand the Afflux brand. 
Money will be invested in our depot down in Dover port, this will enable us to ship Afflux to more territories worldwide and reduce the shipment time. 
Funds will also be used to expand our London studio, to cater for a larger team and Afflux events. 
We will then take the fight to other market leading energy drinks, by heavily investing in Point of Sale material and on site branding in supermarkets and events. 
We are very passionate about Afflux and would like to bring it to the mass market, with your help we will be able to introduce consumers to the next generation of energy drinks and help lead the detachment of stigma surrounding energy drinks. 



How will the money be invested?
£10,000 will be invested in our shipping costs, this will enable the launch of Afflux in Hong Kong just before Christmas, then the launch of Afflux in Beijing after the new year. 
£15,000 will be used to expand Afflux studios in London, this will enable us to take on 3 new team members and host our own Afflux party's right in central London. 
£10,000 will be invested in POS/ On site branding, this will drive sales in supermarkets and bars nationwide. 
£10,000 will be used to increase the size of our logistics fleet, enabling us to deliver Afflux quicker to our eager customers.  
The reminder will then be used to launch Afflux into the US market, with the first trade trip taking place on the 27th September.   


Our Amazing Perks 

As the Indiegogo community means so much to us, we are offering our contributors exclusive offers and perks. 
You will not be able to get these perks anywhere else as they are only available to the Indiegogo community, so be sure to show them off when they arrive at your door, as you'll be part of an exclusive group!  
Everybody who contributes £10 will be entered into our monthly draw to win lunch with the Afflux founder in London.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Even If you can't contribute to our campaign we still want you to be part of the Afflux Family! Be sure to share this page on Facebook or Twitter let people know about the next generation, become a catalyst for the movement! 

Follow us on Twitter or like our Facebook page to be in with a chance of winning Afflux goodies! 

https://www.facebook.com/AffluxNaturalEnergy/timeline

https://twitter.com/AffluxEnergy

story:
At the Africa Rising Cycling Centre, the health of the riders, staff, and guests is always our primary concern.  Imagine coming into an elite cycling training facility and being unable to drink the tap water due to the threat of common diseases such as diarrhea, arsenicosis, cholera, fluorosis, intestinal worms, schistosomiasis, trachoma, and typhoid.

The Africa Rising Cycling Centre is the home of Team Rwanda, the national cycling team.  It also serves as a training facility for all countries on the continent, making it a cycling hub for Africa.  In order to maintain consistent water supply and guarantee water safety, this system will provide proper water pressure, adequate reserves (18,000 liters), and purified water. These reserves will last 10 days at full capacity should we experience an interruption in local service, which is a common occurrence. 

Our goal is to guarantee these top-level and professional athletes with clean, uncontaminated water that is available on a consistent basis. This is only made possible by the installation of this water filtration system.

The Africa Rising Cycling Centre is the home of Team Rwanda, the national cycling team.  It also serves as a training facility for all countries on the continent, making it a cycling hub for Africa.  In order to maintain consistent water supply and guarantee water safety, this system will provide proper water pressure, adequate reserves (18,000 liters), and purified water. story:
The fundraising campaign to support a free dental clinic in Ajijic is now officially complete.

We surpassed the goal of $4,000USD in less than two weeks!  And pledges in hand will add to that when received!

Any donations received beyond the $4,000 goal will still go to the clinic project. The equipment is a bit more expensive than originally thought, and ongoing supplies will need to be bought.

If you still feel like contributing, your donation will be used well.  Use the CONTRIBUTE NOW button on this website and pay by credit card or PayPal.

Or contact Harry Bublin at 376-766-4282 or at ms1cb@yahoo.com.  Or pledge a donation to Tom Gladney, by email, and the snail mail him a cheque to 16 Treeline Court, Toronto, M9C 1K8.

We hear that the State is very impressed with our fundraising.  They have now appointed a well-established respected dentist for the clinic, and the State's head dentist will come to do surgeries weekly.  The clinic will in fact be free to all patients, not pay-as-you-can, as we said earlier.

Héctor España Ramos, Delegado of Ajijic, thanks those who have supported the appeal.
