story:
Regenerative Moisture Complex

The transformative experience your skin has been waiting for. Rejuvenate your natural beauty as you envelop your skin in a layer of moisturizing and protection. Bask in this balm's ability to return you to supple youth and refine unwanted lines and pores. Truly giving your skin the most decadent appearance and feel! Let the aromas enchant you, a delightful balance of magnolia, blue tansy and jasmine holds you sweetly. Whilst rooting yourself in earth's gentleness with sweet vetiver, sandalwood and orris butter. Nurture yourself with beauty, love yourself with Omorfia.Full ingredients: marumaru butter, shea butter, cacao butter, oils of; andiroba, tamanu, baobab, sea buckthorn, astaxanthan, red raspberry, maracuja, rose hip seed, amaranth seed, pomegranite seed, schisandra, blue tansy, vetiver, sandalwood, jasmine, orris butter and magnolia.

Why it's special: The Omorfia Balm not only fulfills all the nurturing functions for the skin, it also has the highest quality ingredients. We take freshly winnowed and wet ground heirloom cacao beans and press them, rendering the freshest and highest quality butter. We mix this with wonderful organic shea and murmur butter, creating a hydrating blend that envelops the skin and locks in moisture. The selection of our butters and oils are carefully selected and are low on the comedogenic scale, which means you'll have all the moisturizing, protective anti-inflammation and anti-oxidants without clogging your pores. Our herb-infused MCT oil is full of healing nutrients and benefits, from the soothing properties in comfrey and clover, to the protective and skin tightening qualities in plantain leaf and yarrow. In addition, we feature andiroba, one of the Amazon’s most cherished miracle oils, that works as the ultimate healer to boost collagen levels and restore balance. We source our andiroba from a farmer’s cooperative where it’s fresh pressed and delivered only days after.  Omorfia Balm is made in small micro batches upon demand so that you can feel the quality with all your senses and bask in the beauty.


 

Energy Cleansing Room Spray


Open any space to new horizons with a few spritz of  refreshing wilderness. Feel the breeze of coastal pine and the clearing energy of black and dessert sage. Walk into any room invigorated with the wild aromas of the earth.
 

 

 

Bio Fermented Resurfacing Peel

Illuminate and awaken your skins inner vibrance. Break free from dead cell layers and damage spots from sun and time. Swoon in the softness of rose petals, walk through the yarrow filled forest of protection. Brighten your day and revisit the ageless reflection of your illustrious self.
Full ingredients: sake kasu, raw honey, bee pollen, propolis, royal jelly, coconut charcoal, bentonite clay, rassoul clay, and yarrow.

Why it's special: We're blessed to craft our products next to one of the finest artisan sake makers, Den Sake. We use his sweet pressed sake kasu made from locally grown rice. We referment this wonderful kojic acid-rich ingredient with a blend of raw honey, pollen and propolis.  When the desired PH and acid profile is reached, we stop the ferment and add yarrow for an aroma of purity and quality of protection. We blend with powerful, detoxifying earth minerals such as bentonite clay, rassoul clay and bio-charred coconut hull. Re- hydrate the mask with a desired amount of water, hydrosol or apple cider vinegar, and spread evenly on the skin. Allow to dry, rinse then soothe the skin with our Brightening Sol.

 

      

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

From seed to bottle, our mission is to source the highest quality, sustainably grown and ethically harvested ingredients. We blend formulas with organic skincare oils and butters derived from fruits, seeds, flowers and vegetables. Everything is hand-crafted in small batches without parabens, sulfates, silicones, synthetic fragrances, and the other toxic chemicals and additives seen across our modern beauty industry. We only use plants that our ancestors have used for thousands of years: pure, simple, and natural. Getting products that are raw, real, and incredible, and also knowing that with every purchase, you are helping the local farmers, their communities thrive, and protect the forests.

 

 

 

Our love for wildcrafting starts in the backyard. We forage plants like comfrey, yarrow, and plantain across the coasts of California. We directly source from artisanal farmers and local companies that share our values on sustainability and fair trade. Beyond that, we source Amazonian plants through direct farmer-cooperative relationships. This in turn helps Exousia Wild preserve the forest, all while supporting local farmers. 

We're able to enrich communities and give back to our land through sustainable harvesting and regenerative agriculture, as we continue to cultivate relationships with local artisans and ingredient suppliers. 

Our production takes place in an urban garden and makers space called O2 Artisans Aggregate in Oakland. With neighbors like Juniper Ridge, Den Sake and Salt Point Seaweed, we're working alongside creatives and networks who are all bringing wonderful environmentally progressive projects and ideas to market. This hive of conscious companies inspired us deeply, as we developed a kinship with fellow artisans and laid the groundwork for Exousia Wild.

And through collaborating with these companies, along with practicing the principles that define us, we are able to create the freshest and highest quality beauty products. Ones that transform your skin and the way you feel about it.

 

 

 

We’re ready to share our products with the world. Your contribution will help launch Exousia Wild off the ground, as we improve production, sourcing, and expand our network.
 

By backing our campaign, you would help:

• Boost inventory for our first line of products and expedite shipping

• Upgrade production space at the O2 Artisan Aggregate Community 

• Develop minimal, biodegradable packaging with miron glass to protect the products 

• Support R&D for the launch of new products including a CBD balm and Body Bar

• Source highest quality ingredients and cultivate close relationships with local artisan farmers and ingredient suppliers, with transparency and culture, so that we can give back to the ones protecting the land

• Create a community through Branding and Marketing, sharing our ethos through social media with blogs on ingredients, recipes and DIY, with featured stories on sustainability, community, and our wildcrafting process

 

 

 

Johnny and Rachel turned their love for plant medicine into clean beauty and chemical-free crafting. After decades-long expertise as a distiller, woodworker, and forager, the duo began creating products and exploring formulas in 2013.


 

 


Ingredients: hydrosols of plaintain, yarrow, witch hazel, hellicrysium, sandalwood and jasmine.

 


Ingredients: aloe, bladderack, kelp, rose, sprirulina and songre de drago.

 


A CBD balm

 


TBA
 

 

 

Our backers are the backbone to launch Exousia Wild off the ground, so we’re giving back through product sneak peaks, unique experiences, and bundles of products from local artisans.
 

• Be the first to experience our products
Pre-order the newest products at a discounted price.

• 5x7 Original Art Print
Exclusive art print made especially for Exousia Wild by Chandra Oh.

• Wildcrafted DIY Ebook
A beautifully crafted e-book that will teach you how to wildcraft along with some DIY recipes you can make at home.

• Products from the O2 Artisans Aggregate community:

  • Surf Snack by Salt Point Seaweed: 
    Made with California Nori and California Wakame that we hand-harvest, Surf Snack is baked with a mix of healthy, energy-packed seeds and a touch of maple syrup for a sweet and savory snack.No gluten. No dairy. No refined sugar. Just real ingredients and our favorite superfood of the sea.
  • Sake by Den Sake Brewery:
    Sako brews his small-batch sake using traditional Japanese brewing methods with a single origin rice grown by Rue & Forsman ranch in the Sacramento Valley. The delicately aromatic sake pairs exceptionally well with all types of California cuisine as well as many types of Asian cuisine.

  • Live Edge Shelf by Ponderosa Millworks:
    A custom, handmade wooden live edge floating shelf made in an urban sawmill. Ponderosa takes trees that would ordinarily be taken to landfill and will the logs into beautiful, usable pieces of natural art.

• Exousia Wild Hot Springs Trip
Enjoy the ultimate relaxation for you and your friends with a spa session featuring all the products, a plant walk, and dinner (sushi + sake).

• Dinner Party with Friends
How does a farm-to-table meal sound for you and five of your friends? We'll bring the kitchen to you, complete with all-organic fare and foraged foods, artisan absinthe and sake from fellow O2 artisans. To top it off you will also receive a custom live edge (redwood, cypress or oak) dining table for your meal.

 

 

We're sourcing upcycled ingredients and collaborating with local artisinal companies.

Den Sake brews handcrafted, small-batch sake from Cal-Hikari rice grown in the Sacramento Valley. The fermentation byproduct Sake Kasu is the highlight of our mask for its rich kojic acid, known for its resurfacing and rejuvenating properties.

Juniper Ridge creates fragrances and perfumes from wild harvested plants. As they steam distill and render high quality oils from the forest, their hydrosols are the by-product we use in our Wild Sol Spray.

Salt Point Seaweed uses culinary seaweed sustainably harvested from the California coast with ingredients like bladderack and kelp which we blend in our Deep Sea Mask and Body Bar.

 

 

 

Please spread the word and share our campaign with anyone you feel would like to contribute and be a part of launching Exousia Wild.  If you can't contribute financially, you can still make a big difference and here's how:

CONNECT WITH US

   Instagram    •    ExousiaWild.com   •  Email Us

 

We greatly appreciate you being a part of our community!
story_txt:
Regenerative Moisture Complex
The transformative experience your skin has been waiting for. Rejuvenate your natural beauty as you envelop your skin in a layer of moisturizing and protection. Bask in this balm's ability to return you to supple youth and refine unwanted lines and pores. Truly giving your skin the most decadent appearance and feel! Let the aromas enchant you, a delightful balance of magnolia, blue tansy and jasmine holds you sweetly. Whilst rooting yourself in earth's gentleness with sweet vetiver, sandalwood and orris butter. Nurture yourself with beauty, love yourself with Omorfia.Full ingredients: marumaru butter, shea butter, cacao butter, oils of; andiroba, tamanu, baobab, sea buckthorn, astaxanthan, red raspberry, maracuja, rose hip seed, amaranth seed, pomegranite seed, schisandra, blue tansy, vetiver, sandalwood, jasmine, orris butter and magnolia.Why it's special: The Omorfia Balm not only fulfills all the nurturing functions for the skin, it also has the highest quality ingredients. We take freshly winnowed and wet ground heirloom cacao beans and press them, rendering the freshest and highest quality butter. We mix this with wonderful organic shea and murmur butter, creating a hydrating blend that envelops the skin and locks in moisture. The selection of our butters and oils are carefully selected and are low on the comedogenic scale, which means you'll have all the moisturizing, protective anti-inflammation and anti-oxidants without clogging your pores. Our herb-infused MCT oil is full of healing nutrients and benefits, from the soothing properties in comfrey and clover, to the protective and skin tightening qualities in plantain leaf and yarrow. In addition, we feature andiroba, one of the Amazon’s most cherished miracle oils, that works as the ultimate healer to boost collagen levels and restore balance. We source our andiroba from a farmer’s cooperative where it’s fresh pressed and delivered only days after.  Omorfia Balm is made in small micro batches upon demand so that you can feel the quality with all your senses and bask in the beauty.





 
Energy Cleansing Room Spray
Open any space to new horizons with a few spritz of  refreshing wilderness. Feel the breeze of coastal pine and the clearing energy of black and dessert sage. Walk into any room invigorated with the wild aromas of the earth. 

 

 
Bio Fermented Resurfacing Peel
Illuminate and awaken your skins inner vibrance. Break free from dead cell layers and damage spots from sun and time. Swoon in the softness of rose petals, walk through the yarrow filled forest of protection. Brighten your day and revisit the ageless reflection of your illustrious self.Full ingredients: sake kasu, raw honey, bee pollen, propolis, royal jelly, coconut charcoal, bentonite clay, rassoul clay, and yarrow.Why it's special: We're blessed to craft our products next to one of the finest artisan sake makers, Den Sake. We use his sweet pressed sake kasu made from locally grown rice. We referment this wonderful kojic acid-rich ingredient with a blend of raw honey, pollen and propolis.  When the desired PH and acid profile is reached, we stop the ferment and add yarrow for an aroma of purity and quality of protection. We blend with powerful, detoxifying earth minerals such as bentonite clay, rassoul clay and bio-charred coconut hull. Re- hydrate the mask with a desired amount of water, hydrosol or apple cider vinegar, and spread evenly on the skin. Allow to dry, rinse then soothe the skin with our Brightening Sol.
 
      
 

 

 

 

 


 

 
From seed to bottle, our mission is to source the highest quality, sustainably grown and ethically harvested ingredients. We blend formulas with organic skincare oils and butters derived from fruits, seeds, flowers and vegetables. Everything is hand-crafted in small batches without parabens, sulfates, silicones, synthetic fragrances, and the other toxic chemicals and additives seen across our modern beauty industry. We only use plants that our ancestors have used for thousands of years: pure, simple, and natural. Getting products that are raw, real, and incredible, and also knowing that with every purchase, you are helping the local farmers, their communities thrive, and protect the forests.
 

 

 
Our love for wildcrafting starts in the backyard. We forage plants like comfrey, yarrow, and plantain across the coasts of California. We directly source from artisanal farmers and local companies that share our values on sustainability and fair trade. Beyond that, we source Amazonian plants through direct farmer-cooperative relationships. This in turn helps Exousia Wild preserve the forest, all while supporting local farmers. 
We're able to enrich communities and give back to our land through sustainable harvesting and regenerative agriculture, as we continue to cultivate relationships with local artisans and ingredient suppliers. 
Our production takes place in an urban garden and makers space called O2 Artisans Aggregate in Oakland. With neighbors like Juniper Ridge, Den Sake and Salt Point Seaweed, we're working alongside creatives and networks who are all bringing wonderful environmentally progressive projects and ideas to market. This hive of conscious companies inspired us deeply, as we developed a kinship with fellow artisans and laid the groundwork for Exousia Wild.
And through collaborating with these companies, along with practicing the principles that define us, we are able to create the freshest and highest quality beauty products. Ones that transform your skin and the way you feel about it.
 

 

 


We’re ready to share our products with the world. Your contribution will help launch Exousia Wild off the ground, as we improve production, sourcing, and expand our network. 
By backing our campaign, you would help:
• Boost inventory for our first line of products and expedite shipping
• Upgrade production space at the O2 Artisan Aggregate Community 
• Develop minimal, biodegradable packaging with miron glass to protect the products 
• Support R&D for the launch of new products including a CBD balm and Body Bar
• Source highest quality ingredients and cultivate close relationships with local artisan farmers and ingredient suppliers, with transparency and culture, so that we can give back to the ones protecting the land
• Create a community through Branding and Marketing, sharing our ethos through social media with blogs on ingredients, recipes and DIY, with featured stories on sustainability, community, and our wildcrafting process
 

 

 
Johnny and Rachel turned their love for plant medicine into clean beauty and chemical-free crafting. After decades-long expertise as a distiller, woodworker, and forager, the duo began creating products and exploring formulas in 2013.




 
 

Ingredients: hydrosols of plaintain, yarrow, witch hazel, hellicrysium, sandalwood and jasmine.
 

Ingredients: aloe, bladderack, kelp, rose, sprirulina and songre de drago.
 

A CBD balm
 

TBA 

 

 
Our backers are the backbone to launch Exousia Wild off the ground, so we’re giving back through product sneak peaks, unique experiences, and bundles of products from local artisans. 
• Be the first to experience our productsPre-order the newest products at a discounted price.
• 5x7 Original Art PrintExclusive art print made especially for Exousia Wild by Chandra Oh.
• Wildcrafted DIY EbookA beautifully crafted e-book that will teach you how to wildcraft along with some DIY recipes you can make at home.
• Products from the O2 Artisans Aggregate community:


Surf Snack by Salt Point Seaweed: Made with California Nori and California Wakame that we hand-harvest, Surf Snack is baked with a mix of healthy, energy-packed seeds and a touch of maple syrup for a sweet and savory snack.No gluten. No dairy. No refined sugar. Just real ingredients and our favorite superfood of the sea.

Sake by Den Sake Brewery:Sako brews his small-batch sake using traditional Japanese brewing methods with a single origin rice grown by Rue & Forsman ranch in the Sacramento Valley. The delicately aromatic sake pairs exceptionally well with all types of California cuisine as well as many types of Asian cuisine.
Live Edge Shelf by Ponderosa Millworks:A custom, handmade wooden live edge floating shelf made in an urban sawmill. Ponderosa takes trees that would ordinarily be taken to landfill and will the logs into beautiful, usable pieces of natural art.

• Exousia Wild Hot Springs TripEnjoy the ultimate relaxation for you and your friends with a spa session featuring all the products, a plant walk, and dinner (sushi + sake).
• Dinner Party with FriendsHow does a farm-to-table meal sound for you and five of your friends? We'll bring the kitchen to you, complete with all-organic fare and foraged foods, artisan absinthe and sake from fellow O2 artisans. To top it off you will also receive a custom live edge (redwood, cypress or oak) dining table for your meal.

Juniper Ridge creates fragrances and perfumes from wild harvested plants. As they steam distill and render high quality oils from the forest, their hydrosols are the by-product we use in our Wild Sol Spray.

story:
GLUCOSCANNER

GlucoScanner will be the first small, portable optical Glucometer! It is real, it is working and it is a few months away to be produced.


IT WORKS!
Research and Development Settings
Below is a demonstration video where we show how our prototype works. In the video we compare our results with an over-the-counter (OTC) glucometer that requires users to prick their fingers and deliver a drop of blood on a test strip.

In our demonstration, the prototype outcome is 109mg/dL, if we consider 114 mg/dL as a glucose value close enough to the reference value. In this case our estimate would be in compliance with FDA guidelines. However, our ultimate aim is to create a device that gives results as close as possible to the actual values. We make similar tests in our laboratory daily, mostly on ourselves, and if there is an opportunity we test friends, colleagues and occasionally paid outside subjects.

"We have to reduce its size to make it smaller than a mobile phone. We have already contacted the people responsible for miniaturization: it will cost about 130-150 thousand dollars. This is why we use crowdfunding. Then, of course, the device will be tested on as many patients as possible,” explains Stefano Valenzi. “It will definitely change the life of diabetic persons”.

The next picture show the prototype used in the above demonstration video.

 

Our Story

I am Stefano Valenzi, a researcher specialized in physiological data. I was formally trained in Italy. In 2008 I moved to Japan to work at Brain Science Institute of RIKEN. RIKEN is one of the top research institutes in the world. There I met Peter Jurica, a talented engineer. He moved from Slovakia for the same reasons, to work with the most advanced technological resources in a world class environment.

We became aware of problems related to glucose self-monitoring when our parents started to check themselves daily. We began to explore alternative non invasive methods for controlling and monitoring of blood glucose. 

Our exploration started with long discussions and research review. Non-invasive methods for blood glucose monitoring were researched before. We knew this from the work on devices we had built until then. Among other methods, we found many scientific studies that were suggesting optical methods as one of the best ones to estimate blood glucose non-invasively. We reviewed the research and decided to try and replicate some of published studies. Meanwhile, we kept improving our skills in building hardware. Our first breadboard prototype for sensing glucose using different lights was an educated guess based on mixture of ideas from a few research papers we have deemed plausible.

Our first prototype used only optical sensors, it gave us the first positive signs of a working principle. A few more breadboards came after that, until they become so large and complex that we had to ask professionals to turn the mess of wires into a solid circuit board (picture below).

Our Company

We needed more money, more time, and more people. Help came in summer 2016, when the Dynamic Brain Lab was established. Our team grew by two new partners, Nicola Grieco and Roberto Forlani, with skills in business and marketing, and with definitely more financial means than us. We began the procedure for registering our first hardware patent on day one of the lab (check our company story). Other two people joined us since then, and many others are still helping us in our mission.

Our mission

Succeeding in our campaign means to create a painless and more affordable way of blood glucose monitoring. Lowering the expenses of to this procedure will mean that people, who could not until now afford the test strip method, could become able to monitor their blood glucose, and potentially live a healthier life. In future steps we are also looking into reaching criteria to get approvals for medical use and develop discreet wearable devices. Wearables will allow continuous monitoring and the possibility of automatic alarms and/or emergency calls.

Why we need you

We need to transform our device into a small, portable device, not just to make a more convenient and discreet device but also to improve its performance.

A successful funding campaign will allow us to facilitate data collection and generally improve the user experience. 

Both points can be achieved by reducing the area occupied by sensors and creating a finger chamber with a self-adjusting spring system cuff. Users have to fully cover our device's optical sensors with their finger. The larger the sensors area the harder is to fully cover it, especially with tiny fingers. In our prototype we use off-the-shelf commercial sensors and LEDs which require 10 times more space than compact light/sensor sets designed for specific usage.

We amplify tiny signals millions of times so even imperceptible hand movements are creating noise. Having a spring system cuff will grant a constant pressure between users finger and sensors and will further reduce possible noise given by involuntary finger movements, so user can measure themselves with less movement restrains and generally in a more convenient way. Our current prototypes require the user to be still, resting arm close to the device, as in the time lapse below. The footage is from one day of our experiment.


This procedure will be easier with a cuff inserted into a finger clip as it is used currently in devices that employ similar optical technology. For instance pulse-oximeter uses a self-adjusting spring system to perfectly fit most fingers (picture below)

Last but not least, we will need your help to conduct the final stage of user experience checks and to completely test the new portable device in the wild, outside of the lab. We estimate to start such experiments in June 2018. Please go to dynamicbrainlab.org/signup to leave your data. We will send our final prototype to selected people, based on possible match between their personal details (e.g. body mass index, blood glucose levels, age, etc) and our research needs.

Our Perks

We are proud to bring out there a device that can improve health conditions and quality of life, and hope you can find a way to become a part of these good changes, backing our GlucoScanner project.

We created a special $30 perk to help people in need (allowing you to express a preferences or a suggestions on who could receive our device), named Help Us To Help Others. Every $600 we will send a GlucoScanner to a beneficiary selected among the suggested ones and we will take care of the delivery (paying shipping fees and taxes). 

GlucoScanner will have the ability to profile more users and will be usable by more people.​ Early birds BASIC, Extended edition and Family edition answer to different users needs.  Please check our perks section and our updates for further details.

Make The Difference

If you decide to support our mission, you will speed up our development toward production. We believe in our mission and we are determined to pursue our path until we will be able to distribute our product. That is the reason why we have a flexible goal.

Without your help, it can take years for us to start to distribute our product..

With your help, distribution will start in months!

How We Will Use Money:

  1. We can outsource some engineering work to professionals that can bring us to a stage of production within months. We have quotes from four potential partners. We need $130.000 for this stage.
  2. We can speed up the user experience testing and be sure to meet all quality standards in the shortest time possible. We need $50.000 for this stage.
  3. To start the mass production of GlucoScanner with a reasonable cost we have to anticipate some money to the manufacturer. We need $200.000 for this stage.
  4. More money could also speed up the process to get medical approvals. This would allow GlucoScanner to be recognized by medical insurances and welfare, and therefore GlucoScanner could become even more affordable.

Open Question

Currently our prototype works beyond our expectations, we have created a completely new method to acquire and evaluate data about blood flowing through examined tissue. Such innovative method has given our device the reliability that we could just hope for, and that no one could reach before. We are looking forward to test the miniaturized and stabilized portable device to evaluate how its performance will be improved. Right now, before to use our device to estimate blood glucose in new users, we have to calibrate the device. Based on differences we could observe so far, it was possible to group users with one of the 3 groups of parameters we defined. The question is whether or not GlucoScanner will be able to recognize automatically which group the users belong to. In the worst case scenario users will have to manually calibrate the device by a simple procedure.

Help Us As You Can

We appreciate your help in any form. If you care, please be open to spread the news of our project, and of our campaign on social platforms. Please talk to friends or colleagues, or any other interested people who could benefit from this, any positive action would be of great help and deeply appreciated on our side. Blood glucose monitoring gives everyone the possibility of a healthier life.

Thank you!

 

To get further info about us, our projects, and future ideas go to:

Dynamic Brain Lab

GlucoScanner

story:
What’s this all about?

Our team consists primarily of CIEE employees and a couple of their friends all of whom share a common goal: to run home from Bar Harbor to Portland, Maine and complete the totally crazy two-day relay race that is the 2017 Rock Lobster Relay. 10 of the 11 competitors completes three legs, of varying lengths, over the course of 36 non-stop hours, hopefully less.  The 11th competitor will run six legs of the race! We are all fully dedicated and making preparations physically, mentally, logistically and financially.  We knew from the beginning that coordinating a 36 hour, 200 mile race, down the coast of Maine would be a challenge. We have fully paid our race entrance fee but are seeking financial support for the other travel and logistical fees that are adding up. Vehicles, lodging, food, and gear are needed to ensure a successful run for all of us.

Who are we?

Our team represents CIEE staff from all across the company. Kerry Plath-Captain (Teach Abroad), Alan McLellan (IT), Chris McCoy (Study Abroad), Connor Shoos (Study Abroad), Moriah Maron (Study Abroad), Mike Moran (Registration), Annie Hooper (Camp USA), Zoe Romano (Enrollment), Adam Hallet and Ian Robbins (awesome friends who signed on to help us round out the eleven person team)

Why Rock Lobster Relay?

Aside from the personal challenge, the Rock Lobster Relay is supporting local nonprofits and businesses in the communities along the 200 mile racecourse.

For our team, it's truly a win win proposition. We can achieve our personal goals while helping so many outstanding organizations pay it forward. 

What do we need?

Raising an additional $1,500 would help us pay for: two large vans (that we will be eating, resting, and sleeping in when we aren’t running), lodging before the race, meals, snacks, drinks, lights and reflective vest. We are confident with your help our team will have a successful run!  Thank You!

Kerry Plath-Captain (Teach Abroad), Alan McLellan (IT), Chris McCoy (Study Abroad), Connor Shoos (Study Abroad), Moriah Maron (Study Abroad), Mike Moran (Registration), Annie Hooper (Camp USA), Zoe Romano (Enrollment), Adam Hallet and Ian Robbins (awesome friends who signed on to help us round out the eleven person team)Why Rock Lobster Relay?Aside from the personal challenge, the Rock Lobster Relay is supporting local nonprofits and businesses in the communities along the 200 mile racecourse.For our team, it's truly a win win proposition. We can achieve our personal goals while helping so many outstanding organizations pay it forward. What do we need?Raising an additional $1,500 would help us pay for: two large vans (that we will be eating, resting, and sleeping in when we aren’t running), lodging before the race, meals, snacks, drinks, lights and reflective vest. We are confident with your help our team will have a successful run!  Thank You!
